text: First time eating at this restaurant and it was an excellent experience. Coming from the Bay Area we are seasoned pakiindo food eaters. This food however is the best desi food we have ever tasted. The best part was seeing my pre teen kids enjoying the food. We ordered the wings, chicken tikka masala, chicken tandoori, chicken boti. I am coming again to Phoenix, just to eat here

My meat was dry again. When you order a drink, they give you a cup and point you to the coke machine, so service is not this place is style. Apache Blvd has become a middle eastern mecca of food, so they will have to shape up or ship out, since better and less expensive delights are all down the street.

Best chicken tikka masala, nice and spicy. I order the garlic naan. My husband gets the biryani  and he's always happy with it.  I used to eat inside but our last 4 visits my husband orders take out.  The owner's son (part owner?) is nice and helpful.

I like this place. It's close to campus for a good price and good portion sizes. I like their yummy Chicken Tikka Masala! They give you a good portion sizes. The other dishes were pretty good, samosas were ok, their curry is tasty and the food isn't that spicy. Super love their tikka masala fries. Yeah, I said tikka masala fries!   They're currently undergoing renovations to make the place a bit bigger and it's needed since it can get busy and full.

I have been going to this place frequently for the last 1 and half years and the food was great until recently.  The last few times I ordered take out food and I always find the curries highly diluted with water, samosas fried in old oil and their signature biriyani not flavorful at all.  The last time I ordered take out food from there, I even found a piece of meat in my veggie curry!!   Like others have mentioned, the service is poor, the place is highly understaffed and not so friendly staff either.  The place used to be known for its flavorful, cheap food but sadly the quality has degraded over the last few months...

Great food!  There was just the small problem of forgetting that my girlfriend and myself were sitting in the restaurant. After watching everyone else receive their food (after entering 30+ minutes after us) I decided to enter passive aggressive stare mode with the host.  My non verbal cues were apparently on point and we then received our food with a very brief explanation on how our food was sent to another table minus the apology.  I'd recommend curry corner as long as you don't care for service or an immediate appetite.

So, the other day my friend and I wanted to go and have Cantonese food down the street from this place, but they were closed for an ASU welcome back dinner; wack!! So, I scrammed to find a yummy place last minute on Yelp which was in the area, and Curry Corner popped up.  I am very happy that he and I went to this place after all. Since I am doing a physical and spiritual cleanse at this time and cannot eat meat, dairy, processed sugar, sweets, breads/white flour products, this place made me happy.   I had their veggie combination and was blown away by how well delectable they can make chic peas and spinach taste with their spices and techniques.   I am going back when I can eat meat and bread and will enjoy their fish/chicken dishes and supposedly amazing naan.  I am a fan!  Love, The East Coast Foodie

I took my parents here for Mother's Day. As a vegan myself I am always unsure in any restaurant but the staff here put my mind to ease and helped me find a few menu items I could eat. The daal tasted great with a nice spiciness to it, and I'm told the beef tikka masala was delicious too. Not only was the food great, the prices were too! Would most certainly recommend!!!

This is about as good a place I've found in a while. From the fluffy perfectly baked naans to the rich curries with cuts of meat that remind one of what meat is supposed to be like, I've enjoyed everything I've tried here. From what I could make out this is a smallish family-run place (with a warm friendliness to match), but it seems to be expanding a bit. The decor is simple, as is the service - you get your own drinks and order at the counter - but that stuff is unimportant. What is really important is the quality, and this place delivers in every way.  If you like (north) Indian food, you'll find yourself at home - the spices and preparations are similar, though perhaps a little richer, and the names are different. And based on the Indian places I've seen in Phoenix, this place is far superior. I particularly recommend the Beef Achari, which was the first thing I tried there; I do want to try a biryani and see how that it, so watch this space for updates.  In short, if you want an awesome dining experience on a very reasonable budget, this is one of the best places you'll find, I guarantee.

The best Indian/Pakistani Restaurant and one of the best in Phoenix, no doubt about it. One way this restaurant stands out is that it does not serve buffet atypical from other Indian places. So the food is made just for you. The lady who runs the place cooks most of the food and her passion exudes in her cooking. I usually order goat/lamb Karachi with Tawa paratha and hardly ever have I been disappointed and I have been eating here since 2013. Service is quick and quicker during lunch. Price is set for students and so 12 dollars will get you two meals worth of food. This restaurant would be a stand-out even in highly ethnic and diverse eatery locations such as Philadelphia and New York and I should know coz I am from there.

Curry Corner is an instant classic, an all around go-to for great food.   My wife and I had a date night last night, we were both were hungry for Indian cuisine and Curry Corner was on our minds. We had seen reviews and articles about the restaurant and couldn't wait to try. We did and we loved it!   Excellent food and service. I'm not sure I could have asked for anything more than what was delivered.
Everything on the menu is fantastic. Prices are reasonable. I don't eat this type of food much at all but I will now and Ill drive here to get it.

The food from Curry Corner is good but the service is pretty bad and their attitude is very racist... They treat the white Americans as Roman Gods and the people from the subcontinent and Mexico as the slaves... They will treat you as if they were your boss if you are anywhere from Asia... So if you are looking for quite tasty food (at somewhat higher but okay price) but bad behavior from the owners you are very welcome.

Any restaurant that can convince our 8-year old daughter that goat is her new favorite meat is serving really superb dishes. These folks are masterful in building complex and distinct flavors, some spicy and others mild, but all melt-in-your-mouth delicious. We drove 1200 miles from Portland, Oregon to visit family, knowing all the while we couldn't leave Phoenix before coming to eat here. We're so glad we did, and can't wait to come again.
I questioned ordering them at first but the Tika masala fries are great! I also almost always order the tandoori chicken because it is charred to perfection and never disappoints.
Awesome authentic Indian/Pakistani food.Very kind welcoming hosts, very affordable,do yourselves a favor and eat here!

I would have given this place a better review but the service is always so terrible. When you call up to order out they hang up immediately after taking the order without telling you how long it will take to make or even saying thank you or goodbye. If you eat in, there is always the same lone miserable looking server there who wants as little to do with the customer's happiness as possible.   Apart from that, the food is very tasty. I have had a variety of chicken curries and grilled chicken and they were all very tasty. Also good is the Aloo Gobi. The hummus and samosa are great too.

The staff is very rude and are always in a rush to get off the phone , I live in queen creek and I drive about 35 min to get to Tempe and il always order more than $70 , and top it off anytime I ask the gentleman to make sure food is sealed and rapped he always gives me an attitude as if I'm irrelevant , I understand that the food is decent but doesn't mean you get to treat your customers  in a poor manner, this is the not first time this has happened and not the first time I have had a interaction with this individual . I think it has come to a point where I will fine another place to eat ...... so sad the owner is a nice lady but this guy is ruining there business ,

Food is great but their servers are often rude and poorly trained. From soggy old masala fries, cold shoulder treatment, to being handed the menus at the door with a "can you do me a favor and take this with you."   If the food was not so good they would have closed shop years ago. As competition grows from copper kettle next door, service must dramatically improve or customers will be fed up.

This place not the best looking inside, but the food is awesome and authentic! The service can be a little slow because it is almost always very crowded, but the waits aren't unbearable. I had the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Garlic Naan. My boyfriend had another chicken dish with rice. It was flavorful but the Naan was the best part. If you like spicy food make sure to ask for it though! They keep it non-spicy unless you ask because there's a lot of wimpy white people who complain about it being too hot otherwise lol!
So good. It can get pretty busy. My favorite thing to do is to just order a bunch of dishes to go since I can get a little crowded in there sometimes. The naan and the chicken marsala is so yummy.

Fast and friendly. Awesome soft garlic naan. I had the goat karahi and it was delicious. Looked like mom was in charge in the kitchen too. A lot of local indians dining in as well. A good sign. Big ole cup of steaming chai too. I'm hooked. Decore sucks but who cares? It's all about the food. I will return despite the 20 minute bus ride from my hotel.

I have been eating here for more than a year now since i moved to AZ , had couple of incidents with them where they gave me the wrong order or my order will be missing sth , i told them about it and they didn't do anything about it This time i ordered the mixed grill, yummy stuff, but it wasn't cooked right, the chicken was raw   I gave up on this place  I don't recommend this place for customers who are looking for consistency in food and service
Bland food. Serving bad. The guy serving was so irritated when asked for refills. Bad customer service.
First time I went with an indian couple and the felt that it was the best Indian food they had outside of India. It was delish... cant recomend the mixed tandoori enough.
They have the best rice! I love their curry! I like rice.

I went to this restaurant for the first time with my SO last Tuesday(Mar 17th). When we walked in, there were a bunch of people standing awkwardly in the door and then someone came by to seat us. The table was dirty, so the man quickly wiped it, but there were still crumbs all over it. It took about 10 minutes just to get drinks(a water and a coke). I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and it was trashed. While waiting for food, the phone kept ringing loudly for several minutes with no one answering it.            I got the Aloo Tikki first after about 15 minutes. It had small black specs and crumbles on it, which I wiped off. The favor was decent. The outside of the patties was luke warm, but the inside was definitely cold. The Palak paneer was decent flavor wise as well, but it only had 4 paneer cubes in the whole dish. My SO got the chicken and rice. The flavor of the chicken was really good but I got a gangly piece was was turned off from eating more chicken. I'm not sure what is used to flavor the rice, since after a few bites I couldn't justify taking the rest home(which I am very much against throwing food away if I can help it). I enjoy trying new foods, so I am used to ethnic flavors, but something wasn't right about the chicken and rice.          My SO and I did agree that the Naan was really good. Unfortunately, I don't think that is enough for a sit down return (maybe just take out for the naan). I was so disappointed with this experience, since I was expecting it really good based on reviews and the pretty attractive pictures on the website.

Food is good.  Funny they have tvs in the restaurant with it on the food network and when I was there Curry Corner was on Diner Dives and drive-ins.  I have since been there many times and tried more then just the chicken.  The tilki massala fries are so good mmm I am getting hungry right now.

I had been meaning to try this for a long time and finally made it in! I am not at all familiar with Indian/Pakistani food so I can't remember what I had, but it was delicious! A friend got the masala fries which were to die for.

I know a lot of people who love this place, but I don't get it.  They are going to be featured on the food network as having the beset chicken tikka masala.  I ordered this twice (thinking maybe the first time it was an off day) but it was horrible each time.  Not tender or tasty.   The goat tastes like lamb and has that grassy taste.  And the Nan's are served on these plastic trays, where they don't change the foil between customers!   Bathroom is filthy.  Lots of college students eat here, and it is in walking distance of ASU's campus.  It's not even that cheap.    I must be missing something, because I do not recommend this place.
Had their chicken biryani today, the chicken was not cooked properly at all. I am already sick. Always had good experience but I think they should change their cooking quality. Highly disappointed!

Its good , midrange , indian/Pakistani restaurant. If you haven't tried this cosine before then its extra plus for trying without spending a small fortune. Ask for the Garlic Naan = garlic bread , as long you don't plan in kissing someone for the next few hours.
Love this place. Simple cheap food though sometimes the service can be a little slow. I definitely go back any time I crave some good India food.

Ive never been a huge fan of indian food. This place may have changed my mind. Dont be fooled by the location its alot nicer on the inside then it appears from the parking lot. The staff was really nice and the pricing was very reasonable. 4 entrees and 2 appetizers for 40 bucks. Ill be back for sure.

The service is extremely poor. No one to receive the customers. I waited for nearly 10 minutes for nothing on my table for nothing. No one to take order or even provide water.  Had to walk out. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE SERVICE.

Like the food here. It has that "home cooked.. by mom"  taste. Their non veg thali is the best and so is the biriyani. I gave a star less for this place for 2 reasons... they do not know how to season the food.. too little salt and the guys attending you could be rude and intimidating. They could learn how to treat customers well. But if you think only about food..its a good place.

The food is fantastic and reasonably priced. I've been going here when they were in their super small location. My only con is the service. Their water isn't filtered. They don't have enough staff members to handle all their business, both phone orders and dining room.   If you are going to come, just go in knowing that you will be in for a long wait (1.5 to 2 hours) and relax with whoever you'll be going with. This goes for takeout too, I've seen people wait for awhile for their food.  That said, I highly recommend their hummus appetizer, best hummus I've ever had. I love all their Thali plates. Their masala is so yummy. I've had it with chicken and fish, and I really love it with fish.   In the end it is worth the wait, but if the service could tighten up it would be such a better atmosphere. Such a shame to sit there listening to new people gripe about the wait and then shut up once it finally comes stuffing their face.  Oh well!

Curry Corner is a Tempe Gem. Tucked away in a little strip right off of the light rail, the ambiance is cozy and lovely. I love the Chicken Tikka Masala, Biranyi and Naan. Fresh, perfect level of spiciness and flavor. We are excited to continue making our way through the entire menu.

Okay.  This review will lack details on my end.   I must have been mentally exhausted that day to not to have retained many specifics.  My g/f and I wanted lunch near our office and had seen Curry Corner but neither of us had ever been before.   It was suspect from the outside but I've learned never to judge a book by its cover. We arrived way before the lunch crowd so the place was empty when we entered.  The decor was okay (sorry didn't really pay much attention) from what I remember.  We decided on a booth since all the spots were open.    On to my next lack of detail.  I don't remember the name of the entree that I ordered.  But I ordered it since it was the closest thing to saag paneer that I could find.  I was not disappointed.  (My younger self would be amazed that I would ever look forward and enjoy eating something that looked that questionable, if you know what I mean).  It was absolutely delicious!! I also ordered a potato naan (guess I really wanted carbs that day) and was also very good.   The service was good.  And by the time we finished our lunch the place was totally full.  The dish my g/f ordered was not what she had visualized but she said it was absolutely delish.    Since it's very close to our job, we will keep this place in mind when venturing out for lunch.
Very good food. Affordable and casual. Very helpful advise with the menu. We will be back
The best Indian food I have EVER had! I will definitely go there again and try more dishes. I believe it will not let you down.

As a foodie and lover of tasty spicy (cause spicy bland exists) food, Curry Corner has to rank as one of my favorite places to eat, simply for the quality of the food. Can't believe it took me so long to find this place! The Lamb Karahi with extra chili is by far my favorite dish.

The mutter paneer was good. It was not the best I have ever had but good. I like this place, the prices are reasonable, the food is tasty and the people are nice. The naan that came with the meal was ok, next time I will have to order garlic naan. I will be back for sure.

First visit at Curry Corner four different dishes lamb- chicken naan it was  As advertised fabulous  the only way a really Resturant review can b written is by eating at the Curry Corner   Competition resturants Dont write reviews work at ur own place make ur food better Thank u Curry Corner Manno

The food is really good. We like their food but the waiting time is too long and it kills the pleasure. People come later than us finish sooner. Twenty minutes is ok but we waited for over forty minutes. The last plate was not here after a whole hour so we had to cancel it.
Chicken in the Tikka Massala was dark meat which I don't care for. It was a bit grissly. Taste was fair and naan was fair also

I took some friends here tonight after regrettably not making reservations at the dhaba, which we love.   This was by far the worst Indian food we have ever had.  We have had take out here once before that wasn't great but tolerable.  Tonight our samosas were cold in the middle and the Palak paneer and aloo paneer tasted like tomato paste and peas with no spice.   The chole dish I had was ok, but my friends food came out nearly 30 minutes after mine and it was awful.  We also didn't get our garlic naan until almost the end of the meal and it was flavorless.  They did apologize for the food and the "new" cook and did end up comping our meal, kudos to them for that.   But we did leave hungry and disappointed.  Definitely will not be returning.  Next time will be sure to make reservations in time at The Dhaba!

Nice affordable place for students. Liked their chicken delicacies. The vegetarian food is OK, little bland actually. But the chicken is good, especially the biryani.  Also their simple dal tadka is a staple for when you don't wanna cook much. Just get this as a to go and cook some plain rice! Simple yet sumptuous, and easy on the students' pocket! PS. Tikka masala fries is the underdog here!
Really excellent food, large portions, and a solid price.  Some of the best chicken tikka masla I've ever had.  I'll definitely be going back
Excellent. Had the chicken tikki, great! If you like Indian food, you have to go here!
Cheap. Delicious. The chicken tikka masala is top notch, the take out is super convenient and fast. Samosas are fantastic. Definitely worth going to if you're a fan of Indian food.

Went to this restaurant after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.  It definitely was a dive.  Our host was blowing his nose in a tissue very often.  Doubt he washed his hands.  Our curry goat had a hair in it.  The samosas were cold in the middle.  They did apologize,  but still had item on bill.  I will not go there again.  Beware false advertising.  Although to be fair I didn't give the food real chance.  It was hard for me to stomach.  My wife enjoyed the tandoori chicken.

I had high expectations for this restaurant after reading all the great reviews on Yelp and it did not disappoint. My friends and I were a bit apprehensive because we are not exactly Indian food connoisseurs but the server helped us order our dishes and we were very pleased with what we got. All the curry was delicious and it had the perfect amount of spice to it, just enough to make you reach for the water but not too much that you lose the taste of the food. The naan was delicious and the portions were perfect for sharing with the whole party. I think we had the chicken makhani, chicken tikka masala, one of their goat specials, and the vegetarian thali plate which was a big sample plate of a bunch of different foods. Oh and it doesn't get better than only paying around $8 per person and being so full you can barely move. Let's just say I am jealous of everyone at ASU who can frequent this restaurant on a regular basis.

People don't go to this Resturant. Beware!! Most dishonest owner and workers I have ever seen. Food had hairs in them. Insisted refund one person named Sakib (cashier) said he will refund the money but I need to speak with the owner. Owner is a lady by the name Biren or Viren evaded (hang up)my calls when I reached her over the phone. Sheer lie and deception. Some other worker answered the next call, said the owner had left the store. Terrible experience, will report to BBB for unsanitary food handling and deceptive tactic
If you want good service and a dining "experience", don't go here.  If you want to taste deliciously balanced Pakistani/Indian food, go here...now.  Oh, and you can byob. Liquor store on the corner.
The food here was phenomenal and I loved the tikka masala fries. The Paneer masala and garlic naans were so tasty.   It's a small place and the service was good..

Went to eat there and had a craving for it but was completely disappointed. The food was cold and the flavors were tasteless. the food was 2 days old and was not fresh. We got sick  the next day. Loved it in the past and always referred it to many of our friends. will not return.

I go to this place regularly. Even witnessed it take the turn to fame before it was anything at all.  Any who,  if the store owners truly do read this, please know that chicken Tikka massala is supposed to be made by using chicken breasts! Not thighs or whatever part of the chicken you put in there. Every time I make that order I get  many uncooked chicken pieces in my meal and it's an appetite killer I tell ya. Please make the effort to satisfy this long time customer by handing me well-cooked chicken, chicken cooked all the way through... That type of chicken,  like chicken breasts, would go fantastic with the brilliant masalla sauce.
Menu is extensive. Food was YUM.  The place was packed, so it took a bit for the food to come out, but it was definitely worth the wait!

I'm becoming a regular here. after hearing so any different people recommend this strip mall curry joint, I had to try it, just to stop the looks of surprise that I had not been. food was excellent. cute interior. professional staff. charging for naan makes me sad, but worth it. now I find myself considering this a default option when considering where to eat. highly recommend.

Straight to the point their food is delicious and deserves 4 stars, but their service is awful/ disappointing. I honestly even wish their food wasn't so good. I've come in on multiple occasions and the waiter/waitresses have been so rude. On one occasion when I asked for water while I waited for my to-go the waitress with a lot of makeup on was talking badly about me in spanish. Awkward considering I understand/speak Spanish. It was to the point where I felt uncomfortable eating there. Service is slow and it's to the point where I feel I need to write this review.

The smells coming out of here are great; overall it was a good experience albeit it for a bittersweet goodbye dinner to friends.   We started with the tikka fries; while I wouldn't choose them over chili cheese fries they are a nice change if pace. I was also amazed at how the fries stayed crispy while being slathered in sauce.   I had the goat haleem, purely out of curiosity and a desire to try the most widely consumed meat in the wold. It is a type of lentil and goat pur√©ed soup served rice. While it was delicious, I would have preferred more actual meat as opposed to the few pieces I got.   Naan was also good but I don't know that I have ever had bad naan.

After reading all the reviews a few of us at work decided to give this place a try.  We like spicy food and asked the waitress to give us the spiciest version of chicken tikka masala available.  What they gave us was clearly from their premade pot in the back with some chili flakes on top.  The flavor itself was bland, and the spicy flakes made no difference.  None of us came close to finishing our meals.  Terrible.

I have been going to Curry Corner since it was a small joint near the campus.  They have come a long way. Easily the best Indian/Pakistani/Middle-Eastern food in the Phoenix area. Very friendly staff and excellent service. Their grilled items are a must-try!

Been sitting here for 5 mins. No one came to us, I had to call the waiter to take our order. Within that a family of 3  just walked out after no one came to take their order. Terrible service. Very slow. The kitchen staff is so loud. They were screaming making us not concentrate on our conversation I was having with my family. The food was okay. Water was just nasty. Beware don't order there water! Last time we are coming here.  Came here thinking Guy came here, wanted to give it a shot but no way.

Been here a couple of times, and it's a pretty good place. Good food, reasonable prices. Their customer service is alright and varies from day to day, once we came in at night and the customer service was pretty bad, but at other times it was good...should be consistent.

I have been looking for an entire year for good Paki/Indian places to eat in the valley but this place is my new favorite place where I'll be driving 40min to eat good home made food. Let me tell you..it's even better than food you will have in Pakistan. Mixed grill and korma masala was amazing. I had 2 mango lassi's in one setting including the best chai. I say the wait is long but the food is worth it. Going back there again very soon....everyone who likes indo/Paki food should go to this place and forget places like Tandoori Times, India Best or even Bombay Spice.

I left an earlier review about an experience I had in April of 2016 and how their service was horrible and had declined in the past couple of years. I hesitantly went back tonight because my sister was dying for some home (Pakistani) food and this is the only good place in town.  I was surprised by how much the service has improved. They've hired a new girl there who definitely understands customer service, some of the previous employees seem to be much better as well. I dont know if it was just by chance, but the owner was there taking orders as well, I havent seen that since 2013, but maybe thats because my visits have declined since then. Either way it seems the owner is really involved now, the service is much better than before. Our food came in under 15 minutes or so, though I noticed some tables waited quite a while, still not a problem. Final words, food is as great as it used to be, my stomach was more than satisfied and finally after a couple of years I was satisfied and happy to have gone there, and didnt feel like I was bothering them with my presence.   Only reason I didnt give it a 5 star was because I just want to make sure its like this the next time I go in and that it wasnt just a fluke, also there was a huge water leak on one side of our table from the ceiling which I thought was actually funny more than it was annoying lol. I think the recent negative yelp reviews have gotten them to straighten up, or maybe they've done it on their own. Definitely recommend that you go here for Pakistani/Indian cuisine.

I have been to this restaurant numerous times and have always been fully satisfied from every aspect, taste, quantity, service and money. It is truly the biggest bang for the buck. The grilled menu, like the malai chicken, mixed grill, chicken tikka and chick boti are the best. In addition, their chicken biryani delivers a great taste to their rice menu. Tikka masala fries are something I have never heard of before until I tasted it at curry corner. It was amazing. I think this is something that they innovated. A glass of mango lussi (sweet mango yogurt shake) closes the deal.   Highly recommended.

Yum,yum,yum! The hummus is wonderful and served with naan (any flavor you want) I have been there four times and each time was five star. Chicken tandoori is very tender and tasteful. Even the goat and lamb was superb. We were treated like kings & queens even though they were super busy. The parking is good once you maneuver around Apache blvd. God love the rail! I highly recommend it if you love indian/pakistani food. I have yet to try the deserts, always too full.

My husband and I visited Curry Corner last weekend and were extremely disappointed. We often eat curry and have been to numerous Indian and Pakistani restaurants throughout the US and overseas and Curry Corner was by far the worst restaurant we've ever dined at. The food is mediocre at best and the service is extremely slow. We spent over 2 hours  there and the majority of the time was spent waiting for our food. It took more than 10 minutes for the waiter to bring water! Not to mention we waited more than 45 minutes for our halwa to be brought to us (which by the way was pre-made and only had to be microwaved).   While we were there we observed a family of 4 walk out and leave before their food had a chance to arrive. Additionally, we overheard a customer complain about the food, which was apparently so bad she wasn't even willing to try another item on the menu and wanted to pay and leave.   If you prefer to spend your money at an establishment with poor food, below average service and questionable cleanliness then Curry Corner is probably the place for you. I personally will not be returning to this establishment and will caution friends and associates against it.
Friendly Service and GREAT food.  The hummus and naan are awesome!  Such big portions on our entrees as well.
Good yummy food. We had chicken jalfrezi, hickey makhani, and paneer achari. Mango lassi was yum as usual. Paneer tikka may have been better choice than achari. Achari was good but had thin gravy.

I tried this place with a friend by accident today since there was a long wait for my fave Indian/pakastani resturant just down the street. At first the place seems like it may be a little dissappointing from it's fast food appearance (maybe it was because you have to order your food at the window?)     Don't let the appearance fool you the food is great! The Naan isn't the best i ever had but was good and the meal was excellent. prepare for SPICEY though. They don't skimp on spice for sure and they don't cook it to taste like some resturants I've been to. I loved it though and would definitly go back. The price is right too. Expect to pay abt $11 a person that's including your drink.

My boyfriend and I have eaten here twice and have loved it both times. I got the punjabi lamb handi and omg its amazing. The meat is so incredibly tender it just falls apart. The people were also really friendly and helpful. We never had Indian food before and our server made excellent suggestions and was very knowledgeable about the menu. We both loved the food and the service was good. The prices are very reasonable and our food came out pretty fast. We plan on bringing friends here and im pretty sure we are going to be regulars.

My workgroup came here for dinner. Standard hole in the wall decor. We found prices to be reasonable, our portions were way too much for one person. The chicken tikka wings were awesome, they also had tikka masala fries, something different unique never had it before but still tasted american flavor so didn't go well with the rest of the food. Also had nehari, lamb curry, and chicken handi, all good but nothing special.

This has to be the best Indian food I have ever had in my life! My husband said the same thing. Everything we had was just amazing and so flavorful and the prices are great!    We had the Fish Curry, Non veg tali (sp?) with this chickpea dish the waitress recommended, A mango lassi, and garlic naan. Everything was out of this world! So good! There was a curry that was on the tali plate that I had never heard of and it was one of the best things I have ever eaten. The waitress told me the name, but I can't remember. She said it was a buttery flavored curry. The fish curry was excellent, the naan was the best I've ever had. And the lassi was good and sweet.

Have been going to this place for nearly 7 years now..the food is good...this review is not about the quality/taste of the food this is more about their terrible service.  I was charged 30%!!!of my final bill as a reservation fee for reserving a table for 6 for Friday evening( we showed up before time). Like I said, we are regulars at this place and this was the first time in 7 years I was hearing about this reservation fee. Moreover, the guy(looks Mexican but could be Midle eastern) who rudely and very firmly told me about this reservation fee acted like a total jerk!!...dude you are supposed to  provide customer service and be polite....you don't work for the IRS!! I asked for a high chair for my  daughter and the same guy simply showed me the place where it is kept..as if..go get it from there..seriously!!! I have known the faimly running this place for past several years..very nice people..I  hope they are reading this review. Please make your policy clear about the reservation fee..and please give some training to your staff to be polite and to actually provide customer service.

Was in the Tempe area and visited CC to try out their Guy Fieri recommended tandoori chicken. The restaurant welcome us at the door with an immediate aroma and we found the last available table for two even at 3pm on a Saturday.  In between college kids and a sprinkling of Indian patrons, the first thing to visually be distracted by are the loud TVs set to the food network but a lively atmosphere regardless.  As today was yet another fiery day in the desert, the owners decided to let us sweat some more by having on a half working AC (a huuuge gripe for me on summer days) and not enough fans.  As we have a pretty high bar for Indian cuisine, the tandoori chicken was indeed moist and charbroiled well. You get two chicken legs per order along with a side of naan or rice. Hubby went for the tikka masala but he was surprised that there was no question of the preferred heat level by our waitress. It turned out a mild variation of what he's used to and a bit lacking in depth of spices.   Their naan was more on the thin crispy side so by my standards a 3 star effort at best. And if you're not a huge coriander lover, definitely ask for the curry sans the pungent leafy condiment as CC does tend to overindulge. Hubby's side was the saffron infused rice which was al dente and a good texture.  We probably won't make a special trip out just for dinner but both our meals summed up to definitely less than one dish at our regular spot in north scottsdale, so those on college budgets should continue to feel comfortable with CC being their go to Tempe curry joint!
Best goat biriyani in AZ. Bad service.

Super tasty, love the cozy atmosphere, excellent and friendly service!  The naan was a bit thinner and crispier than some others, which I really dug.  We had a goat dish that was outstanding.  Nicely spiced.  Also had the non-vegetarian thali - two chicken curries (one with a bit of sour pickle taste that was very nice), daal, basmati rice and a little salad.  Quite inexpensive.  And I like the less-thick lassi with ice.

Passing by Phoenix area.  Looked up Guy Fieri's website and found this restaurant. WOW! Excellent food and courteous service. We ordered tikki masala, tandoori chicken, seafood bowl, Sindhi lamb,and mango lassi. The food was flavorful and equisite!

Terrible terrible terrible service.....please save yourself some time, pride and money...specially if you are an asian. The skinny weirdo who takes your order does not have any courtesy whatsoever...no hello..no smile...no thank you nothing!! I felt so weird and so little while standing in their cramped and filthy restaurant with my wife for at least 15minutes without being welcomed or even asked to sit down. Finally, the owner lady asked us to sit down with such an attitude as if she is doing a huge favor to us.The lady would talk so nicely about the food and stuff to our non asian neighbors but would never bother coming to us to take our order or even to hand us the menu(btw this has happened to us twice on separate occasions) Wow lady!!..were we not paying or what?? This is not the racist land where you came from and we are not college students who would not react to this kind of mean and rude service. The water took 20 minutes to arrive...don't even wanna talk about the other female server...she is just going through her shift. I grew up eating this kind of food so you can take it from me, seriously it's not that great..they use chicken thigh meat in all curries which is not always a good thing...portions sizes are ridiculously small...nothing interesting really...there are much better and courteous places around. I seriously hope that their "Guy Fiery" bubble bursts soon. I am not going back again at any cost...and would highly recommend all of you to stay away..specially if you are an asian.

This place is AMAZING. Very good prices, exceptional service, even better food! They are renovating right now so don't let the decor steer you away. The food is full of flavor and just the right portions. The naan was fluffy and delicious. I would eat there every day if my waistline would allow it! :)
AWESOME garlic naan. Bubbly, buttery goodness. Entrees were fantastic. Service was prompt and friendly! Prices were nice and low. Could use some updated decor.

The food is OK, but ASK FOR AN ITEMIZED RECEIPT. They overcharged me, my sister, and a friend on 3 separate occasions. Their explanation was that the prices went up but they hadn't had time to update the menu... but it has been months since the first time I was over charged. I will not give business to dishonest people.

Excellent Indian food. I get the Chicken Tikki masala. Great naan. We go with garlic naan. I've had their mango lassi, it's delicious. No buffet, you order off the menu so everything comes out nice and fresh... And delicious. Definitely recommend. Give it a try. Central location and ambient parking.

Vegetable briyani. Yummy.  They inspired me so much i tried out how to make one and i got ot. Yay . Tried paneer tikka masala. Super. I like spicy food and i got it. Hara bhara paneer, new dish for me it was nice. Naan is bit hard everytime i try here.  Dont know why. Kheer was nice. Have vegetarian options as well.
Met some friends with my Family.  Everything was very good except for a young server who could not be bothered.  Owner was really nice and helpful with the menu.

I rate keeping the price in mind. It's all relative.   Food: 4.5/5 The owner runs the kitchen which ensures consistency and the food is very tasty. I   Service: 2.5/5 The service isn't bad but it can be very slow at times since they're severely understaffed. It's great for lunch. There are a lot of customers during the evening (which says a lot about the food = good) but that over burdens the two servers and they take while to attend to your needs. BUT it's not that big a deal.  General Cleanliness 4/5  Bathroom cleanliness 4/5

Went there with a friend for lunch, it was good! I The place is cute,  not so small people commented as long as it isn't fill up with people. The butter chick Marsala is so good and Mango Lassi is my favorite! Waitress is very helpful as well, she is enthusiasm on recommending us some great food and happy to bring some Lassi favor to see if we like it first. Definitely come next time!

The curry had a beautifully complex flavor that was unfortunately diminished by overpowering amounts of salt. The phone rang loudly and frequently in the dining area and was a bit of a nuisance.   Otherwise the chicken tikka is an excellent choice and the curries, despite the salt, have much more body than comparably curries I have had locally.

Best Indian restaurant in Tempe for reasonably priced and great food. It's located in an eyesore plaza and is desiring a face lift inside but that being said, the food is Amazeballs! Try the chicken tikka masala :D

I would say the tikki masala was not the best Indian dish I have eaten, but it was fair. The service was lacking and the interior of the restaurant needed updating. It was a expensive dish for a positive note.

Have you been looking for mouth watering ethnic Pakistani food at an inexpensive price?  We didn't know we were looking for it either, until we ended up at Curry Corner last night.  Upon the recommendation of one of our kind followers we headed over to this suspicious looking restaurant for some spectacular food.  We got there pretty close to closing time but the service was still exceptional and they made us feel welcomed and helped us to choose the three dishes.  Most people might know that Guy Fieri showcased this spot on his show but we were unaware until the waiter mentioned it.  He proceeded to recommend the top three dishes that were ordered and enjoyed by Guy, all three of which we dined on as well.  The Tikka Masala was like a party of flavors in my mouth.  The heat from the spices wasn't overpowering but nice and welcoming.  The chicken was moist and there was tons of sauce, perfect for dipping the naan in to.  Processed with VSCOcam with f2 presetNext we dug into the fresh Goat Karahi, our first time eating goat and it was easily likeable.  I did feel that there were more bones in this dish than meat, which was too bad because the meat and the flavors of ginger, garlic and yogurt were delicious.  To take home (because we were enjoying the food so much) we ordered the Tandoori Chicken Tikka.  The chicken was cooked perfectly and the sauce that came with it was a great combination.  Corner to try out some more dishes and to eat the Tikka Masala and naan again.

My Indian friend suggested I go and try their goat biryani and mango lhassi. I have to say the portions are huge! It tasted really good and you could tell that they used good quality basmati rice. I couldn't finish half of what was in my plate. The mango lhassi was really refreshing and sweet! loved it! the only issue i have with this place is the service! really horrible. we came around 12 noon and there were very few customers there. but oh my! the waitress was super slow, it took 15 minutes to get the lhassi. And get this--- she doesn't even offer you a straw as she serves you with it. You would have to go get the straw from their counter. I don't get that..  I mean she is already serving the drink, why wouldn't she serve the straw as well. The only redeeming thing is that their price is super cheap for the amount and quality of the food that you get. I will come back some other day and i hope that the service gets better!

This place has such delicious food and I have never had a bad experience there. The cheese naan is out of this world good - it is light and flavorful and just the right combination of crispy outside and soft inside. I love that there are so many meatless options.   The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because every time I go, the water is constantly running in the women's bathroom. It never shuts off, and that bothers me. I hate wasting resources and for the water to ALWAYS run - that is a bit excessive to me  please fix your sink so I can update this review and change the rating to 5 stars!! Thank you!!

Although I am as white as 2% milk, I grew up frequently eating at the house of an Indian family.  I have mentioned to many people as I have tried many restaurants that I am always trying to find "Mrs Singh".  A couple friends and I made it there for lunch today.  There's no ambience, but the food is delicious.  We shared three dishes for a variety of meat and vegetable and it was more than enough.  I like hot but got medium for my friends and we were all happy.

I have to admit--we were here from another state and picked this place because it was on DDD!    I am SO glad we did. We had an amazing meal and it was extremely affordable. We couldn't decide which appetizers to get, so we got three!  The samosas were great, but the real star was the masala fries.   I can't remember the names of our dishes, but we asked the waitress what to get. She recommended two chicken dishes. One was a coconut curry and the other was buttery garlic. They were both some of the best dishes I've had.  There was plenty of food--we couldn't even finish.   I highly recommend this place if you're looking for delicious curry and at a great price!

Service was slow and terrible. I asked for suggestions on what to order and the waiter couldn't explain anything and seemed to have an attitude whenever we asked questions about the menu. Food was ok but wait time was bad! It took 30 minutes before anyone was able to get us drinks. They need more help there as well, the phone was ringing off the hook and the guy working there had no urgency whatsoever.

I love Curry Corner, it's got the best Indian and Pakistani food in Tempe. A lot of my Pakistani friends and Indian friends all recommend it. After going for a couple of years, I was glad to see they had expanded the place and got some publicity with Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. Their Chicken Makhani and briyani is so good and their garlic naan can be eaten on its own. Definitely a great place to go!

Came on 7/23/2014 with a group of 10 - service was awful and the food was worse - the only saving grace was that the prices are cheap - and I suppose that's because you get what you pay for!  I ordered the tandoori wings and a side of nan - I never got the nan - it was delivered to the other end of the table and I never saw any of that. Everyone else got their orders but me - I waited 10 more - long - minutes before my 8 little tandoori wings arrived, only to find that they were dried out and so hot with curry that I could only eat one. I was extremely dissappointed to say the least.  My daughter who had her 6 week old baby with her - asked for a small bowl of hot water to place the baby's bottle in (to warm up the milk) - and was told by our server that "they don't have hot water here".... Seriously? You're a freakin RESTUARANT and you DON'T HAVE HOT WATER? Finally, after realizing what a pathetic boob he was making himself look like, our waiter brought a small teacup full of warm water to our table.  Aaaaaaaaaaaaaand to top things off for our excursion to a Triple D rated establishment - ALL TEN OF OUR PARTY GOT SICK FROM THE FOOD WE ATE AT THE CURRY CORNER!!! Maybe they should change their name to the "Colitis Corner" - cramps, nausea & vomitting - I lost a day of work due to the food I ate made it impossible for me to go to my job.  This is the seond time I've gone to an establishment that had the old "As Seen on Diners, Drive ins and Dives" - Curry Colitis Corner is DEFINATELY A DIVE !!! Be afraid - BE VERY AFRAID !!!!!!!!!!!!

Was looking forward to eating here, food was okay, not the best. This place is overrated. Only good thing is the tikka masala fries! My food was cold when I got it! Our waiter KELLY was the best, until his shift ended and we ended up with a rude waiter who didn't even pay attention to us! Asked for drink refill and boxes many times before we got them, and it wasn't that busy! Maybe I would've given this place another star if Kelly remained our waiter, because it seems like he's the only one with good customer service!

We decided as a family to rate this place food and service, because we felt that one overall rating wouldn't work. The food was flavorful but not all of it was amazing. The tandoori wings were so tasty, the hummus was the best we have probably ever had and the lamb tikka malsala was a definite favorite along with the naan bread. Other items were a bit to salty but over all the food was good. Food we gave a rating of 7 out of 10.  Unfortunately the front of the house is where this place needs the most work. Items that were ordered were missing, which may have been the result of the to servers taking our orders. Place could use a good scrub down and some kind of gnat spray. We had to ask for water refills, only to be refilled by what we assumed to be timid tap water. Servers more interested in the grub hub drivers that came in then the actual patrons siting in the restaurant. Unfortunately the service rating from us was a 4.  Maybe better to get food to go next time.

UPDATE:  Looks like the health department can confirm my personal experience.  5 negative findings on their most recent inspection (http://phoenix.about.com/library/blrestinspectbad0613.htm). Meanwhile, the owners keep messaging me to get me to delete my review.  Oh Curry Corner.  I loved you since the day I met you.  Your takeout orders were usually wrong.  But I forgave you, for each time I came inside, my food was just right.  I was wierded out by your self-service beverages, and your water always tasted so awful that I drank tea or soda.  I figured it was a ploy to sell drinks, and I was OK with that, because your food was so cheap and so delicious.  I was excited to come in last week to find Guy Fieri's visit (can't stand the dude...wtf is with his hair...SERIOUSLY) prompted a major renovation.  Gone were the mostly disgusting and crappy booths near the kitchen.  Hardly an improvement to remove booths and replace with tables and chairs, but this was.  They cleaned it up. And it looked great!  Well, I was pumped that my friend, who is mostly an Indian food virgin, enjoyed this place and his first foray to the cuisine.  So much so, that (well, until he reads this review) I couldn't bear to tell him what I saw when we checked out.  A roach.  Not a dead one.  One still clinging to it's life.  Legs in the air like he just didn't care.  I immediately bugged (ha!) my friend who had originally turned me on to the place to tell him my woeful tale of a roach at Curry Corner.  OH, he said?  I saw one the last time I was there, but I assumed it was just a fluke.  No.  It was not.  And no thanks, CC.  I'm over you.

This place is great! Love the chicken tikka masala and the naan (love the garlic)-- this place singlehandedly put the word naan in our kids vocabulary. They clamor for it each time we are there. Also the prices are fantastic!

Saw the place on Diners Drive ins & Dives. I can usually tell when the host genuinely likes a restaurant. I got the vibe he was really feeling this place, I wasn't wrong. It's the real deal. The Goat Karai is in the top 5 dishes I've EVER had. I mean, it's off the charts. We tried about 5 different dishes and EVERY dish was www.bomb.com. If you're looking for a "high end" place to eat, this isn't it. It's a college dive that's frequented by students. It's a well taken care of place that delivers on quality food, period. If you want a great meal, this is it. My only complaint, the water is horrible. It's awful. We had to purchase their bottled water. It would make sense to add some sort of filtration system to their water supply. But they get to sell bottled water because of the awful tap water, so from a business standpoint, I get it.
Best indian food in AZ. Get the chicken tikka fries. Very affordable. Inexpensive excellence.
Outstanding!! Tikka Masala, Curry Chicken, Tandoori Chicken, Pakoros, naan. All to die for.  I just left and am trying to figure out what night I can go back. Amazing and flavorful to the max!

Seating:  Confusing; the table set up is strange and it's unclear if you should seat yourself or wait to be seated.  They left the table dirty that was next to us the whole time we were there, and it was actually connected to our table.  Drinks:  My wife's mango lassi was completely forgotten (thankfully we weren't charged), and my water was never refilled even though it was empty before I got my main dish.  Food:  Overall very good; bold flavors, great textures, and the prices are extremely reasonable for what you're getting.  Service:  This is the doozy.  The server was cold, inattentive, distracted, and careless.  At one point while we were eating we saw a few people walk in and then stand there awkwardly because they were not greeted.  Our server peeked his head out, saw them, and then continued talking to someone in the back.  It blew my mind.  The young girl who brought us our food seemed nice though, and was the only pleasant encounter we had while we were there.  Honestly, my wife and I are both caucasian, and I wouldn't even mention this if I didn't feel like it was part of the reason why they treated us like we weren't even there.  Overall:  A restaurant can serve the best food in the world, but if the service is as bad as what we experienced tonight, it just wouldn't be worth it to go back.  We'll consider ordering takeout, but that's it.  We truly felt unwelcome there from the time we walked in to the time we walked out.

The food was nice, they seemed to be short on staff but it didn't reflected in service.  Tikka masala fries was a gr8 starter, never had fries in indian style. The chicken curry was nice and naan were also good. Overall a nice place to visit, you wont be disappointed.

Food is on par and amazing but the service leaves something to be desired. The staff is not rude but generally a little inattentive. The atmosphere is that of a dive location but the last time I went it looked like they had done some modest remodeling.  I am ok that the service isn't stellar because I really enjoy the food.  The Goat is amazing!!!  Favorite Indian/Pakistani food around just go with little expectation for the service and ambience and you will be a fan I am sure.   Check them out if you like authentic food!

I decided to try this place based on my cravings for Indian food in addition to the yelp reviews. I've only tried the basic korma curry and samosas, but will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu...eventually. haha. The prices were decent and affordable for the college/family budget. I had take away so I can't comment on the service, but the girl who rang up my order was very welcoming and nice. Tip: Grab some craft beer or wine next door and you're good to go! haha

Tandoori chicken Wings are Yummm...Their Chicken Boti kabab for appetizer , Karahi chicken for Entree are must try's . Best place for Fresh and Delicious food for a very very reasonable price .Totally apt Punch line Inexpensive Experience and i will add an amazing one !

This place gets 4 stars because the food is amazing. The service, however, left a little to be desired.   When we walked in no one greeted us and there was no sign saying "seat yourself" so we sort of stood there for awhile not sure what to do. Eventually we just sat down and waited. It took awhile for the waitress to come take our order.   We ordered tikka masala fries, the vegetarian combo, and my husband ordered the tandoori chicken. Everything was great but those fries were killer! They were delicious. I couldn't stop eating them.    The naan that came with the vegetarian plate was so good. I loved everything.   When we were done we waited a really long time for our check. Eventually we just walked up to the register where the waitress was and asked her if we paid there or at the table. She was really nice but I think she was overloaded with how many people were in there.   I will go back. It was seriously good enough to make me drive out to Tempe again. The place isn't a fancy restaurant (really casual) but the food is worth it.

On our way out camping we decided to stop in to this Triple D visited est and while mine was super good the hubby wasn't as lucky.    The curry looks great but I was really feeling the Tandoori chicken so I went for the sizzler player. The beef kabobs were good with a nice spice mix but the two offered was enough for me, the consistency was off. It seemed like it was ground beef made into a patty? The Tandoori chicken and the other option, don't remember name was both very moist, with quite a bit of heat to them, and really delightful.   Hubby ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala. I enjoyed it enough, he didn't like it at all. I think the waitress misunderstood his request for the spiciest menu item as it had none and the mix of spices especially the mint and yogurt didn't sit well with either of us.... He finished MAYBE half.  We also ordered the garlic naan and later on the hummus as the naan had absolutely no flavor, nothing like the one we enjoy from the store even, so we needed a dip to get through it. The hummus however was amazing and very garlicky.    Overall it was ok, we are from out of town so if in the area again we would opt to try a different eatery

Worst service are the only words which comes to my mind. Staff is arrogant.  We ordered samosa for starters and chicken Biryani for main course and it took them 40 minutes to put the samosas on my table and another 30 mins for the chicken Biryani. No raita was provided.
Service is terrible, but the food is super yummy and I'm pretty patient, so it doesn't bother me too much. Lots of good vegetarian options, the samosas, hummus, and garlic naan make my mouth water...

We had samosas and the hummus as starters. Both were great--hot and flavorful! My main dish, lamb tikki Marsala was also very delicious. Also great price point! Service was fast and asked us often if we were alright. No complaints at all would definitely go here again.
Stay away from curries they are watered down. Friendly people cozy atmosphere. All I tried was chicken tikka masala and it's not up to par.

I had lunch here with some friends who have never had Indian/Pakistani food.  I thought it would be a good experience for them, and luckily it was!  We had a variety of dishes, including the tikka masala fries (YUM!!!), chicken tandoori naan, cheese naan, paneer tikka masala, Afghan something (?), goat curry, and beef handi (sp?)  Everything was excellent!  We all enjoyed every dish!  The service was okay.  It wasn't bad, but there was no rapport whatsoever.  Even though the food was excellent, I thought the prices were just a tad steep.  Still, I would definitely come back for the paneer tikka masala alone!  Tasty!!!

This is my favorite corner for getting Curry of all the corners in the Phoenix valley. Everything is tasty and well priced, but the Nihari Noor Jehan is my favorite - very flavorful and a good amount of spice. They have been featured in Phoenix new times and on Diners, Dives, and Drive-ins.

My husband and I ate there tonight for the 1st time, not only did he find a hair in his food but he has been throwing up ever since we got home, its been about an hour now of vomiting, will NOT EVER eat here again!!!

Best South Asian food at the best price.  Growing up eating Indian food, its hard for me to give high ratings to most of the South Asian places.  However, Curry Corner is a happy exception.   Almost everything I have eaten here  (4 or so visits), has been really good.  I really liked their samosas, chicken tikka, lamb biryani, dal, and saag paneer.  I didn't care too much for the channa masala or the murgh achari. Also, their naan is awesome, they are hands down the best I've had in the valley!   The staff members are polite and many of them take care to ensure their customers are having an enjoyable experience.  The service is typically quick, but when its busy the service does lag.  Its not unusual to see people awkwardly standing by the door waiting to be seated.  But once a staff member comes to seat you, you're set since they are very accommodating in making room to seat waiting patrons.  If you want to eat South Asian food in Tempe this is the place to go, they have quality food and reasonable prices.

Authentic, variety, tenderness, and flavor are the first words that come to mind. I had the chapli and it was the best I've ever had. I also got samosas which were a great balance of crisp, flaky and moist. My main entree was the Arabian Thali which I devoured. It's an all around great place for cheap authentic indo-paki-afghan food. Five stars for the good. Atmosphere and costumer service was lacking, bit to be expected at a small authentic place of the sort.

The food was pretty good but the service earns this place a 3 star. The servers have poor multitasking abilities and forget simple tasks like bringing water to the table after 15 min of ordering and bringing out the food without silverware, Also, do not ask the servers if something is spicy .... The server said not really and when the food came out I couldn't handle it after a few bites. I have a low spice tolerance. The naan was good!

One day after work  I decided to visit the Curry Corner with my friend, and I was a little skeptical to try the food because I have tried a lot of average Indian food, and I didn't want to have that experience again, but I noticed the food was Pakistani style.  Since I had chicken twice that day already, I wanted to order a beef dish. The guy at the counter told me that they were out of beef.  Then I decided to order the most popular dish the "Chicken Tikka Masala."      It was a different kind of Indian/Pakistani dish that I am used to. Usually these kind of dishes are heavy, but this dish was very light, but flavorful at the same time.  The Naan bread was different as well. It was a lot lighter and fluffier then the usual Naan bread; the rice was pretty good too.  We ended up paying about $10 bucks a person. I would like to pay a little toward the $7-$8 range for this kind of place because they don't serve you, but $10 is ok.   Overall I would recommend this place if you are looking for a change of pace when it comes to Indian/Pakistani food, and want something lighter, but flavorful at the same time.

We went twice in one week. After hearing about this place from coworkers I had to try. I don't recall what we ordered as we just asked the super sweet waitress to bring us sampling of her favorite dishes. Spice was just right and the flavor is delightfully foreign. A must try!

Pathetic food , worst hospitality/service, using lot of artificial food colors .Also seen fight in kitchen between the chefs . I will NOT go to this restaurant again . And this is not Indian restaurant this Pakistani restaurant.

it seriously blows my mind that this place has a 4.5 star average. who is rating this stuff so high?!!  the samosas were served room-temperature, my paneer dish was EXTREMELY greasy, my mango lassi never came, the entire restaurant was out of napkins (not kidding!) and the chicken dishes come with such huge chunks of chicken that there's barely any flavor (so i'm told, i don't eat meat). a highlight was the garlic naan, lowlight, the service. by far. two young women who didn't care the least about good service.  don't waste your time or money. seriously, go up the street to the dhaba. waaaaaay better food and service. a little pricier, but you get what you pay for.

I didn't have a bad experience and enjoyed the Afghan Chicken with Garlic Nan. I'd eat it again too but the wait for the meal was really long and when you have a lunch break they need to move a bit faster on the food. We had to scarf it down and couldn't finish because of time. It took us nearly 30 min to get our meal and it wasn't packed when we ordered it as we were the first to arrive. If the service had been better I could give them a 4 star review but it wasn't. I'd still try it again though, just don't know when with other curry places in the city.

Horrible service! Sat down for 15mins didn't take our drink orders nor acknowledge us. I ordered appetizer I was looking forward to it but it never made it out to me! Ordered curry chicken dish and it was salty. My Nann bread was just ok, just wished they cut it for me instead of giving it to me in a basket without cutting it first.  The chef/owner that was cooking on Guy F. Show I'd rather have her  cook for me! The guys there didn't know nothing. So I won't be returning!

I thought Curry Corner was fantastic. I ordered something like a vegetarian sampler platter, and it was so good, I ordered a second entree immediately after.  Unfortunately, I don't remember the names of what dishes I had. But it was stuff that I don't typically see on south Asian restaurant menus, so I get the impression it's fairly traditional / authentic stuff. Not just mainstream "Americanized Indian" food. (Not that there's anything wrong with that!)  I will say that my (meat-eating) companions were not as enthusiastic about their dishes, but that has more to do with the fact that they don't really like curries and south Asian food, and less to do with Curry Corner specifically.  Also, service was a little slow and not terribly friendly. Oh, and the faucet in the men's restroom was leaking so much it was basically just On. I mentioned it to the waitstaff, so hopefully it's fixed by the time I've posted this.

Got this place from Diners Drivins and Dives. When I walked in to this place it looked kind of low budget but when we tasted the food it was suprisingly wonderful. The only problem was service. They forgot my wifes meal and that took a while to fix. But the food is worth going back and trying again.

Seriously, am I missing something???   I seem to be the only person who has had better Indian food.  The fam and I decided to give this place a try, even though it is very far from home, but with a recommendation like DDD, what could go wrong?  Well, first off, it's a bit chaotic when you walk in.  No real system to be seated and the tables are weirdly situated.  Once we were seated we were rushed to order... thankfully we mostly knew what we wanted.  I tryed the marsala fries, which were BY FAR the best thing we ate.  Those, I must say are amazing.  I also had a bite of the samosas, which were ok... not really that favorful, and the chicken tikka masala.  Honestly, it was ok, but I've had better... even from Trader Joes.  We also had the goat... this too was ok... better than the masala, but so fatty it was hard to eat.  So, long story short... if you live near here then perhaps hit it up.  Otherwise, check out some Indian food closer to home... that is my recommendation.  You're welcome.

After, seeing this place on Food Network  Triple D's. I knew I wanted try this place the next time I was in Mesa, Arizona.  I  arrived and was told to seat myself.  A waiter came with a somewhat tattered menu. The prices of foods on menu had been written on piece of paper and taped on menu. I  ordered The Arabic plate it consist of: Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Curry, Biryani Rice, Yogurt, pickled slices of Onion , Hummus and Naan. I also ordered a Mango Lassi. I brought a ginormous plate of food.  I  got everything but the Curry Chicken. Instead they gave either Lamb or Beef Curry. I was okay with that, being I wanted to try it.  The food was pretty good. The right amount of spices with a hint of garlic. The Naan was perfection. Now, for that Mango Lassi. This was my first one ever. I  like flavor but it wasn't cold. It could have been chilled. I  don't know if Lassi are supposed to be room  temperature. If it is to be served at room temperature. I will never order again.   I probably will not go back.  It was just okay. I have had much better.
The Chicken Boti is awesome, though the lunch serving was not served as a kebab. I also love the Naan. Prices seemed responsible. The tikka masala fries are really good too.
Nothing is as good as Curry Corner! We've tried so many restaurants in the Phoenix area and this one is TOPS! We highly recommend you give it a try!
Fantastic. Definitely go here. Delicious curries... I hope to be back many times.

Oh man!  Rarely do I hand out 5 stars... but this place is an exception.  First off, don't be turned off by the crummy strip mall it's in, or the Tempe trash that loiters around outside scratching at their coke bugs... or the fact that u-turns and left-hand turns are a pain in the ass off of Apache due to this light-rail set-up - you must open your mind!  The guy working tonight was either the owner or son of the owner or something but he KNEW customer service.  He was welcoming, friendly, informative... diligent with cleaning up, taking and bringing orders AND answering the myriad of questions I threw out at him (like "is the lamb leg or shoulder... are the bones included...?")  This guy knew his food (we shared our goat meat sources and cooking tips) and described everything in a very detailed way.  I sure wasn't asking lots of questions to be picky.. no, in fact I was wanting to learn how this $9 goat dish I had was having such an effect on me... OOF!  BEST friggin $9 I've spent so far this year!!!  I could eat this all day!  Out from the kitchen where a Pakistani woman was cooking came a size-able stainless steel container with this wonderfully aromatic, succulent goat meat in tomato and garam masala stew... it was fantastic!  I love that they used the fat renderings with the garam masala to make this *heavenly* soupy deliciousness that was plentiful in the little container.... damn, I'm salivating just remembering it all over again.  SO, check out this place.  The guy was awesome but what stood out the most was their flavorful goat dish... the goat being the stand-out!   My sister's Chicken Tikka was also super flavorful, but mine was definitely more complex and interesting... now i just need another excuse to go to Tempe so I can relive this!

I will give this place a five  Clean restrooms  Good food  I was advised by another Resturant to come here and was informed they are all Halal so here we are  Portions are little small for the price but good tasty food  You will not be disappointed for the price

I have now been back to Curry Corner a few times & must update my review! After trying out a variety of items like the paneer tikka masala, vegetable hundi, etc. I found the hidden gem .. the Chicken Makhni!  Most Indian restaurants serve their curries with rice, or nothing at all, so I'm happy to be able to be able to pick one or the other depending on my mood. Both taste equally good with but I prefer the soft yet crispy naan! The portion size of their dishes is large enough that I normally have some for dinner & the rest for lunch.  This place in on my way home from work so I often stop by to pick up a to-go order. They have it ready within 15 to 20 minutes. It's always piping hot & remains that way until I drive home. I've become a frequent visitor here & will continue to be one!

I'm sure Curry Corner is a great place but tonight was not their night. The Palak Paneer was bland but my boyfriends Goat Haleem was good! My chai tea tasted like Lipton tea...ZERO spice and it took over 30 min to get my tea. The garlic naan was good and the cheesy naan was too cheesy, like imagine quesadilla on steroids. Unfortunately my night ended with a roach chillin to my right just crawling across the table......shit happens, it's gross but it is bound to happen at some point somewhere...this place is clean and new but I could not eat another bite, a roach is a definite deal breaker! I tried this place due to the triple D show but I think I'll stick to my joint down the street, Khoorinors.
It's sooooo good after I checked out with my friends. I wanna go there again and again!! Especially my favorite drink, Mango lassi is so good there!!!

Warning! This place can mess up. My girlfriend and I went her on Sunday.  Within hours of eating we both got really ill. I recovered in a day, my girlfriend has been sick for 3 days. I now have to take her to the hospital because she has not been able to keep any food down. The food tasted fine, but clearly there was something wrong with place. I assume unwashed hands or ingredients were the cause.

Service still bad, but I keep coming back because the food is excellent. Try the tikka masalla fries, it is different and I love it. Chicken tikka masalla is still the best. Ordering the food to go Is the bet option.

Love this place! The Fish tikka masala in bomb! I moved away to Colorado and still have dreams of this food! Every time I come to town eating at curry corner is a MUST!  The only problem here is I always eat too much :)

The Chicken Makhani was delicious!  I was scraping the bowl to make sure I got every last drop of this luxurious sauce dish!  If you like  creamy Indian chicken butter dish, try this one!  It is THE BOMB!  Nancy M enjoyed her vegetarian dish as well.  There was a nice selection of vegetarian  entrees.

Love this place! The food is always good and service is great. Especially Mark, he was very attentive to us and everyone in the restaurant. If you are looking for a quick and cheap place to eat this it!

Curry Corner is always good, and really cheap for what you get. The tikka masala fries are unique and fun, and everything we've had has been really tasty. The platters have enough food to take some home, and you get to sample multiple dishes.  Just FYI, though, you might want to bring your own water if you're ordering anything that is at all spicy, because the servers seem pretty busy and don't do refills or any other kind of interaction, besides taking your order (it will probably take them 10-15 minutes to get to you for that). We've had multiple experiences where our water glasses have been empty for the whole meal, even after we've asked for refills. Also, don't expect anyone to come check on you - if you need something, ask multiple people!  In short, great food for good prices, with poor service. In our book, it still gets four stars because of the value, but barely.

This is probably my favorite curry place in town. Service has always been on point for me--its never unreasonably slow (even when they're busy). My dishes always come out hot and fresh. The naan is amazing. My favorite is the Rajistani, and you can't go wrong with Tikka Masala if it's your first time.

I make a habit of visiting Food Network locations, and usually they are just as amazing as the show says...Curry Corner is just 'ok'.  I've had Indian/Pakistani food all over the country and this did not stand up to the hype on Food Network.  I've been there 3 times and have had the Chicken Tikka (featured), the Tikka Masala, and the Aloo Saag.  The Chicken Tikka was great, but the other two were the exact same dishes you'd find at any average Indian restaurant.  The food has also been luke-warm every single time, like it had been sitting for about 10 minutes before being brought out.  Food-wise this comes nowhere near the really good Indian places I've been...it's not bad, but not great either.  Now onto the service, which is where most of this review score comes from.  The customer service is TERRIBLE.  Everyone working there acts like they have no idea what's going on, like this is their first time in a restaurant and they don't know how it works.  My party of two had to wait for 15 minutes before being seated and there were only 2 other families in there.  They gave us literally 10 seconds to look at the menu before very briskly asking for our order, and then looking offended when we said we needed more time.  The food took WAY too long (and like I said felt like it had just been sitting), and the check took even longer.  We didn't have a consistent waiter, different people kept coming over to us and I really got the impression that they don't have any type of consistent system for waiting on their guests.  In general, everyone working there acts like they don't care that you came in and are deciding to spend your money there.  It makes me not want to come back.  CURRY CORNER: if you are reading this, go hire a consultant to come in and show you how to run a restaurant.  You really really need some help with this.  The restaurant itself is shabby and the tables and booths are arranged really awkwardly.  It's not particularly clean or festive looking and the fish tank is really really dirty.  I could see into the kitchen and that didn't look very clean either.  There is no music playing and it makes it way too quiet and awkward in there.    Sadly, I don't agree with Guy Fieri on this one.  You can find better food and better service at other Indian spots in Phoenix.
OMG...this place is bomb!  I don't know whether to be happy (my wallet) or sad that we live on the other side of town! We WILL be going back!  Amazing food and amazing prices!!

I went back last night.  Had to.  There is no better Chicken Tikka Masala around.... It was superb as usual along with the garlic naan and samosas.   And I'm please to report that the service this time,unlike almost every visit before, was very professional.   I'm not a college student and won't just be 'ok' with any kind of service. Maybe college students aren't either.  She was attentive, took my order promptly, brought everything I needed to the table, and checked on me 2-3 times during the course of my solo dining.  Very well done indeed.  I just hope they can keep up this level of service because it matches their food now!  Nuff said.

The Tikka Masala fries ended up being a little disappointing, the flavor of the sauce was a little lacking.  But whatever, what do you expect ordering white people food?  I did get the chicken tikka masala (yes, I know, more white people food), and the sauce was better here (shouldn't it be the same sauce?) But the star was the chicken.  It was so tender, falling apart and just awesome.  My wife got the hummus with beef and it was a surprise.  There was so much for the price and it was packed with flavor.  It's tough to warrant going here when Haji Baba is so close, but Curry Corner is JUST different enough that I can say it's worth it sometimes.
