Went to the Curry Corner for the first tine, and the food was absoLtely amazing. The best part of the whole experience was I was able to BYOB. The service was quick. I would recommend it to any on who like this style of food.
My favorite! Food is amazing. Family owned and operated. Can't go wrong with the chicken tikka masala. I drive from Queen Creek to Tempe to eat here.
Food prices were great. The samosas were delicious. I ordered the beef curry and it seemed a little bland. The beef was tender, but not my favorite curry. I'd return and try it again.
I went back. I thought I will give a try again.  Disappointed.  Oil curry

My husband and I are auditioning new Indian food places since our favorite, Royal Taj, will be closing soon. I figured Curry Corner would be a good place to start.  When we arrived, the owner sat us at a dirty table and didn't even notice the debris. It was the gentleman who brought out our water later that seemed to be embarrassed by the mess and immediately wiped the table.   I got the vegetarian thali so that I could try a few different dishes at once, and my husband got the chicken tikka masala since it's a good "comparison" dish. Our food came out fairly quickly although my naan lagged behind a few minutes. At least it was fresh and hot though very plain. The dal and chickpeas were the standouts in my dish. Tons of flavor for something so simple. My husband was happy with his chicken. He said the meat was tender, and the sauce wasn't overwhelmed with cream like at other places. He was hoping for a bigger portion, but for the price, it was a good value. The basmati was decent, but we prefer the more spiced version from our usual place.  Service was really lacking though. We had to ask for water. My husband's entree didn't come with a plate. No one checked up on us after the food arrived. We had to ask for the check. We observed other patrons who got wrong orders or orders that were forgotten altogether. The misspelled t-shirts worn by the staff "In Expensive Excellence" really irked me too. I would try Curry Corner again, but I might stick to takeout.

I have not had much Indian food before this place but it was very good! The tiki masala was delicious and the garlic non was incredible. My one complaint was that the samosas filling was a little too starchy.

Two words:  Goat Karahi.  The reason I will be willing to drive from San Tan Valley to Tempe again.    Hopefully I spelled this right, by the way.  I forgot to grab a take-out menu to get names right.  Anyway, this dish was suggested by our server.  Who incidentally was very courteous and attentive.    The goat was tender, flavorful and just delicious.  We should have ordered two dishes of it because it comes on the bone and my husband and I were left wanting more.    We also had the Chicken Korma, which was good but when we return we'll try something else.    Prices are excellent, entrees include either rice or naan.  We opted for rice but also ordered garlic naan.  Good call on our part.  The naan was crispy and soft at the same time with great garlic flavor.  Yum!  If I understand correctly, they've recently remodeled.  I saw no problems with cleanliness, one of the things that seems to have been an issue previously.    Had a nice chat with our server about how their experience was with Guy Fieri as well.    Can't wait to go back and try some other dishes.

In the mood for Indian so we tried The Dhaba but it was that weird time of day between lunch and dinner. So, we went to Curry Corner. The service wasn't great. Wife got a soda but wasn't offered a refill until we were ready to leave. And the food was spicy, so she REALLY kinda needed it. She asked at one point and we thought the server heard us, but apparently she didn't. The food is okay. I've definitely had better Indian and I'm not sure what would bring us back here.

Great food, terrible service. Only one waitress and she did not do a good job. Slow to clean off tables, didn't come by to ask if we needed refills. They allow you to sit where you want but then when a larger party comes in, they don't have a good spot to sit. If they had a better waitress or one more, I think I could bump up the rating.

Scrumptious meal butter chk and fresh garlic naan  always enjoy the food here never disappointed but I also never anything else lol advise food is served extremely hot !!!!! Let it cool down before u partake taste so much better when cooled down ..., is it wrong to want to drink the butter chk sauce ??!!

Food is great, location is meh, interior has an awkward layout, and service is hit or miss.  The food keeps me coming back (it really is excellent), but I do wish their service was a bit more consistent.

Curry Corner has inspired me to write my first review on Yelp! I've been coming to this place for years, when I first discovered it thanks to the Food Network. First time I came, I loved it! I loved the food, loved the kind attention (from the female owner) and loved the price. Quite the deal!  However, from a place where I used to love bringing newcomers at a regular basis, it has now become a place where I only show up scarcely and only with a person that already knows its food. Because the biggest problem with this restaurant, is its SERVICE!  To be specific... it's only ONE server I have a problem with. But in a restaurant with only one (maybe two) servers at a time, one bad server is a big deal.  I don't know his name but (and not to be racist) he looks like the only server actually from India/Pakistan region. Other servers seem hispanic or white. Well, this man is the WORST server I've seen in my life. How he's been with this restaurant for so long? It's probably one of life's biggest mysteries because based to my little research, he's not related to the owners.   Anyway... this guy walks with the speed of a drunk zombie inside a turtle exhibition. He stares at you as if he's figuring out what life's meaning is all about. He always sits people at tables and then 5-10 min later he hands them menus, and 5-10 min later he takes your order... instead of doing this all at once! (I paid my college tuition as a server for 5 years so I know what I'm talking about.) He's not nice, not informative, does not understand what you're saying, you don't understand what he's saying. Overall, a mess! If he waits on me, I know it's gonna be horrible service. Food comes out before water gets to table, bread gets there when food is almost finished. And don't even think of requesting extra little things like a little more sauce... because that's a task he'll probably forget, ignore or both!   It's a shame, because I think this guy alone can ruin a business. I'm not saying to get rid of the guy, but the owner should have a talk with him to inspire him to be a little better at his job. I get how some people don't like their jobs, but he has to understand that he works in the service industry and simple things like a smile, an acknowledgement or even a quicker pace of walking can do a difference!  Speaking about the service industry, through my little research I found out that servers do NOT receive the tips. Although it looks like they do get paid their full minimum salary. But why would I restaurant not adopt this system? I believe not giving the tips to their employees can only hurt a business since maybe the incitement for good service is not there. This place is always pretty empty and has the potential to be booming because the food is very good and at a great price and that's the only reason this place gets 3 Stars from me instead of 0.

I am not a review writer ever. Until now. I have been a foodie my whole life and certain thing like quality, simplicity and authenticity are all keys to great food. Curry Corner has truly stuck by tradition and has done an amazing job showing the people in this state what good middle eastern food is. If you don't like the food here you most likely don't have the knowledge or pallet to enjoy this type of food. With the exception of mostly American produced ingredients everything is authentic. Choose one or all of the dishes. You can't go wrong.

So we finally checked this place out based on Guy's recommendation on his show and I really just don't get it We ordered the garlic naan, rice biryani, chicken tikka masala and the chicken korma. The curries were both very thin and lacking the depth of flavors I am used to. The chicken korma really wasn't that good at all - the tikka masala was better but still not that great. I was really disappointed! The biryani was ok but lack luster. The best was the garlic naan probably. There are many other indian restaurants that are far supreme to this one (sorry to say). Although I am fine with dives, this place does need to work on its appearance inside. It just seemed not clean. Not going back. Sorry...

Being an ASU student, I really love how close this place is to campus. It's open till 11 PM, too-- so I like to pick up food before/after study sessions and it works out really well. The food is amazing here-- much better than other Desi restaurants around the Valley. The staff is very amicable and polite, and will easily remember you when you come back again (once is never enough with a place like this). Prices are great, and the menu is surprisingly diverse for a place that prides itself on its curry. This restaurant's opening has been the best thing to happen to me at ASU.

Good for the college town students. Not an authentic food. Ordered an a hair chicken and it was completely blend. Also the aloo tikki for appetizers were just plain with a mint sauce. No flavors here.

I love DDD and always check out his picks when in the area. Seen this on TV and decided to see what all the hoo-ha was all about. Normally Guy is pretty good with his choices but sometimes he can be off a bit.  Inside is rather small and appears to be a hit with the ASU students as well as the regulars who live or work nearby. There are two TVs that are always on and either playing the Food Network or a cheesy flick from overseas.  The menu has a several choices to pick from when ordering. Some are more Pakistani style while others are more of the standard favorites that you would see for this type of restaurant cuisine.  Started with a some appetizers. Ordered the Samosas with dipping sauces and on another visit some Aloo Tikki. Had to try what Guy had eaten so got the Goat Karahi with Garlic Naan and then came back again later in the week and tried the Tandoori Chicken Tikka.  They definitely got the flavors down but the portions seemed rather small. Really liked both the Goat and the Tandoori. Wish that you could order a larger version of the meals without having to pay for two dishes. I had asked if I could get the Tandoori with more chicken for an extra charge and I was told that was not an option. Hmmm?  Give them a try and make sure to fill up on the appetizers first so that you are not still hungry when you are finished. Prices are reasonable until you end up ordering more than what you were expecting. THAT'S MONEY!  3.25 STARS
I went here because I saw in triple D, the food was good..location could be more clean tho.

We went over Xmas holidays. My son and I were on a quest to go to many DDD eateries. We ordered dishes featured on the show and plus 2 more. Food is good; 4 stars. However, service is slow; it wasn't crowded at all. I am fine with service, as long as they are cooking the food. The issue I had was with the waitress. She bites her nails often. Often had her fingers in her mouth. She brought the dishes to our table. They need to hire servers with better hygenes.

My friend in Arizona recommended Curry Corner after finding it via the Food Network app. Overall the experience was good, but I don't think I'd return if I were in the area as I've had better Indian and Pakistani food.  We arrived on a lazy Sunday afternoon close to 12 and the place was quite empty. We sat at one of the few small tables against the wall and began debating what we should order.  We started with an order of the Tikka Masala fries, which I'd seen recommended on Yelp. They were good, especially the portions with feta cheese, but I'd recommend skipping them. The fries were pretty soggy, which is understandable, but the tikka masala sauce wasn't very flavorful or spicy.   I ordered the Vegetarian thali, a combination of 2 vegetable curries, lentils, rice, naan, yogurt, and a small salad. It was good, though the lentils were incredibly salty. The standout for me was the yogurt dip, which I found really refreshing. The curries were good, just not outstanding. Still, the price can't be beat for the amount of food you get.  My friend ordered the Arabic Plate, which is like the thali plates in that you get two kinds of curry (hers had chicken), lentils, biryani rice, hummus instead of yogurt, salad, and naan. I liked these curries better than my vegetarian ones personally.  The oddest part of our visit was watching someone, presumably an employee, wander back and forth between the kitchen and cleaning the outdoor windows. It made me feel slightly awkward about the potential for unsanitary conditions where my food was being made.  I'd honestly skip Curry Corner, but it's not a bad decision.
We had a good experience. We had to try Curry Corner after seeing it on DDD. The rude waiter everyone talks about must of had the day off. Our server was fine. Food was great as expected.

I'm back again & the place looks great & remodeled since the last time I was here-   AMAZING FOOD is all i can say! very authentic, the chicken masala is all I get at indian restaurants, here at CC it's not as heavy & creamy as other places so doesn't leave u feeling bloated-   Ps: to Nadia C below, with her 1 star rating, this isn't "Pei-Wei" hunny so dont go talking about "service" & websites blah blah blah...this place is excellent, authentic, i would highly recommend!
The red curry was great. I got the chicken wrap and the seasoning and cooking was perfect. I dipped the pita in the red curry and it was amazing.

Best Indian food in Phoenix, period. Disagree? Fight me 1vs1.   No seriously, this place is amazing. If you're not on a diet plan, get the masala fries. You won't regret it. If you are on a diet, get the masala fries, you will regret it, but at least you can cry in tears of deliciousness.   I've been at least 4x in parties of at least 6 so we practically got many dishes and shared. My most favorite one of course is the chicken tikka masala and the grilled meats. Also, this was my first experience with CHEESEY NAAN! Cheesey naan + whatever meat = homerdrooling.gif  This place is also Halal for those that need to know.   So once again, if you want a good Indian fix, this is the place.

I have very little knowledge of Indian cuisine and absolutely no knowledge of Pakistani cuisine but this place was fantastic.  I ordered Nehani Noor Jehan, which was intensely flavorful...almost a floral fragrance in your nose while your mouth tastes rich, thick sauce with beef shanks.  I ate it with rice and some prices of their yummy, freshly-made naan.    My dining companion had the Chicken Jalfrezi and it was delicious.  I'll have that next time.  Lots of tender chunks of chicken. This would be a great place to go with a bunch of friends so you can order and share several of their specialties.  I already want to return!!!

SO GOOD! my husband loves diners, drive in's and dives and when we saw this place reviewed and realized it's five minutes from where we live, we decided to go there today for lunch. I'm not a super adventurous eater, but this was AMAZING! Awesome service.......our servers were attentive, helpful and helped us order!  We will FOR SURE be back!

We used to frequent this restaurant quite often when we lived in Tempe and the quality was amazing. As an American who grew up in a traditional midwest household, my tolerance for spicy food is extremely low. My husband is from India, however, and needs spice in his meals -- so this place used to be perfect for us because I could get mild dishes.   I don't know if the management has changed or what, but today when we were there we were told that all of the food is pre-made and they cannot make anything without red chili. The only option is to pour creme into a pre-made dish to try to dilute it. I have never had this happen at a restaurant before and was absolutely shocked to learn all of the food is pre-made spicy here. Cooking indian food at home and having half of a family that's indian, I know it is very simple and possible to make non-spicy food without the use of creme--it's done by not using so much red chili.   Honestly, the easy answer to appeal to more customers here is to make all food mild and add heat to it based on a customers preferences instead of making it all spicy.   So while our family all enjoyed lunch, I was not able to eat because I am 8 months pregnant and cannot have spicy food. I prefer vegetarian food and the only non-spicy veg they had was palak paneer which is full of creme.

Fast, cheap, and good food. Last star reserved because servers were overwhelmed by dinner rush, sauces were a little salty (but not a deal breaker), and we sat in a cramped corner in a dining room that got pretty hot. I'll be back though to try other things.
Very good and inexpensive. No alcohol served. Not the quickest service, but we were not in a hurry. According to my Indian friend it was quite authentic.

Definitivamente regreso a este restaurant Vegetarian thali si eres vegetariano aficionado lo recomiendo. Tai chi tea delicioso. La atencion al cliente lo k esperaba. El tiempo de espera ...no mas de 10 min No tengo nada negativo k comentar. Mi experiencia fue muy grata.

My favorite local Indian cuisine! I've been coming here regularly for the past 3 years to get my Indian food fix and it does the job!  I typically order the Chicken Tikka Masala which is creamy and flavorful with tender chicken! You have your choice of normal Naan or rice. I typically order rice and get a side of garlic naan! Use the Naan to scrap every last bit of your meal. Yum!  Occasionally I'll order the mango Lassi. If you're new to Indian food this is a thick yogurt drink with mango flavor. It's very good but they usually fill me up so be sure to drink them slow so you have room for your meal.   The restaurant itself is in a not so appealing strip mall but the interior is nice and usually clean. Seating is open so feel free to pick a table and the staff with be with you shortly. They are usually very nice and the service is quick.

I absolutely love this place!!! This place is so great for lunch dinner and everything else! If I was Richie Rich I would've put this place in my mansion. They just do everything right and the prices are so affordable! I advise everyone who reads this review to go there immediately!

Service is pretty dreadful and the food is very ordinary. We ordered the Afghan boti, butter chicken, Nehari, with a variety of naan and some Chicken Biryani.  None of the food was tasty resulting in a rather disappointing experience.  The host insisted that they were on the cusp of closing for the day in-spite of us having walked in a whole hour in before they close He even questioned our request for an additional plate and an extra to-go container.

Once again was let down by the quality of food. Each time I've been there, it seems to have degraded. Tikka masala fries were oily and the fries themselves were not crispy/ undercooked. Seekh Kabob and chapli kabob were not very flavorful and the size of the serving seems to have shrunk. The chana puri combo was abysmal. The chana dish was watery and for the Puri, they seemed to have used the naan batter and fried it, so the Puri was more like fried naan! Looks like the only thing they seem to do OK with are chicken items.  I have given them enough chances and won't be returning.

Visited on 11/14/2014 for the first time. Restaurant has a modern look inside and fast serves even though they were short staffed that evening. We ordered the following:  Tikka Masalsa fries $ 5 (Appetizer)  excellent flavors... loved the cheese and crispy fries. TIkka Masala  Shrimp  $ 9 : Served with rice or naan bread  served with a couple of shrimp only but the flavors were good   Traditional Curry Chicken  served with rice or naan bread /// delicious chicken  Cheese Naan  - MUST TRY Delicious !!   Garlic Naan- very tasty  Bill came out to $28 loved the food would come back AGAIN !!  :D

The food is ok but they are not very skilled or particularly good waiters. Seems as tho all the workers do all the work. Nobody is designated to one spot. This made for a very messy service experience. I was approached twice by two difference people to take my order. One person asked if I wanted a water and forgot right as the other guy saw and said "ah water" then brought me the water. After putting in an order they didn't take my menu so the first guy who talked to me asked if I wanted to order again right after I did with the second guy.   If you can stand the mediocre confusing service and the fact that you will have to tell multiple people that you want to order, already ordered, and repeat twice, then you will enjoy some decent food. It is not the best Indian food I have ate before tho, and better places exist with much better service. Also some portion sizes are quite small like the sampler plates and I left not completely full.

We went with the family ordered their mix grill sizzler, this is the 3rd time disappointment  that it was just a chicken tikka and one kabab. There wasn't any other stuff such as behari boti or seekh boti. So better just order a chicken tikka rather their sizzler its waste of money.

This is hands down the best Indian (yeah I know) food I've ever had. However, the service is a hit or miss. One day we can walk in and get seated and helped and served promptly. And literally the next day, or later that day (don't judge), they will take our order and 20 minutes later we find out the they forgot to put it in and we'd have to reorder (there's one specific guy but I don't wanna put him on blast).   It's totally worth it though. Just don't come here on your lunch break or you may have to try to convince your friends that an Indian restaurant is to blame for your getting fired. Trust me. Just kidding. But not really.  If you don't want to be a mainstream bandwagon loser and get the chicken tikka masala like everyone else at your table I'd suggest the hara masala or palak murg.   It would be a game changer if they had a buffet doe

My chicken kabob was bland.  If it wasn't for the cinnamon it would have been flavorless.  For me a little too much cilantro.  The Naan was very soft,  no crisp at all.  The servers were polite, but no follow up on drinks.   I wouldn't go back for the food.

I stopped in today because I was craving Indian food. This place was very good and hit the spot. I'm a little upset because I live far and now I have to drive all the way back to enjoy it again . The staff was very helpful and the prices were great. I would definitely recommend this place.
By far the best Indian food I've had in Arizona. Excellent service and prices!

I sometimes find the Indian/Pakistani resto choices in Metro Phoenix lacking, some places are good with certain specialties, etc. with Curry Corner, most of their curries and biryanis are on point. For instance their chicken tikka masala consistently tastes great, as well as their Karahi's and the Chicken Achari.   I've been a regular customer the last 10 years, back when Curry Corner occupied a storefront at the corner of Lemon Rd and Terrace and pre-food network fame when it was a go to for Indian international students living nearby. I'm happy that they've grown and have still retained their low prices, and the portions have stayed the same. I like their cheese naan, and the tawa paratha too. Definitely get yourself a mango lassi, it's so refreshing especially when it's warm out.

We saw it on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and decided to go with apprehension. Guy did not steer us wrong! The Goat Karahi was the perfect combination of flavor and heat with a blend of spices. I just placed an order to go while thinking about it. Best in town but if you dont trust my culinary palate then look no further beyond the walls littered with awards.   If you are hungry...Go NOW!

The food here is so absolutely delicious every time I come to eat I wonder why I don't come every day. We had the nonvegetarian Thali and chicken tandoori. The flavors are complex and delicious. The chicken is incredibly tender. The Naan is just the right texture. I am knocking off a star because what I would like them to do is get a rag and some Windex and clean the place. Especially the bathroom. It's so easy to clean up. Just spend a minute in there. Please.

OMG! Seriously one of the best Paki restaurant EVER. Well that might be me saying that because it was the only place which served me Chapli Kabob lol. But on a serious note i think this place has done really well for themselves even though i think they have a competition only a block away but its always dead. I was in tempe for 2 days and and went there both days. Customer service was great as well. The dude from the TV wasn't wrong. :D Most of their business is from the HUGE Indian and a Pakistani student population by ASU. So if they all love it trust me you will as well.

I heard about Curry Corner through an Indian friend during a conversation about cooking and eating Indian food -- the rich flavor profiles provided by the wide variety of flavorful spices, the necessity of quality in said spices, and the best Indian places in the valley. My friend swore by Curry Corner as his choice for most authentic, so as a huge fan of Indian food (and food in general, let's be real, this is Yelp), I bookmarked it and tried it within the week.  I ordered the lamb tikka masala with naan, which came out of the kitchen after about 10 minutes. At first I thought it would't be enough food, but I suppose I underestimated and left fat and happy. The lamb was choice although some pieces were a bit dry. The naan was fresh out of the oven, buttery and flaky. The tikka masala sauce was excellent and authentic as any I've had.   I do however have to knock down a star for the cup they gave me for water (first of all, the water tasted a little funky), which had some white greasy substance smeared on the side. Pretty gross. Unfortunately, I didn't notice until I had finished and was about to leave.

Ok, it was almost  a year since I ate here with my wife but I finally signed up for a Yelp account, so here we go...I have been itching to write a review on this place because it is one of those experiences that had such highs and such lows that it kind of eats away at you.....  We are celebrity chef nerds, and try to eat at places that we see on DDD, Anthony Bourdain, etc.  Visiting from Vancouver, B.C., we were looking forward to this spot.  We come from a city that has one of the worlds best Indian chefs, Vikram Vij.  I also had many Indian neighbours growing up.  Finding tin foil packages on the door step, filled with home cooked Indian food is a treat for sure.  Needless to say, we are well versed in quality Indian/Pakistani food.  I even learned many recipes and cooking methods from our Indian neighbours over the years.  Ok enough back up...  I will try to make it short...  For the most part, the food was great.  The curries/sauces were very flavourful and authentic.  The service was ok.  The server we had was a bit on the lacking food knowledge side.  Or at least how to communicate it in English.  We ended up getting what we wanted, so all was good.  Luckily I can say a few cuisine related words in Indian to help him out.  The one thing that was a HUGE disappointment was the goat.  I LOVE goat.  I have had goat at Vij's that makes you wish you ate goat several times a week. Good goat should be fall off the bone, slightly gamey, and like the best pot roast you've ever had but bettter.  The goat here was so bad, I couldn't eat more than half of it.  It was so chewy and gristly that it was embarrassing.  This was the dish that was featured on DDD, and the reason I thought about this place for months???  There is no way a restaurant should ever put out an ingredient that is so far off from its acclaim.  It's maddening.  The curry/sauce was SO amazing that it made it even more maddening.  I ended up having sauce with naan as a meal.  I may visit here again, but I really hope they take their reputation seriously and not follow the few that suffer the fame-to-fail route.  The sounds from all the reviews since my visit here tells me they might very well be going down that path.
After seeing it on tv we had to go try it. It was delicious. Everything was great. The chicken tandoori was perfect. I will be back and you should come try it !
This place is the best Indian restaurant in all of Tempe it really is that good. Have the garlic naan and the chicken makhini

First-time customer. I was so disappointed. I ordered the Tikka Masala Fries as an appetizer. Took forever for them to come out, and by the time they finally come out delivered by somebody besides our waiter, they were cold except for in the middle of the fries. It was clear they had been sitting there for a good long time. So about 2 minutes after we got our french fries we got our food. My daughter got the rice and beef. The beef was so tough that using a fork and pressing down and trying to cut it as hard as I could I couldn't cut it. My goat Curry had sharp little pieces of bone in its. Just bone all by itself, not surrounded by any meat. I could easily see biting down on that and really messing up your mouth. The Taste was okay, and the food was warm so at least there's that. We also had to flag down our server for him to finally bring us our drinks.  They did take off the beef dish from our bill. But all in all, a horrible experience.  Cheese naan was wonderful. Two stars for that.
Poor quality food; I was just passing by PHX and had a dinner here. It's not authentic indo pak restaurant. Will not recommend it. They use poor quality meat.

Curry Corner is absolutely great! As a college student, I love how cheap it is, but the quality is not at all sacrificed. I love their hummus, and I honestly probably get it at least two times a week.  I've been starting to take my friends here, and they love it as well.  The service is usually fast, though I've had to wait a few times, but that's not a big deal at all. Five stars for sure!

I love, love, love this restaurant! This is the best Indian food I have found. I am addicted to Curry Corner. I have tried bariani, chicken masala, simosas, garlic nan bread and so on. Not only is the food amazing but it's a family owned business & they know how to make you feel at home.

Saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. We had to go. The food is excellent, spicy, and it's awesome that the vegetarian section is just as large as the meat section.   Some of my favorites are the Palak Paneer( freshly chopped spinach greens (palak) cooked with home made paneer (cheese), Aloo Matar (Potatoes saut√©ed with green peas seasoned with house spices, or the Vegetarian Thali ( 2 vegetable curries and one lentil served with rice, naan, yogurt, and salad).  You can't go wrong at this place. Everything is good. If you don't know what to get, just take a chance and you won't be disappointed.

I started going here about 5 months ago when a friend who lives right near it said it was pretty good.  I do not eat nonkosher meat or poultry, so I was delighted when I saw they have a good amount of fish options with Talapia.  My favorite by far is the fish biryani (fish cooked with rice and a ton of herbs and seasonigns) served with a side of yogurt.  It is absolutely phenomenal and cheap considering the portion size.  I think it costs like 8 dollars.  The amount of seasonings and herbs is what really makes the dish taste so good.    I have also tried the fish curries.  They are pretty good, but I much prefer the Biryani.  My GF usually orders a curry,either fish or vegetable, and she also loves it.  We also order the samosas on occasion, which have a great flavor.  The Naan is also delicious, but I have never really had "bad" naan at an indian/paki restuarant, so i do not think that having great naan is a special benefit - rather, if you dont have great naan, i wont be going to the restaurant!  The service is usually slow, but getting better as the restaurant becomes more professional.  I hope they dont lose the home style cooking or low prices as a result of becoming more of a "real" restaurant.    Also, Guy Fieri ate there recently for his DDD show and I am very excited to see it!
Authentic paki Indian food.  Not Americanized/westernized taste like other restaurants.   Service could be better but it adds authenticity of the place.
This little place is great!  Good food and reasonably priced. If want a quick, good, inexpensive meal. Definitely make it a point to try it.

The food tastes great! You can get a lot of food for a fairly low price when you order a thali! The location is good too since it is close to ASU. Their mango lassi is amazing. I would recommend this place to include a paneer veg curry like paneer tikka masala in their veg thali. Also, the service could be better, it seemed like one person was doing all the work - greeting guests, serving food, and working as a cashier.

This place comes highly recommended within my little group of friends but Overall wasn't super impressed.  I ordered the tika masala chicken & it was super good one on the best flavored masala sauces I have eaten anywhere.  If only everything on the menu was this good.  My husband ordered goat.    It was mostly grissle and bones.  the little bit of edible meat was dry and tasteless.    Nann is also dry and tasteless.  Prices are expensive.  There is no buffet.  service is terrible (rude, sloppy, listless, and supper supper slow).

The last time I ate here, a few nights ago, the food was really good.  The problem was the service.  Horrible.  Slow.  I had to ask three times for more napkins.  The waitress got the orders wrong at most of the tables.  We did not get the naan bread we ordered at all until at the last minute they decided we should have some so they brought it to us in foil as we were about to leave.  Never got asked for a refill on my drink.  They really need to raise their game or my next visit will be my last.  Too bad, the food is so good.

Food is amazing, each and every time I have gone.  The lamb curry had a good amount of meat and plenty of rice and curry.  I really hope to try the goat next time, last time they were out.  The chicken tikka is juicy, tender and perfectly prepared.  GET THE CHEESE NAN BREAD, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT! If you want something to help with some of the spicier dishes, I recommend the lassi, especially if they still have strawberry.  This place is my favorite Indian restaurant, and you can't beat the prices  The only issue I have is the servers.  Some are better than others but I feel like the staff spends more time in the back than up in the front (this could be due to a lack of staffing.). Also the less professional servers are not very friendly and are very lackadaisical.  Don't let this divert you from the stellar food.
I saw this place on the show Diner, Drive-Ins and Dives. The Best Tandoori chicken I've ever had. I tried the Salt Lassi, which was not refreshing at all.

If I could i would leave zero stars. I've came here a few times in the past and the experience has been fair. The food is very good, the only problem is the service. The most recent experience 11/9/2017 me and my wife came in for dinner. We were sat down and the server just left and never came back.  About 15 minutes have passed not one employee asked us if we needed a drink or gave us a menu. This was going to be my first meal of the day, so you can imagine how irritated I must have been. A few times the server looked at us. Rather than asking if we needed anything he just went around empty tables to set napkins. Then a new group of people came in and they were  sat down and immediatley asked if they needed water and given a menu....after we have been sitting there for about 20 minutes with no service. They are very selective with how they treat their customers. The food here is amazing but the people of the facility are terrible. I've never experienced this in any resturaunt ever in my life. We got up and left hungry.

This restaurant has average Indian food but the reason why it gets 2 stars is because of thier horrible customer service. Forgetting drinks, naan, and rice. Only bringing them after the meal was finished.

Loved it! Very different but delicious, tried the Tikka Masala Fries (reminds me chilaquiles), Hummus (the best I have had) with Naan (reminds me of homemade flour tortillas), Tandoori chicken, and Goat Karahi. I love spicy food so I did not think the food was spicy at all, I could have used more heat but if you are sensitive to spicy food you might melt. I didn't think the service was bad as others have mentioned. I would come back and would bring friends that like to try different food.

I've eaten Indian food one other time. It was buffet style- ok, but... Curry Corner is a sit down, order from the menu and I simply do not have a metaphor to describe how good it is. We ordered: (spelling?) tandoori  chicken, masala chicken and a thick lentil soup- don't know the name. Our meals came with long grain white rice and nam. The tandoori chicken came sizzling to the table, perfect char, covered with onion and bell pepper slices. It was unspeakably good! The lentils over white rice was a perfect side. The rice was plentiful and steamed (I assume) correctly. The nam was sprinkled with cilantro, there was more than enough and it was amazing! Now for the Marsala chicken. Served boneless in a red sauce, I couldn't believe how good it tasted! It had a flavor that imprints on your mind. Slightly spicy but no way over powering, since I'm a novice with Indian food I am unable to identify the ingredients. Let me also say; in my opinion, when one eats at an 'ethnic' restaurant and 40%+ of the other customers are of that ethnicity, you can pretty much bet you are getting the real thing! My only thoughts on improvement would be the chai tea didn't seem to have the sweetness I'm used to and I like to listen to the music from the country with the food I'm eating- just me... Curry Corner- you win! One more thing before I go; I usually try to take a photo or two but when the food came to the table, photography was the last thing on my mind

I'm giving the place 4 stars because the ceiling was starting to cave in over our heads from condensation from the A/C. Yes really. It was dripping on our table.   BUT....  The food is phenomenal. We tried a little of everything here and wow. SO fresh, so delicious, and what an experience. If you are not familiar with Indian food, this is a great place to start because once you've had the best, the other restaurants won't matter.  And I hope they've fixed the ceiling since our visit...because a place like this is worth preserving!

We've had the chicken tikka masala, basmati rice, and garlic naan from here; it was pretty good. Tried ordering from them through uber eats: they gave the uber driver someone else's order to be delivered to me and then tried blaming the driver. Either management pays no attention to anyone walking in and just grabbing wrong orders, or they gave the uber driver the wrong order. They vehemently blamed the driver. When calling to resolve it, their line was "busy" for 20 minutes straight and then the phone was passed to another person who had no idea why she was speaking to me. I have never dined in but do not plan to in the future, unfortunately.  P.s. Chicken Tikka Masala Fries are divine but their service has been so terrible that I know longer wish to further give them my money.

You have to go to this little gem, which is hidden in a nondescript strip-mall location.  The location is small and is - for reasons unknown - usually quite empty.  I had the tikka masala (once with chicken, once with lamb) and naan.  Both times I was in tikka masala heaven.  My friend had potatoes in a green sauce (I forget what herb the sauce was made from) - I had a taste and it was also crazy good (especially for a vegetarian dish, which I do not gravitate toward).  You won't be disappointed!

I have been to a lot of Indian/Pakistani restaurant by far this place has the best lamb biryani. Wow!!! It was amazing full of flavor can't get any better. I also had their Haleem, it wasn't all that but it's worth getting it.

The last time I went to curry corner  the service was terrible. The two girls working on a Wednesday around lunch time didn't even acknowledge we came in. They were busy doing other stuff. That's fine, but then after 10 mins of no one greeting us or taking our drink orders when the restaurant wasn't even at half I decided to leave. The last few times the service has been pretty bad but never this bad where they were just standing around. I talked to one of the waiters from a previous visit, he They told me they don't work off tips. The tips go to the owner. Maybe that's why they didn't seem to care. Food is great, when you actually order. Hopefully this review will help and they will get better service.
Really fantastic food - really.  A little slow on the service, but they were very nice and cheerful!  My only recommendation would be don't be in a hurry. The Arabian Thali was amazing!
Really good Pakistani food! Definitely one of the finer foods in Arizona! I would actually say it's better than most Indian/Pakistani restaurants in LA.  Ibrahim
Long story short: Food Quality: Very Good Service: Horrible

I've heard many good thing. Many. Many. Many. I want to thank you yelpers for helping me through the menu. Several of you mentioned the (Goat Karahi) and omg that was good. Fall off the bone meat with a spiciness that I loved. The boyfriend had the (Chicken Tikki Masala), he was done before I could get a bit, so that speaks for it self. For appetizer we had a the (Samosas) and (Tandoori Wings) and we pretty much inhaled both. Yeah inhaled. They took a bit longer to make due to the cooking process but definitely worth the wait. Service was good. Not great. She did the job while juggling seven other tables but I'm a server as well and she knew how to handle this restaurant. When the bill came, I choked a bit because I thought we got under charged. Nope. The food is amazing. It's nothing simple but it will leave you taking a to-go menu and craving more. We'll be back. Yes we will.

If you love food that has lots of flavor then try this place, the variety of spices & herb they use in their dishes are awesome! Also the garlic Naan ( flat bread ) is delicious , definitely coming back again, and prices are very reasonable.

I love this place so much but it doesn't agree with the stomach too much if you know what I mean. Every time I eat here it's an immediate trip to the restroom my girlfriend hates it... little bit of a back story here me and my girlfriend moved in together 3 months ago into her moms basement and I had had curry corner a couple hours prior I went to bed that night and woke up with poop in the bed and I wasn't surprised of course tho I blamed it on her 12 year old son Jason (I hate him) he expects me to be his dad or something idk but yeah I blamed it on him and this place really gives me the sh!ts but overall really good place would give it 5 stars but my girlfriend said no so there ya go

Went with six of my Friends there. Great tasting food.   Strawberry Milkshake is really tasty. Fries are great. Biryani, Naans, Curris wonderful.    Affordable and Tasty..  Service could be better though.

The food here is amazing. I love this place prices are fair and portions are large. If this place is lacking anything its a little in the atmosphere department but they have been improving over the years. Food is always great.
Old spinach / tasted very old , no flavor & really bland ! I am having stomach issues already! I won't even serve this to humans ! Paneer was old and tasted like old rubber !!

This place honestly reminds me of the quality of food I used to get in Chicago. The meat is fresh and the spices are perfect. The Karahi lamb reminded me of my favorite restaurant inchicago Sabri nihari Karahi gosht. Not the exact same but pretty damn good. The handi chicken is also spectacular. Just ask them to make it extra hot if you want a kick. Love this place I'm definitely going back there again.
Sticky seats and sticky floors, but I keep coming back for the delicious food! Specifically, the Tikka Masala Fries. Yum!

I had the lamb tikka and it was OK. The food was very tasty but it wasn't hot (hot as in "not warm"). And It kinda felt like eating homemade Indian food that got microwaved  for 1 minute and 30 seconds and then served to us. Prices are reasonable, $8-$10 for a small bowl of curry and meat of your choice and a big plate of white (flavorless) biryani rice.   Would give 5 stars if: 1) Food was freshly made, 2) Hot and 3) More meat :)

Food: Outstanding. My family and I ordered a ton of things off the menu, and everything we got (see photos!) tasted heavenly.   Service: On a scale of 1-10, it's somewhere between a 7 and 7.5. One of our servers was kind of cold, and the wait time was a bit long.    Overall, it was still worth every penny, and I'd definitely come back for seconds.

Kelly was awesome, great waiter, friendly and knowledgeable. Food was good but wasn't mind blowing, didn't take too long to be served. Chai tea... was ok. Samoas were pretty good. After Kelly left though our group didn't get taken care of by the relieving waiter... it wasn't even busy in there.

I've been a customer for only a couple years, but have eaten here a couple dozen times. Food is really delicious, but service is subpar. This is the main reason why I only do takeout now, and even then I don't feel like a valued customer. I'll continue to eat the food, but won't eat there because I won't tip a server if I get terrible service.

The vegetarian biryani was great , the palak paneer to die for but then wen I ordered a take home, found tht the food had not been defrosted properly, it was full of nylon, the memory of the incident too strong to revisit curry corner. Have serious doubts about the maintenance since then
Great food with amazing prices!! The service was good... A little strange because we never actually had one specific server but they were all very friendly!

First off let me start off by saying... SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE! If I could give 0 stars I would. Here are my reasons.  1: No greeting upon arrival 2: Served flat drinks; had to wait 5-10 mins for new drinks  3: Three people who came in after me, were served before me.  4: Waited 35+ Mins for my Appetizer 5: Girl checking me out tried to give me every excuse in the book as to why my food took so long 6: To be "Nice" she said she'll take the drinks off the bill for me....    All in all at the end of the day; I felt like me and my girlfriend as people who also work in the food business should've been treated a little bit better; after having to wait 35+ minutes for food, while customers who came in after us were served before my girlfriend and I; I personally felt like our whole bill should've been comped out due to the certain circumstances we had to deal with.

I want to give them a 3... interior is a 1... food is a 4..... BUT! They earn the extra 1 point because the food is good... AND! They're open til 11pm and satisfy the late night cravings.  Wouldn't take your first date here.. but damn it's good!

Where do I start? Perhaps from the time when I first gave them a call to confirm they are open before coming in?  It was close to 3.30pm on a Saturday and I called the restaurant to confirm that they are open before driving 15 minutes to come here. I asked "Hi.. Are you open now?" The guy, with a perplexed tone responds "Why?"  Whyyyy??? Whyyyyyyy?? Really? That was the first red flag to turn away. But I didn't because I wanted to give them a second chance.  They got us seated right next to the entrance where tons of people were walking by. It was annoying, so we asked the waiter to move us to another booth at the far end of the restaurant.  He said he'll accomodate our request after cleaning up the table. We waited, waited and waited. 15 minutes passed. The other table was not cleaned yet. And nobody came to our table to take our order. Everytime we tried to flag somebody down to take our order, we heard "Just one minute".. Several minutes passed and nobody showed up to take our order.  Finally, we noticed that the other table that we wanted to move to, had been cleaned. So, we just walked over and told the waiter "We are going there".  And then waited for another 10-15min before some guy came by to take our order. We got Tikka Fries, Chicken Curry, Chicken Tikka Naan, Garlic Naan and Veggie Biriyani.  The chicken tikka naan was terrible. Likewise, the garlic naan. There was hardly any garlic on it.  The chicken curry was mediocre at best. While serving the veggie biriyani, the waiter said "Here's your chicken vegetable biriyani". We went "Woah woah wait.. Is it chicken or veggie biriyani. We ordered veggie, and you said it was chicken veggie biriyani". His response "No no, this is veggie biriyani". IDIOT  After requesting for water (without ice) multiple times, we were served water with ice. And obviously we told him "We asked for water without ice". He says "Oh ok, sorry" and leaves the glasses right there.  Made a mistake by ordering salted lassi and yeah, you could clean your bathroom with whatever they got. It was not lassi and it was inedible.

My friend heard about this place through the Food Network and we decided to get lunch here one day! The food was quite delicious, and the staff accommodated how I wanted to bring a cake in for my friend. The only downside would be how we attempted to order certain items, just to be told over and over that they could not make any at the time.

The food is delicious here & is one of my favorites. We were in today & my husband ordered the tandoori wings & they were not cooked. The owner even came out & we showed her. I believe that if you can't eat the food you should not have to pay for it. That is not good business! The chicken was not cooked through!! They still made us pay for it. Very unfortunate as we are regular customers. I am giving it 3 stars for this reason & not 5.

Very deceiving from the outside, but the food was very unique! It's rare to find a place that sells delicacies from Pakistan or Afghanistan. I tried the goat dish. The meat was very tender, though a bit fatty, but I didn't mind since it was very flavorful. It was stewed in a thick and flavorful sauce. You get either naan or basmati rice with the dish, but we got both. Our meal ended with clove-infused rice pudding... which was addicting! Our server was very friendly and had good recommendations. There is no ambiance, so don't go expecting a classy atmosphere. This place is for people that appreciate good and unique food. Looking forward to trying more off of their amazing menu!

Good service, for me any how. I like the design of the restaurant. The food came out beautifully.  The portions were generous both of our entrees were only $8 so that was nice as well. We had been here before I had a yelp so I am glad to give them the 5 stars they deserve.

It took me a year and a half to make it back to Curry Corner. Things really changed! The menu is still the same, but the entire decor is much nicer. This is definitely a restaurant I'd recommend to people. I hate that I happen to live in West Phoenix and don't get to come here very often as it's rather affordable.  Hosts/servers could use a little more training. It's customary to check in on someone a little after they've gotten their food. You want to make sure people's drinks are never empty.
Good food, horrible service. Quite an easy fix - hire people who actually want to work.

This place is spectacular. Hands down the best Northern Indian / Pakistani food in Phoenix. It's a family run place owned by actual Pakistanis, and the food is definitely served for their palate not for wimpy Americans. They don't ask you how spicy you want it. It comes one way: the real way.  For the person whining about hygiene and cleanliness because they got "food poisoning": Maybe you just couldn't take it. Go find a McDonalds. They're very clean.

I first came here in 2014 and I thought the food was pretty good, however when I ordered take-out about a month later they totally skimped on the amount of paneer and since I loathe dishonestly I vowed not to come again. However since I am employed at the University and often dine with co-workers who wish to come here, I have been here two additional times, once in late 2015 and once this month (2016).  In 2015: 1) My food was mediocre 2) One guy was acting as host/waiter and was extremely rude 3) Food took forever to come out even through they weren't busy 4) My coworker's specialty drink never came  On the most recent trip things were even worse.  1) My dish was terrible 2) One woman was acting as hostess/waitress so no one was in front-of-the-house for 5 minutes while we waited to be seated 3) My coworker's meal was below average for such a popular dish; and the chicken in the curry was fatty 4) It took 15 min. for water to arrive and was never refilled and we were not given napkins (had to get up to get them ourselves)  5) One sauce on the table was extremely low and the was other dirty (they had just opened) 6) Coworker's tea came out about 40 minutes after being seated and tasted more like cream than tea.  It appears that the owner's of Curry Corner are trying to ride the Diner's Drive-ends and Dives wave from 2013 while cutting corners and pushing out poor food and shitty service post-production.

I thoroughly enjoy Indian food, and my boyfriend's mom saw this place on TV and suggested we go try it, which I am glad we did!   When we first pulled up, the place from the outside does look a tad scary... and we were questioning how this visit was going to go. But once you get inside the place looks fine, the waiters are very friendly, and let you pick a table to sit at. Not a bad start.  We ended up ordering a few things to try which included: Lamb tikka masala, tandoori chicken, cheese naan, and a medium curry called Jalrezi with chicken (my fave). We got some with rice, and others with more naan to try too.   I don't remember the wait being bad, but I do remember how delicious the food was. I admit, I was skeptical after thoroughly reading about this place and the reviews online; however, I am pleased to say my boyfriend and I loved it. Price ended up being better than I expected too, especially after ordering what felt like a feast.  Maybe I have good luck with trying new places, but this to me is a good find and worth my time!
Not sure why this was on Food Network. Chicken was fatty and dark meat in curries. The best parts of the meal were the nan bread and the rice.
food is soooooooooooo good!!!! it's ok if you don't want to try this place... more for us!!  i'm coming back for sure!!!!!

My new favorite restaurant. I have been here twice, now..the first time just randomly chose the chicken achari, and was completely amazed, the flavors exploded across my palate, with the subtle heat in the finish, was like nothing I've ever experienced. I upgraded to the potato naan, which is mashed potatoes stuffed between two delicious pieces of grilled bread..my second time, I got the curry sampler, combo thingy..three different curries, pickled onions, naan, and yogurt sauce..this is the way to go..always upgrade to the potato naan! The combo said it came with a desert on the menu, but not in reality..still the cold leftovers were a perfect finish..

First time trying Indian food, and it wasn't bad! Not my favorite style of food, but everything was cooked thoroughly and had a fresh taste! We also received some type of pita bread with some cilantro dip and it was phenomenal. I will definitely be back

Very bad stale food .. Went there with great expectations as they are featured on food network but huge disappointment !! Ordered chicken tikka which was bland and tasteless and curry which has no flavor and lots of oil ! Even naan bread was old and stale !! Won't go back !

This restaurant would be 5 stars in my book if I could eat there. Have never not been able to eat at a restaurant before because it was too cold to even be bearable.  But I can no longer eat here and neither can two of my friends.  So sad because we loved curry corner.  Please make the room temperature warmer!  Update:  Thank you, Curry Corner!  It has been much warmer for years now and we so enjoy your food and staff.  I forgot I had written this review until today.  The Chicken Makhani is exquisitely spiced!

For anyone visiting the Phoenix metro, love Indian food, or consider them self a foodie, this is a must try! I've been coming here since 2011 and there's no other restaurant I've ate at more than here (except for Chipotle and Chic-Fil-a) during my time as an undergrad. I do miss their old prices but am very happy they have expanded.  Food is still amazing as always. I've tried almost everything except for the vegetarian list and a few other items. The yogurt mango lassi is delicious - sweet, creamy consistency, and refreshing. The chicken Tikka Masala with rice and garlic naan is a must - I've heard it's not made like "traditional" ways, but I've tried multiple takes of this at various of different restaurants (maybe it depends what region of Indian you compare it to? this version is absolutely the best). The chicken tikka masala has a perfect mix of Indian spice in a tomato base and cream. I always love it when they add an extra kick to it. You can ask for extra meat (not sure if they charge though. I've never paid attention).  Other things to get are the mixed grilled sizzler is. This is good as well, especially if you're really big on meat portions. I usually get lamb briyani every now and then. Honestly, I can go on for days! The service is not over the top amazing, but they're good people. However, everything on the menu will rock your taste buds.

If I could customize my diet 85% of it would consist of naan bread and egg rolls.  The potato naan here is my manna. The other dishes are solid representations from the mystical sub continent.  I do wish the chicken used in their tika masala was less Gandhi and more meat.

Ok, the place is simple. Nothing too fancy.   Servers were ok. Not so friendly but it didnt bother me.  Presentation of the food was alright, but the flavors were really good! I couldnt stop munching on the garlic and especially the cheese naan bread! Currys were tasteful! All of our orders turned out great! Im happy with the tastes!   I would recommend this to anyone. I have three stars only cuz i expected more cuz of watching the show. Would i come back for more in the future? I would say so! This is a good place to eat traditional food!

We went because of Diners drive ins and dives.  We did not get the food he got even though we ordered the same thing.  Ours wasn't tasty the order was smaller and even a different color. The place wasn't clean, dirty floors, sticky table edges.  Wouldn't go again.
Love the food. Their service is friendly. They are usually busy when I come in so there's a wait but nothing too excessive. The cheese naan is amazing! Definitely one of my favorite places!!

We'd seen this place before, but this time the restaurant we planned to visit was closed(!!).  So we walked over here.  Some interesting dishes on the menu that I am not familiar with.  I like that.  We ordered chicken rajisthani, hara masala chicken, and samosas.  The samosas were of a reasonable size, and they give three of them.  They were very tasty.  Simple, but tasty.  The other dishes were served like stews in bowls.  The portions were reasonably large.  The flavors of each were unique.  I've never had either before.  I liked them both.  Very good.  We were pleased with our choices.  This will be on our short list of places to visit when we want sub-continent food (Indian/Pakistani).

The food is good, but a little bit too much Mexican food fusion here. Each table has two types of hot sauce-- the red rooster sauce and a straight habanero sauce. What's the deal?  It's worth coming back though, since prices are around $8 on average and mango lassi is $2.50.  Just... don't expect an authentic Indian food experience.

We went to curry corner today. No one to receive us. No one to serve food. The waiters were totally negligent and don't care about the customers. We waited for 10 minutes for the Order and left the restaurant.

BEST Indian food I have ever had. We had the Tikka Masala fries which were to die for..tasted like an indian version of chili cheese fries. We also ordered the Chicken Makhani...which was recommended to me by the owner who was featured on triple d's. The Makhani was perfect curry. Creamy richness with a slight spicy kick. Being from NYC and the tri state area, this place has perfected indian food to the finest.

LOVE the food here! My fiance and I recently moved here from out of state and found this place on Yelp. We moved here from a small town (he is originally from southern India) and we were excited to see so many different restaurants with culture and flavor. We have been to Curry Corner twice and have eaten the samosas, tikka masala, lamb biryani, chicken makhani and aloo tikki. We have had these dishes with both rice and naan and on both visits the food was excellent! The portions aren't huge, but we have had leftovers each time, and they don't overprice. The service provided by the wait staff has been very friendly and prompt. The decor and seating leave something to be desired but the food itself was great. We will return and soon!!

I think I hyped up Curry Corner too much in my head before visiting. I had been salivating over the photos of the masala fries for quiet sometime so I was thrilled to finally try them out. Sadly, my expectations were shattered in a bad way. The fries were cold by the time we received them and they were kind of soggy from the sauce. Also, I noticed they were missing the green garnish that is shown in lot of other photos.   Service was spotty from the start. It took a while for us to be sat. Then, it took a while for the food to come out and finally, it took a long while to pay the bill. For some unknown reason, all of the staff seemed to be back in the kitchen area. So glad we came on a weekend and did not need to be anywhere in a rush because the visit took much longer than necessary.   When our food did come out, we were brought two plates when we had only ordered one. This lead to an awkward conversation trying to explain that we only ordered one. However the waitress proceeded to tell us that we had ordered two. Mistakes do happen but arguing with customers about it does not make the situation any better.   Our waitress also never asked what spice level we wanted and some of the vegetarian plate was a little spicier than I would have preferred. Towards the end of the meal the owner/manager came by to check on us which was appreciated but a little too late.   Overall the food was okay but due to the service I don't think I'll be back.

F%#* me this ish was good! I came because I saw it on diners drive in with that dude who looks like he can't decide what era or genre he belongs to but is still cool. I had the Tika masala fired. Bomb. Tandori chicken. Bomb. Bread. Bomb. I pulled off some chicken, threw it in the bread and wrapped that bird up like a little burrito in honor of my people. Place is on point and good price. Worth the trip I'll be back.

Easily the best Indo-Pac food in Arizona, but don't just take my word for it. When I started coming here they were a 2 star joint and all the reviews complained about slow service, cramped dinning rooms and long wait times, but I went on an off night when I expected that not too many people would be in. We had an amazing meal.   Since then, they have expanded the dinning area by double and have hired more hands to take and deliver orders...That should put those 1 and 2 stars to rest. Now about what makes them a 5 star place and really, the only Indian food place you need to have on speed dial.   Their Tikka Masala is absolutely divine. I use this dish as my litmus test...If the masala is garbage, chances are the rest of the dishes follow...But this place...Holy mother of all things great and small. It is one of the best dishes they have on the menu. The chicken is tender, the sauce nice and warm, creamy and so aromatic. Couple this with some of their garlic naan and you have a dish that puts you halfway to Nirvana.  Other dish recommendations: the Chicken Jalfrezi (my wife's words on this one) was "a transcendent experience". She allowed me a few bites and it was mind blowing. The peppers and onions, the meat slow cooked into spicy mouthfuls of beauty...Think I am overplaying my hand? Friggin try this place.  If none of this sways you, let me put it this way. I came here once. It is now my only Indian restaurant. I tell everyone I meet about it and it becomes their ONLY Indian restaurant. One try and you will see why I sing this place's praises to anyone who will listen.
Excellent good and service. I had the grill sampler and all the meats were very good. My wife had the chicken tikka masala and it was the best Pakistani food I've ever eaten.

Meh.  I've tasted way better. The meal was lukewarm and could have used additional salt.  Selection is very limited. Usual menu items were missing. No chicken Vindaloo. Where they do that at??  Low authenticity as well. No regular spicy chili sauce thing; instead, they had cholula and Tabasco. OutOfPlace.com.  Prices are amazing though.
Hype for no reason. Service is ok, food is alright. I expected more after hearing about Curry Corner. There are far better options in the area.

I've ordered from here on Uber eats a couple times & they don't ever seem to take their delivery customers seriously. I've had a few occasions where I've made a certain request to add a certain vegetable to my curry and they don't listen, or they don't put the sauces that belongs with my appetizer. I've had missing Togo forks n knives it's just very annoying when they don't value returning or first time customers!!!!

My experience here left me disillusioned and feeling like a second class citizen. When I walked in, I waited for someone to get me a table. I was ignored. I waited 10 minutes. I start searching for someone to help me.  Finally found someone.   I was abruptly asked "for here or to go" and was told to go grab my own menu, of which I had a lot of trouble finding in this messy place. I sat myself since nobody bothered seating me.   I ordered veggie biriyani and a mango lassi to go. I waited. And waited. And waited. No one made eye contact with me or acknowledged me. No one tried to assure me that I wasn't forgotten or tried to keep me happy with my mango lassie or at least a glass of water.  Approximately 30 minutes later, I caught eye contact with someone flagged him down. He came up to me and told me that my food would be out shortly. Perhaps he picked up on my frustration.  Food came out, after waiting even longer. I was given a ridiculous excuse as to what happened, which I will not even bother to mention. I paid and took my food home. I was unhappy with the veggie biriyani. The menu stated that it has fragrant saffron and other spices. I did not taste or smell a trace of saffron. It was dry and bland. To top it off, there were a couple of pieces of chicken in my VEGETARIAN rice. I am never coming back again.

I have eaten here many times, dining in and taking out. I come back for the food, but the service is driving me away. There has not been one time where they did not mess up the order, and the wait has always been trying.
Food is good. But the service is terrible. Probably the worst among all restaurants I have been to here in Arizona.

The food here is amazing! I found this place off Diner drive inn and dives. This place has some of the best curry in Tempe that I've had only problem is the service is always so slow to the point you don't even want the food anymore. I recommend calling in for pick up because you might get so upset at the slow service that you may not even enjoy the food. Overall I love curry corner though!

Worst paneer tikka masala I have ever had. Had half of my food n left. Couldn't evn finish, it was that bad!!!  My friend ordered biriyani and Saag chicken it wasn't good either !! Oh and I forgot to mention the tikka masala was cold , uncooked , tasteless , salt less and very very watery !! Worst experience ! Nva coming back !!

Good tikka masala fries. Had lamb curry and chicken Korma. Just ok. Pretty spicy and tasted the same. Probably won't come back. Really needed a refill on my soda and was never offered one. Waitress didn't hear my request in passing me.

There are a few times in your life when you have a baaad feeling about a place...Peeling plastic off of the menus, peeling plaster off the walls, filthy kitchen (which I mistook for the entrance to the restaurant before being shooed out) for starters.  Ordered some staple, vegetarian dishes. I think the food was watered down from a previously frozen and very likely refrozen dishes. There still was the distinct aftertaste of freezer burn...  I'm falling sick even a few hours after...bloating, nausea, and a general sick feeling.   Avoid this restaurant like the plague.

YES to the samosas. They are flavorful, steamy hot, and come with a delicious sauce. NO to the curries - ha, go figure. Unless you like liquidy, oily, flavorless broth with chunks of meat inside. Also, NO to the water. It tastes very chlorinated.  Note the door on the left is STUCK so don't be discouraged and try, try again!
Tikka masala fries are amazing!!!!! Crunchy mushy spicy sweet = wow  Everything else was just ok

This place rocks! Everything is like 8 bucks on the menu, so you don't have to worry about ordering something "cheaper".  The portions are very reasonable and the curries are very flavorful... add some of their naan to your meal and you're set.  This place was on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives a couple years ago, so that also adds to their credibility (in my opinion, that's really cool).

After months off trying to make it here. I was let down.  Service from the beginning was not good. Server obviously didn't not want to be their. We mentioned it was our first time and he was just like Ok... Food was not as flavorful as I would have thought. Not everything you see on TV is what it is. Owell..... And no Chai tea and it was 3pm.... Maybe it was Because they were a bit busy maybe I'll give them a second chance.

Took me forever to finally leave the comforts of Phoenix to check out Curry Corner.  My only regret, not coming sooner!  Super close, right next to ASU.  Fast, friendly service.  Some of the best garlic and cheese stuffed naan around.  Had the chicken tikka, lamb, biryani and of course a mango lassi.  Like many family owned gems, the d√©cor isn't fancy.  I was a little worried that they would rest on their DD&D laurels like some restaurants do, but I am eagerly looking for another excuse to head back and check out the rest of the menu.

First and maybe last time at this place. First off my friend brought some food she ask for mild food. Everything down to the spinach with cheese was spicy. The naan was burnt up. The cheese in the spinach was burned. We actually took it back and we sat there for a good 20 minutes. The owner did compensated us with a free entree and was nice about the situation from the time we walked in. My friend got the new naan (not knowing I had the old burnt stuff) and I guess they heated up the burnt naan and put it back in the foil... And I guess they warmed up the spinach with cheese as well... but my question is who gives someone back burnt food?!?... To manager- Don't bother with apologizing on this review as well...
This was our first time at Curry Corner and we were very satisfied with the service and the food was absolutely delish!!

My go-to spot for Indian food in the Scottsdale/Tempe Area. The food is always excellent - the lamb karahi is absolutely worth the extra wait time! Downside is the dine-in service is non-existent. I like my Indian food very spicy but good luck getting more than 1 water refill during your meal. Kitchen plays their music too loud so you get a strange mix of mariachi and Indian music playing over each other. Order to-go and you'll be very satisfied though

What an amazing place! Our first time having Pakistani food so we didn't know what to order, but we were lucky and met Shawn who gave us a quick explanation of everything and even gave us an excellent recommendations on the food. My husband got the Goat/Lamb  Punjabi Handi (Goat stew) and I got the chicken Tikka masala; both were DELICIOUS. They were served with rice and Naan,  yummy yummy!  Service is great and fast. Prices are more than fair. If you like to try new food and spices, this is your place, be adventurous. Don't miss it!

I can only comment on the service as I never got to order. I stood at the door and was ignored numerous times by people walking in and out of the kitchen. When I finally asked to be seated, it seemed like they were being bothered or surprised by my request. After I sat down wherever I wanted, it was quickly evident that I wouldnt be served any time soon, so I just left.

Tikka Masala Fries, chicken Tikka Masala, and cheese naan! All amazing! Didn't necessarily care for the yogurt drink, but that could just be my taste. My friend usually orders a vegi dish and enjoys. We always have leftovers and it tastes even better the next day! The service could be a little faster, but... hasn't stopped me from going back countless times! They are always very sweet!

This was GREAT Indian food. It doesn't look like much from the outside, and is definitely in a divey location, but wow. First off, order the fries with masala sauce. Seriously, trust me. They were double fried and so crispy they all but shattered when you looked at them, but doused in delicious sauce and feta cheese. I'm pretty sure I could have eaten that and called it an entire meal. The garlic naan wasn't as garlicky as I could have hoped, but it was tasty anyways. All of the rest of the food was delicious, and the service was friendly. Only thing I was missing was the little dish of spices on the way out the door. It always helps settle my stomach after a heavy meal. Nice big parking lot here, which is great right off campus.

Food is ok, prices are good, but service is horrible....  The taste of same item is different each time. It's better to order for a pick up, rather than dine in. Have tried their BBQ chicken, biryani, nihari and a couple of more items. Food tastes better but not very authentic.
Fantastic food! Very authentic and great hummus! Hard to find good hummus outside of Israel but this is good. Everyone must try!

Sub-par food, as in the food left me feeling still hungry for Indian food the next day because I was left very unsatisfied. Waitstaff here is the real problem though: Rude, lazy, and acted as though everything my group asked for or ordered was the absolute last thing they wanted anything to do with. Didn't bring us the bill  for 20 minutes and when we asked for the bill they were just like "you pay up front." No sign saying that.  Would not recommend, as there are WAY better places in Tempe for Indian food and the experience at those restaurants is much better. Try Delhi Palace.

Food: Indian Food Staff: Friendly and helpful Atmosphere: Small little restaurant, but plenty of seats for everyone.   Parking: There is plenty of parking because it is located in a strip mall, but if you are coming along Apache from the west you'll have to make a U-turn down the road.  I've been traveling a lot lately and when I do I have a tendency to watch a lot of Food Network shows.  This place was on an episode of Diner, Drive-ins, and Dives the week before I was going to be in town so I decided to drop in.  Whenever I try a new Indian place I go with the standard Chicken Tikka Marsala and garlic naan.  Since I decided to dine in, I also got a mango lassi to cool down the sauce if needed.  When the dish came out, it seemed like there wasn't much chicken in the dish, but it was really hiding under the sauce.  The sauce had a nice spice to it, I would say closer to hot than warm.  The mango lassi came in handy.  The sauce was also extremely smooth, almost as if it had been processed.  I'm also guessing they finished it off with a touch of butter to give it a nice silky texture.  The garlic naan was good, but had a slight after taste of something.  I'm guessing it was the fuel they used in their oven to cook it, but I can't be sure.  The mango lassi was okay.  The texture was good, but I had hoped for a bit more mango flavor.  So, back to the sauce.  The sauce was so good, that I decided to order a cheese naan to dip in it.  It was good (turned it into an Indian pizza), but the cheese naan is bit heavy.  The wait staff was friendly and attentive and alway kept my water full.  Overall it was good and would be in my top three Indian places.  I'll be back and I'll have to dry the garlic naan and mango lassi again to see if it improves, if so, it would be five stars from me.  Ordered Dish: - Chicken Tikka Marsala - Garlic Naan  - Cheese Naan - Mango Lassi

I really cannot overstate how good this place is. Every dish we tried was better than the next. A big dude named Omar took our order and he could not have been friendlier, and considering this place was on Triple D a few nights before, it was so cool how appreciative he was of our business. So, the food and service are great...what else is there? Oh yea three of us ate like Pakistani royalty with plenty of leftovers for $35. That's why I gave a rare five stars.
Really great food, my favorite is the veggie wrap and the chicken masala is awesome!

This place is a HIT OR MISS spot. Some days you will get exceptional food and other days you will get horrible, over watered curry. This place is basically designed for students who barely understand or care for quality food. Their menus condition looks like they were in a dumpster for weeks, Nasty, sticky and dirty. Now imagine how your food is being cooked in the back if the items in the front are so terrible. Dont make a mistake on dining in on weekends. Packed restaurant with 2 servers? You will wait hours for food and service. Its not like these guys are not making money but the quality is not improving.

A small place, the food is great. The curry fries are fantastic and a must order! The staff is friendly and the decor is very cozy in an authentic traditional way.  I really enjoyed Curry Corner and will likely come back again

I have only had one lunch meal here - the thali. I can surely say their menu is reasonably priced but, the taste of the food is below average. The meats were indeed cooked to perfection but, the just wasn't great. Very controlled use of oil/fat which is another plus. I will update this as I try a couple more items.
