Amazing, addicting Indian food! My husbands favorite is the chicken makhani and my favorite is the tikka masala.  The tikka masala sauce is very inconsistent (assuming based on different chefs) but good every time!  Delicious garlic naan!

My friend and I decided to try this place because we like to try new things. He asked if they had any alcoholic beverages and they said no but he can go next door and buy alcohol there and bring it on. I thought that was really cool. I ordered the tandoori chicken masala and my friend ordered the mixed grill sizzler. I also got the garlic naan. I can't even begin top say how delicious the food is. My friend has since give back three times. Is a little far for me but I need to make time to go and eat there. I highly recommend the place.

Amazing food !! I cant tell ya all of what we had but i can tell ya it was amazing !! The potato naan was soooo yummy !! The tikka marsala chicken was wonderful ! The other things i dont know the name of were out of this world ( i will try to update with their names soon cuz u need to know :)   They forgot the toppings on the tikka marsala fries though :( didnt know till we were home to my sisters ...
Food was delicious.  The price was very reasonable as well.  The manager is the one that actually served us.  She was fast and efficient.

Very poor service, after waiting 20 minutes my order was totally wrong, and after another 10 minutes I got my food and the chicken I have ordered was not even cooked all pink from inside never go back to this restaurant.
Very good food!  The waiters are patient even though they don't really seem like they want to be there. Check out is super fast. Food comes quick. Would recommend.
Went here because we saw it on triple D. Great food home- like vibe.

The food was ok. But the service was horrible!!! Phone manners were not good. Then when we went to pick up the order we waited  10 minutes and when she handed us our food it was COLD!  Not happy. Won't be back.

The food was not at all worth 3.5 stars as rated in yelp. Really bad service, the server was getting irritated as we were asking for stuff. We ordered biryani and curry, and specifically mentioned for the biryani to be served after the curry. Still they served biryani before and when asked to bring it later, they got irritated and made faces.  Ridiculous service. Arrogant servers.  Treat your guests wisely!!

First off, I didn't see any of the service issues some of the other reviews complained about.   The food wasn't bad, it just was not good. Both of the curry type dishes my party had were extremely oily but still somehow bland. The rice had a strange after taste to it - not exactly bad but I didn't enjoy it. The mean was entirely too soft, there was no crispness or flakiness at all. The kebab was actually flavorful, but very dry.  It's not all bad though. The tandoori chicken was excellent; flavorful and moist. The service was good, especially considering there was only one server there, and I really enjoyed my strawberry lassi. Oh, and they brought out some pepper flakes for us after asking if they could bring something to make it spicier.  Probably not going back. There are better places to get Indian food.

I was here last night with Apache Eats and I loved the food. Everything had a nice heat to it and a very nice flavor. The hummus consistancy was great. I really can't think of anything to be critical about. I'll definitely be going back.

I thought this place was going to be better based on reviews but I guess not. You enter in through the hookah place next door and you are obligated to get your own drinks. I love Indian food, I make it at home all of the time but sometimes I like to venture out. The lowdown:  *I got the tikka masala fries and they were good but they desperately needed salt. *Mattar paneer also needed salt and spice, I thought this food was supposed to be full of flavor and spice?No creamy texture and the cheese was rubbery and more firm than it is supposed to be.  *My partner's lamb curry was sadly laden with oil and you could see the separation between the tomato curry and the oil sitting on top. The biggest part of the lamb that was saved for last was mostly, if not all fat.  *Basmati rice needed salt as well, and I'm not a salt fiend! More oil would have helped to make it moist.  *Garlic Naan was crispy and hot.  In conclusion: tikka masala fries and naan were good. I was disappointed at the lack of flavor everything had. If you want one of the best experiences go to Royal Taj here in Tempe, if you want some of the best Indian food in your life go to Delhi Palace in Flagstaff at Woodlands Village.

We dined in this restaurant last Sunday and everything was great during that visit. We liked the food so much that we decided to come here again for dinner today. Unfortunately the experience was utterly disappointing this time. We ordered right after we were seated as we knew exactly what to order. Our order included 2 Tandoori Chicken Tikkas, one Reshmi kabob, one sizzling platter and one Tikka masala fries. The fries didn't take long to be served and they were okay. We had to wait for another 45 minutes for the rest of the food to be served. Upon my reminder, I was told that since we ordered all grilled menu items, it was taking long. I also reminded about how we were not even served water which was provided right after.  When our food was finally served and we started eating, we noticed that the quality and taste was not even close to how it was last time. Above all the Tandoori chicken Tikkas were raw from inside- something I wasn't all all expecting considering the amount of time it took to show up at the table. It seems like the owner doesn't come to the restaurant anymore and has made her kids and a couple of his college friends in-charge. The service and quality of the food used to be much better when she was here. It wasn't even that busy today otherwise I would have given them some benefit of the doubt. While paying for the meal, I complained about the rawness of the chicken so they 'graciously' didn't charge me for one order of chicken tikka. I did pay for the rest of the meal and even added 15% gratuity. I would strongly advise the owner to be managing/cooking herself if she wanted her loyal customers to keep coming to her restaurant.

Came here late at night after a road trip near closing time - the staff was very accommodating and allowed us to dine in even though they were doing take=out only at that point.  The mango lassi was excellent - a little bit on the sweet side (I usually like it a little tart), but tasted like it was made from real mangoes rather than the prepackaged stuff. The chicken boti was some of the best I've tasted - the meat was juicy and fully flavored, and the spiced onions complement it nicely.  Though the atmosphere seems like it's geared towards the college crowd from nearby ASU, Curry Corner is a great place to get a nice filling meal, and I'd definitely consider coming back if I'm in town again.

I have been to this place many times. It is much cheaper than the other Indian restaurants around.  I love their Biryani.I think they serve the best biryani in Tempe. The staff is also friendly. Although, the place is small, It is clean and well maintained.

Food is priced like it is amazing, but it's actually pretty mediocre. If you want to delete your wallet on mediocre food this is the place for you.   Service is slow also but the staff is nice and friendly though.
Great authentic food. A hidden gem. Service could improve a bit, however with a name like curry corner I think everyone knows what you are getting into.

This place is so awkward.... my friend and I wanted to get Indian food so he suggested me this place. We came in and got greeted by this rude waiter who took us forever to seat us even though there were plenty of seats empty. What made it awkward was that this place was completely SILENT... the only noise were the people whispering and quietly talking, so we decided to do take out instead. We tell the waiter we changed our mind to take out and he got annoyed at us... but the food is overall delicious, just work on the customer service and the environment of your restaurant.
Appetizers never came. The food like bas a water added to the Tika masla and was served. I would avoid coming again. It wasn't a busy day, so no excuse.

I LOVE this place.  Their tikka masala is SOO good.  Their chicken makhani is really good too. The rice is like eating a cloud - so light, fluffy.  I've come here almost 20+ times since I moved to Tempe.
Amazing food!  However, disappointed that 50% of the time they are "all out of Chai tea"!  Food price and service is reasonable.

Easily, the BEST Indian food I have EVER had! The service is always hit or miss... But for the food, it's always worth it... ALWAYS!!!   My go to dish is the Chicken Hara Masala! It's SOOO spicy. SOOO savory. And SOOO yummy. I prefer it with Nann, as opposed to rice, but that's because I will eat both and I prefer Nann... However, I can eat the plain rice by itself, and be content - that's how damn good this place is!  This is easily the best place in Tempe!
This place is always yummy.  It is small and not the fanciest.  But the flavors of the dishes make up for it.     Also i think the food is halaal.

The Pakistani food is great. has that great home cooked taste to it...we tried the daal, gosht karahi, chicken pulao, chaana puri and veggie thali. it was amazing the service is great and food is well priced. Definitely made my last day in ARizona a happy one

Food is great, very authentic and huge portions. But the service is a little bit lacking.    Came here to get some Indian Pakistani food and was impressed by the prices and the value we got. We ordered a vegetarian masala and a chicken masala to share. All the dishes were very authentic flavorful and tasty. we got a side order of rice and naan, the naan was perfect. The Musala fries was loaded with sauce and cheese, surely will give you a nice heart attack, but do not worry about that when the flavors are exploding in your mouth. The lamb Punjabi Handi was also very tasty and full of flavors, but the lamb meat was overcooked and very dry. For $9, it was a good deal. I also got the sweet lassi, which is the yogurt drink and loved it.   The service was definitely lacking and our waiter never came back to check on us. parking was very easy in the strip mall lot and the bathrooms were decently clean.

This place is Halal, if Halal translates to terrible food.   I knew this was going to be a bad experience after my first sip of the unfiltered tap water the waitress brought out. To get the taste of ecoli out of my mouth I ordered a mango lassi which proved to as flavorful as dish detergent with stevia. People often say, figuratively, 'this left a bad taste in my mouth,' this drink makes you say it literally. We just couldn't wait for our chicken tikka masala to come out, but that too proved to be disappointing. Our mouths had no refuge as we sipped the mango to get the chicken out of our mouths and then back to our sewer water.   At the time of going here, this place was listed 5/5 stars on nearly every site we searched. I figured out why, as half way through the meal, the resutraunt because busier and busier. Every single person in the restaurant seemed as if this was their first indian food experience. It took nearly 10 minutes for the waitress to bring us the check after we asked for it. Another 10 minutes to come pick it up and process it so we could get the heck out of there.

I got the Afgani Boti   I ran in here with a friend to get lunch to go, the restaurant is very small and cute. I think that this is the best Indian food I have had, staff was very friendly. The dish I got  has a very fresh taste and the cilantro is very apparent. I will definatly recommend and be back when I am in the area again! LOVE IT

We decided to try it after Guy Fieri s recommendation. They only had two servers - which made service slow. For appetizers we ordered the aloo tiki. My husband enjoyed it. I found it too salty. I ordered the sheesh kebab. It was dry and overcooked. I only ate the rice.  At check out, they took it off the bill.  My husband vegetarian thali was to die for. Delicious!! I kept stealing fork fulls of his food.

This is specifically for people with stomach issues and totally my subjective review for those that may share my issues. The chicken based dishes here are extremely spicy, I guess because they don't marinate them without chili and use the same chicken for most curry dishes. Hence even requested at mild, it gets extremely hot- I could only wonder how hot it gets when they add extra chili. I do eat hot food occasionally, but only here,  out of the 3 times I have had these people's food in the last 2 yrs, I get super acid reflux for days after , and iam pretty healthy and fit otherwise- so learnt my lesson finally. What really pissed me off is that I specifically ask them NO spice/ hot, and I get this every time.   Never ever coming back again however desperately hungry iam. Also the service over there, especially if you are a desi is pretty bad, the guy at the door looks down carelessly and looks like he couldn't give a damn. That is the same attitude even if you go in without a takeout. And on top of it, they expect and stand there for a tip while paying them like hawks. The most unprofessional ever.

4 star food, 3 star service.  We ordered the goat karahi and chicken achari. both of the flavors are very good. We wanna try more next time. I am asking for a fork but the staff never give it to me. probably it is busy and he forgets. wish the service could be improved.
Second time at this restaurant and as always the quality of the food is great. It's my parents first time trying Indian food and they absolutely loved it!
This is super authentic Punjabi food! All of the Karahi's and curries are super good! Only drawback is that the service s really poor. Overall best indian food in Tempe!

I love love love!! the food here. I tried the Chicken Haramasala today and it was absolutely amazing. Too bad its a special item and not a part of the regular menu. Now having said that, I wish they'd clean their restroom more often. How about cleaning the floors now and then, some air freshener maybe and oh, empty the trash once in a while?! I had to take back one star, just because of the restroom. Sorry CC :(
Saw them on Diners, Drive in's and Dives, who puts eggs in naan? That's not vegetarian, And the crowd looked like no Indians come here , nothing looked authentic!

I would want to give 2.5 stars but rounding off to 3. We ordered a delivery from Amazon restaurants. This place had lots of reviews, hence wanted to give it a try.   We ordered Tandoori chicken, chicken keema and chicken korma. Both the curries came with rice. The Tandoori chicken to my surprise was really good, the meat was tender and juicy, really enjoyed the chicken. The keema was a disaster, there was absolutely no taste, it was bland and regretted it for ordering. The korma was alright for our taste and was better than keema.   I would want to give them a chance and try other dishes considering the scarcity of good Indian restaurants in the valley. The price is pretty decent for the quantity.
Okay food. Horrible service!! Hey guys it's not rocket science, smile a little, be kind to your customers.
The Tikka Masala is addicting and the cheese naan was good and fresh - gonna try the garlic naan next time. Everything was delicious!

Glad to return to this amazing secret after a four year absence.  The prices are great, the service attentive, and the food delicious.  My family,  friends, & I each ordered something different so we could taste the spectrum of food types and seasonings.  We were NOT disappointed!  Thanks Curry Corner ... see you next time!

This was my favorite restaurant as I was a regular customer... but when I went for dinner two weeks ago... the waiter Shawn was extremely rude to us. He did not rEfill our water and bring our complete order of naan to the table. I ordered - total of 6 naans, which he brought to my table two at a time. We were a family of 5 and could not enjoy our food because the naan kept getting finished. Resulting in Shawn getting very loud with us and threatening to call the cops on us. all we did is ask him if he could please bring our final two naans so we could finish dinner. Then he packed the two naans and told us he had it ready for us to take home . My 6 year old and 3 year old were in tears begging him not to call the cops. And what was the reason?! Because he was telling us he gave us SUPERIOR customer service. And when we nicely told him it would have been fine to bring our naans together at once he started getting loud. Also I'm Pakistani so beware if you go to this restaurant because they will not treat you like a customer. I wrote the curry corner owner on Facebook and they did not follow up with me as promised so, apparently they don't appreciate there   Regular customers. So Hilal grill is my place to go for authentic Pakistani food.

This place is absolutely wonderful!!!!! The food is always great no matter how many times you order it. The Chicken Mahkni (I think that is how it is spelled) is an amazingly creamy and flavorful dish, especially with the Briyani rice. Great Tikki Masala too. You absolutely cannot go wrong with the Potato Naan, my husband requests an order just to himself.  I have only ever ordered out so I have had little experience with the full on customer experience, but the friendliness of the waitresses is hit and miss, but I cannot vouch for the dinning in experience. However, I still feel with the effort this place puts into making great food, it still deserves a full 5 stars.

Worst service ever. Food is really good but waiters don't know what they are doing and it's impossible to order pick up. It becomes more of a hassle to eat there rather than just being able to enjoy it

I will start by saying we drove almost an hour to go there. We saw a rerun episode of Diners, drive-ins and Dives and they were talking about the fabulous food at Curry Corner!  I cannot say how disappointed we are about the experience. The food was awful!  The plates are served institution style, aluminum plates with dividers. I am assuming for portion control.  We ordered two plates; The tikka masala was watered down and the riata looked like skim milk. It came with a small piece old lettuce and tomato, by far this is the worst Indian food I have ever had. The other plate was goat curry, it was a little better, at least it was not watered down, but it was hard and chewy.  Do not get fooled by the Food Network Hype, I am sure they prepared days in advance for the visit. This is not the case for the regular customers. The place was packed with mostly Anglo clients, I am sure they were there for same reason we went.  The service was not great either, too busy for 1 server. Very disappointed!

The worst dinning experience I've ever had here in Tempe      For starters, the staff are extremely rude and won't even give you a menu until you beg for it. Their food is ok though. I have ordered food for pickup several times and every single time my order is missing a main dish. Tonight, I came to the restaurant to have dinner about 40 minutes before closing time and the waiters told us that they are closing and they only take to go orders and there were a bunch of Indian people who just arrived at the restaurant and they served their food on the tables. I don't recommending this place to anyone looking to have great food and great times.

This place has incredible food and really poor service. My fiance and I come here every 4-6 months or so because we have to wait long enough to forget how bad the service is. We went on Thursday and the server barely spoke to us--it took 10 minutes to get menus and we were never offered refills on our drinks. We had to explain when we paid for our meal everything we ordered because the server didn't accurately write anything down. They clearly do great business with their carry out service, and my thought is that they should do away with the eat-in restaurant all together and just focus on that. The food is always *almost* awesome enough to merit the treatment, but I think this last visit will be, in fact, our last visit.
I really like this place. They have a variety of Indian food.Its worth going to this place.

Indo-pak cuisine all meat is halal a good place for Muslims to eat. Not my favorite desk restaurant bit is #2 in my book. Took my wife here after I proposed to her and she liked it. She is a bigger critic of the food since she is Pakistani but said it was good enoigh.

Generally when i go there at night its good but i visited there in afternoon and ordered a malai kofta. One of the worst experience till date, lots of food coloring and no taste. I suggest them to stop adding coloring in veg dishes.
The food was very good here! Super flavorful and very well seasoned. I will definitely return. I would recommend the tikka masala for sure!

The food was good, but the staffs weren't that friendly. We ordered samosa for appetizer and he brought pakora to the table. Maybe they thought that  we didn't know, but FYI that we spent 3 months traveling in India so we know what is the different between pakora and samosa.   He didn't even bother to ask how was our food, sad that they don't value their customers.

I used to enjoy eating at curry corner until now. I was in the middle of eating and I pulled a long brown hair. This is so disgusting. I will definitely not be eating here again. I wasn't able to finish my meal, I? threw everything away, I had ordered the food through post mates so I wasn't able to talk to the manager at the moment. I would love for someone to reach out to me to see how to resolve this issue.

One of the better cheap, casual indian restaurants.  Only complaint is their service is very iffy.  Sometimes we have a waiter who has to ask several times what we ordered and they even forget items you've ordered.  If the service was better, I'd be here more often.

This was a tasty surprise.  We ate here on a Saturday afternoon. Tikki masala fries were delicious.  I ordered the paneer tikki masala and although the flavor was good, I was a little disappointed  that I only had about 7 cubes of paneer. They were out of aloo nan but the regular nan was very good too.  I don't get to Tempe that often, but will consider this spot the next time I go.
Watched Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives and saw Currys Corner.  We just had to try it!! It definitely lived up to the expectations!  Food was amazing!!! Try the Tikka Masala Fries! Outstanding!!!

Good price, good portions and good flavor. You know it can be wrong if a lot of indians go have dinner there. Go wild and order things you haven't tried (forget the names that ring a bell).  I can't remember the names of what we ordered, but it was really tasty. Now they have a larger place with more tables.
Most of the times the food is good. sometimes you get unlucky they give you old stock. Which is really bad for our health.

This has quickly become one of my fav restaurants in Tempe. The chicken tikka masala is excellent! We also enjoy the mixed sizzler and hummus. We've tried a couple of other dishes, but the aforementioned are the go to dishes. I hesitate to give 5 stars because of the service. It's slow and most of the time inattentive. You will have to keep getting your servers attention the whole time. If you can live with this, the food is worth the experience, just go into it without high expectations on service. If the owner is there, which seems to only be on the weekend, the wait staff miraculously will slightly improve.

Passing through Phoenix on a road trip and I went here because it had a good review online. Great samosas! My server recommended the chicken special of the day and it was excellent. He even gave me free garlic naan!
They serve decent food but the service is awful. The worst I've seen ever. I am not going there again. The waiters are too dumb to remember the order that we placed and this happened many times.

If I was going to review based on the food I would give it 5*, based on the service I'd give it a 1*.  We walked in an hour before closing and were told at least 5 times that they were closing.   Every one who came in was seated in one corner so it was loud and chaotic.  We had to ask for plates because they were in such a hurry to leave they couldn't be bothered actually waiting on the tables.   The food was really outstanding but I would only do take out if I were going to go there again.
They have a great variety of non-vegetarian food. But the vegetarian options aren't great. They use too much of color in the food! And the naan (bread) is always too hard.

Food is as good as ever, but we are docking another star because of the service this time. We came in a bit after dinnertime, and it turned out to be pretty full despite the late hour. We ordered a straightforward meal, but either the server or the kitchen got confused and didn't communicate. The waiter was nice and listened when we told him we didn't get our naan but it still took forever because everyone was confused. We don't know whose fault it was but when they finally figured it out they brought it to us as we were finishing so we had to wrap it up and take it home when we wanted to eat it WITH our meal. Even after all of that, they didn't pay attention and overcharged us and added an entire entr√©e that we didn't order into our check. So we had to walk back in and have them refund us and we had to pay again. Needless to say, we were exhausted at the end and didn't have the usually pleasant experience we were expecting.
I love the vegetable daal they serve. Simply awesome. I like the food. Just that service is less because of 2 or 3 staff. But they are good and cordial. Great for students as it has affordable price.
Awesome food loved it.......! Worth spending Chicken biryani was so good and spicy. The ambience and serving were good. If you are near Tempe definitely try it.
Hi I went to this place today for dinner.the lady welcomed very well.i ordered shami kabob (also known as seek kabob).it was so delicious.mango Lassi was simply superbbb.recommending to try.
Lives up to expectations. The chicken tikka is best I've had. Naan is amazing. Owner is so nice and always there. Atmosphere is a bit underwhelming but once you get your food you don't mind at all.

The first problem we had was upon entering the restaurant. All the seats are weirdly situated and there is no hostess or sign that says wait to be seated. All the tables and chairs were located either too close to a bathroom or too close to the kitchen since it is such a small place. The table configurations were also weird with one booth that had two tables. So imagine a normal booth and on each side there is one person and a table in between. Now imagine the same thing but with two tables in between making the distance between you and the other person twice as distant as before.  When I looked around the place it looked filthy and I did notice a fly that kept flying around, which is not something I want to see or deal with when I'm eating. The paint on the walls was brown which I can only imagine is there to hide the grime. I wonder when the last time was that the whole restaurant received a good cleaning. From the attitude of the waitress, I am doubt it has been recent. Additionally, the service station is visible and there was a tacky sign that said "EMPLOYEES ONLY" for the kitchen -- of course it is employee's only.  We had horrible service. Our waitress acted like she had somewhere better to be. She also ignored us when it came time to pay the check which we waited forever for. We tried to flag her down but she wouldn't look at us and literally walked out the front door -- doing who knows what -- only to return 15 minutes later!  I had the tandoori chicken. Overall the food was very bland; I wonder if there was salt and pepper used in the making of it. It all seemed pre-cooked. The sauce that it came with was okay. Parts of the rice seemed undercooked. It was like good rice mixed in with bad rice. The rice should be the same consistency throughout. When we got our coke it tasted like it had root beer in it. I wonder if that was because it literally had root beer in it or because the soda dispenser is not clean.   My clothes smell like curry which I could overlook had the place been good.  To the owner or manager who has been replying on all the bad reviews: don't bother doing that on this one. Just take ownership of the criticism and fix the problems. Stop trying to live off your old successes of being on a television show; there are obvious problems with reoccurring themes which you should clearly be able to see from the amount of times you've had to comment on bad reviews. You really need to call Restaurant Impossible.

Up until about 8 months ago I have never had Indian food, but since we have been here several times.  Everytime we come we try something new and Curry Corner always delivers.  It's a cozy little family owned restaurant near ASS and it can be a little loud at times but so is almost every restaurant in the area.  The staff  is always polite and on top of everything.  The food is always the star anytime you walk through the door.

Excited to visit because heard a lot of good things about the place.  Went with about 11 people and the owner and waiter seemed irritated by our group.  Service was way below standard food was okay, but because of service I will not be back and would not recommend to anyone.

Found this place late on a Sunday night and was surprised it was open till 11. It was actually pretty crowded, too. Spoke with the owner, I believe, he was very nice and made us feel right at home.  The menu is on the wall, above the kitchen. So, if you don't know what you want, and can't see the wall from where you're sitting, then you'll have to go look.  They didn't have actual menus, but we didn't find that to be any big deal.    I had the chicken tikka masala with rice & added a garlic naan. It was SO fresh & tasty. My husband had the mixed grill and really liked his as well. We will definitely be back.  FYI - they are waiting on their new sign so it's a little hard to see, but they're right next to Club Tattoo.

Fantastic food. Had the tikki masala fries they were great. They have feta on them which i am not usually a fan of feta but on the fries with the sauce it was awesome. Had the tiki masala lamb entre and some somosas which were great. Bread was also well done. Service was a little slow but food was great. Good for kids no liquor license so you can bring your own booze. There is a liquor store in the same little strip mall.

I've tried indian and Pakistani food many times but this place it's gorgeous so dilish!!! Also it is Halal food, if you don't know what is halal mean just google it. Try the spicy makhani chicken with garlic nan, it's killing me . I recommend this place for every one. I know many people keep trying just masala but now you need to get something new like the makhani
Loooove this place. The chicken tikka masala and chicken magni never disappoints. Their naan bread (normal, cheesy and garlic kind) is delicious! Service is good. Food is very well priced.

I am so happy that I finally came down here from Northern side of Phoenix! Totally worth the drive!  First off , the website says they close at 10:30 , however don't let t fool you! They actually stop taking call orders at 10:30pm and they close their dine in at 10pm   Appetizer  Tikka masala fries with some Queso fresco Cotija cheese! No but for real, this was the first time in my life that I felt I was in a Mexi-Indian restaurant with the spices and the cheese part to the fries order!!! 10/10  Next up some tandoori chicken , I believed it was . Omg! The chicken was like rotisserie chicken but much more tender and flavorful !! 10/10 stars! Last but no least,  Lamb curry with garlic naan ! A M A Z I N G!!!  If you're a fan of Birria (Mexican goat curry) this dish is totally relatable ! It was too good!  Our waitress Gina was great! Loved how they were very welcoming and always being attentive !  Definitely will come back!!  Gracias paisanos!! Me siento como en casa! :D

My boyfriend and I LOVED Curry Corner. The servers were awesome and the food was amazing. We got:  Tiki Masala Fries - 11 out of 10 recommend Cheesy naan - warm, delicious, and perfectly cheesy beef hummus - yummy as well platter with different curries and meats - everything was very flavor and delicious

I'd never had Pakistani food before Curry Corner and now I can't stop! First time I came my friends and I split dishes (I always recommend this when trying new places). We tried the Tikka Masala Fries, the Goat Karahi, and the chicken Punjabi Handi.   The punjabi handi was the star of the show. Its the perfect amount of tomato and spice and heat and creamy. You HAVE to get it. (It was also featured on DDD)  The price is great. My only complaint is the service. I've been quite a few times where i've felt like service was reeeeaaallly unnecessarally slow. But im not sure if it may just be a bit of a cultural difference because I know that in many places staff should be signaled rather than stop by. Either way, the food is bomb, the price is great, & the staff is always friendly. Prob my fav spot in Tempe.

This place is awful! The chicken tikka masala is not flavored and it tastes like the sauce is Campbell's tomato soup. The tikka masala fries were soggy and luke warm at best. The service was lacking, and the place wasn't even busy! I would drive the .2 miles to The Dhaba and never look back! Best of Phoenix 2011, yeah right!
Seriously one of my favorite places to eat anywhere in the valley!  Try the Samosas, they are kind of addicting.

We know good Indo-Pak food (having grown up on Indo-Pak food gives us some credibility) and on our 1st visit, the whole group left raving!!  The Kharai Goat was finger licking good!  Seekh Kebabs were so flavorful!  The Afghani Boti was grilled to perfection.  The chicken tikka masala was ok.  And the mango lassi was so refreshing!!!  We will be back to Curry Corner for sure!! Worth the 30 min drive from So Chandler:)

Went after seeing the place on triple D. The food was very good but the portions sucked. The chicken tika and korma were both boned when should be boneless. No buffet for lunch and prices were good. I will give it another try in the future

Love this place. Unfortunately I'm not in Tempe as often as I used to be so don't get to eat here as often as I'd like. The tikka masala fries are awesome as is pretty much everything I've tried from here. Its very well priced compared to some other Indian places I've eaten. I'm giving it 4 stars because I do think there is some room for improvement. For the price its great but I have had better Indian food. Definitely recommend trying it sometime.

After watching an episode on triple D, my friend and I decided to try this location. So glad we did because we weren't disappointed! The garlic naan was delicious and so were the fries!! We also got tandoori chicken and and lamb tika masala. We ate every drop of food! We will certainly be back!

So far we have been waiting for 20 minutes and when they brought out food it was my husbands and I am still waiting for mine. So I am sitting here watching him eat. Who does that?  We were asked twice our drink orders and when I was telling him my order he was tapping on the table. Are you serious??  So far they are not impressive

I am very disappointed by this place. I eat Indian food at-least once every couple weeks. I decided to go here based on the show Triple D (Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives). Well let me say this place is high up on the dive end of scale and I will never go back.  I placed an order for take-out and ordered the Chicken Tikks Masala (my favorite), Matar Paneer, and Cheese Naan. I walked into the restaurant and there were only two tables taken. That should have been my warning to leave, but no... I said I will give it a try based on Triple D.   I pay for my order and head back to my hotel. No issue with service, I only walked in and picked up my order. I get back and sit down ready to partake on what I am expecting to be some good/great Indian food. This is where the disappointment starts setting in... :-(  I open up the soup container of Chicken Tikka Masala, and I notice something isn't right.. The Masala sauce is very loose, almost like they used skim milk vs heavy cream. So I opened the container of rice to add to it and I took a bite... no seasoning. Just bland white rice. No flavor of cumin, clove or cardamom, not even salt. I taste Tikka Masala sauce and it wasn't good, almost seemed like they left some important spices out.  I then proceeded to open the soup container of Matar Paneer. This was loose as well. I am really getting frustrated now. I take a spoon and search for the peas and a chunk of the Paneer (homemade cheese). Instead of Paneer, it tasted and had the mouth feel of tofu. Very disappointed. I closed up the containers of Chicken Tiki Masala, Matar Paneer, and rice and threw them straight into the trash.   The only thing that was good was the cheese naan.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, in fact in my opinion, it is a disgrace to Indian Food.   I have ate at one other Indian restaurant; Indian Place (Indian Delhi Palace - http://www.yelp.com/biz/indian-delhi-palace-phoenix?hrid=vLH0tzET4aC02gSgEAWkMw) in the Phoenix area, and I should have just went back there.

So good! I'm a vegetarian; got the veggie thali plate. Delicious, super-spicy garbanzos and dal, not so great spinach. Excellent value. Mango lassi tasted sweet, not mango-y. Split excellent aloo tiki appetizer. Husband said his chicken thali plate was also great. Wish they'd open one in our part of the country!!

We had ordered the Chicken Vindaloo and the Goat Karahi. The sauces and seasoning was amazing. It was also nice to be able to have unsweetened raspberry iced tea as opposed to its sweetened counterpart. My only issue which is minimal at best was it was difficult to eat some of the goat chops because there were a lot of small pieces of bone stuck to the meat I was trying to consume. Other than that, pretty delicious.

Loved the food here went for the first time about a month ago and went back again about 2 weeks ago. They have pretty good prices, clean and friendly staff. If you have never been before and are not sure what to order I found that there online menu has pictures which is really helpful. I wanted to get what I got the first time but I didnt remember the name and was not very good at explaining what it was so I ended up with something different, but it was very good too.

I went back here to try again after my disappointing first attempt. This time I was very pleased. The food was excellent and the portions on the lunch combo were perfect. I'm really glad I tried again, this place will  become a regular for me!

Found this place on here about 6 mo ago and have gone twice, really enjoyed it both times.  Service has been very good both times, drinks stayed full (it is semi-self serve, so ymmv), and food came out piping hot.    The food:  The girlfriend and I like to get samplers so we can try a wide range of food, both times we got 1 non-veg, and 1 veg combo.  I highly recommend that to a) people looking for variety and b) people looking for leftovers.    The first time we went we saw these incredible looking fries come out so it was a must order the 2nd time through.  The Tikka Misala fries were very good.  I feel like the menu said feta but we got blue cheese.  It was still very delicious.  The only thing I would enjoy more would be more naan to come with it,  I know I could order more but I am too busy enjoying the deliciousness.    Have been looking for a reliable option for this kind of food nearby and I think I've found it.  Can't wait to try more of the menu.

I know this restaurant has been on TV and is quite famous, but not anymore. The quality since the TV show has drastically reduced. The service is below par. The decor looks stale and dirty as though there is no life. However I got to say that the food is better than any Indian restaurant that I have tried so far. Really good spices in every dish. The flavors are strong and balanced. The quantity is on the higher side so order accordingly. All said, it's better to take Todo order and enjoy the awesome food at home.

After giving this restaurant numerous chances to redeem itself, I finally give up. The portions are super small compared to other South Asian restaurants, it's over priced, and has really inconsistent food. Last time we went our naan was burnt and Chicken Hara Masala tasted bitter. I was super disappointed. Another time I went I was waiting at the counter for 5 minutes because the cashier was too busy on his phone and was completely ignoring me. I really don't get why it's always so busy in there. There are way better restaurants near by. Only reason I used to go was because it's the only halal place near by. Will definitely not go ever again.  P.S. if you are in the area go to Moroccan Paradise right next to Curry Corner. AMAZING and halal

I visited this place last night with a mate after otherwise unsuccessfully attempting to eat other places. I am glad, considering this place is great.  We shared a vegetarian thali and samosas. It came with yogurt, gobi aloo, masoor dal, palak paneer, chana masala, onion, rice in the centre, and naan on the side. We asked for extra naan. Their naan was quite fluffy and thick compared to other places that I have eaten from, or especially when compared to grocery market purchased naan. All of it was very flavourful. I was really impressed with the spices on the chick peas, especially. Their palak paneer was a very smooth combination of the paneer and spinach flavours. The gobi aloo's identity eluded me at first because i had trouble figuring out that the cauliflower on top was upside down. The spices did not overpower the buttery nature of the cauliflower and were well accented with potato. Neither of us are onion fans, and both of us prefer our yoghurt sweet, so we took no liking to those small sides, although they were obviously less important than the curries. The masoor dal had an appealing milkiness to it. Their samosas were extremely good, with no lack in filling. There was nothing above mild spiciness on our plate, which was of no consequence to either of us as everything was hugely savory.  As far as the eating environment inside, the place is quite small and it seems to be in an otherwise relatively suspicious lot. I found it cozy. They do not wait on you. The menu is right above the order window. They do bring out your food to you, so there is no need to pick it up. They will do take out. The staff are all very friendly. You serve yourself water from a small stand with cups and pitchers. The minimal decorations are pretty and not overbearing, although most of Curry Corner's atmosphere seems to come from its customers keeping the place busy.  I ordered mango lassi on the way out. It is thicker than most I have had and instead of being blended with ice, it has ice cubes in it to chill it, but it was still delicious. It also lasted overnight in the fridge and still tasted good the next day.

Food is excellent but every time the services is slow even with an empty restaurant. The past few times they have messed up our orders. If you can put up with the service and waiting then the Lamb tikka masala is really good.

Curry Corner 1212 Apache Blvd Tempe, AZ 85281  I heard about Curry Corner from a friend who said that they heard about it on Food Network and that it was supposed to be fabulous.  I arrived there at 11:00, only to be told that they don't open till 11:30. No problem to wait and observe that they are currently under construction as they expand to two more stores next door.  Promptly at 11:30 the door opened and I was invited in. The current location is on the smaller side and being under construction is not what I would exactly consider to be highly inviting, however, taking this into consideration, I evaluated only on the food and service.  First on my order list was garlic naan. It came to the table still hot, bubbly and flakey on the edges and chewy in the middle. It was fragrant with the aroma of garlic.  Next, came a bowl of karahi. A dish composed of goat, slow cooked in ginger and spices, onions, yogurt and tomatoes. I love spicy food, and asked for it to be made that way, and the cook happily complied. The dish was excellent and filled with lots of meat that was beautifully tender. I was given a choice of it being served with rice or with naan, and as I had already ordered naan I opted for the rice which was perfectly cooked.  Service was reasonable and the tables were clean.  I am looking forward to coming back after the construction is finished and trying a much larger selection of dishes.  For the time being, I will give them 4 stars for the excellent food.

The food quality is good, but not like the old days when I used to come a lot. The amount of food is decreasing especially for the rice. The new waiters need to not forget the customer's order. Overall, it's still good.

I will give Curry Corner as five stars out five stars. The food is always good whatever I tried any of them, one of the reason is maybe I'm the Indian food lover. Although there are some of disadvantages like unclean restroom, the slow calling for waters, Curry Corner is definitely the good place to go if you like Indian food or spice food. The final suggestion, if you don't know what to order, the Chicken Tikka Masala always a good choice.

People have to stop judging Indian restaurants by how they make Chicken Tikka Masala or any Tikka Masala for that matter. Yes, Chicken Tikka Masala is an Indian dish but it is not the only Indian dish. Hell, it's a north Indian dish that seldom gets any attention in other parts of India.  I choose Curry Corner over other Indian restaurants in this area because of its positive reviews. I ordered a Lamb Biryani and a Chicken Curry to-go was told the order would take 15-20mins. So I sat at one of the tables and patiently waited. The place was not busy and almost everyone who came after me got their food served while I was still kept waiting. Finally, after more than 35mins of waiting my order was ready and I was told the Lamb Biryani usually takes time to prepare. So I thought maybe Biryani was worth the wait.  Initially the Biryani looked good but when I started digging into it was when I realized how badly it was prepared. The Biryani was just rice mixed with some curry and a few hard-to-chew lamb pieces thrown in. Trust me, it tasted awful. I simply don't understand why some Indian restaurants have this compulsion to include a Biryani on the menu when they don't know or even have the faintest idea about how it is prepared.  And as for the Chicken Curry, it tasted OK; nothing great - just mediocre.  Curry Corner is another Indian restaurant serving mediocre Indian food to susceptible locals. What a shame!

I had the chicken tikka masala w/ rice and garlic naan.  All of it was very good.  Nice spice to the sauce.  It was very filling but I wanted rice AND naan so ordered it extra.  I would go back again for sure.

This place is obviously understaffed. When I walked in, out of 10 tables, one had food. Tried to order to go, another couple behind me walks in behind me, and they get served first. Made contact with the one waiter working his tail off. Menus were fraying and caked with grease. I gave up and walked out. It's a workday, I don't have the luxury to wait on a poorly run restaurant.

We made a special stop here before leaving Phoenix after seeing them on triple D.   They had large portions at a good price. The food was delicious.  The reason this is not a 5 is that my husband's goat karahi dish had many many bones in it. (We counted over a dozen). He actually cut the inside of his mouth on one and was bleeding. These were not large bones that would be easily eaten around. They were small, somewhat chopped pieces of bones that were dangerous to be served. They could have easily been swallowed.  We would actually return, as we are hoping this was an anomaly.

I have been to curry corner before but i was waiting to try their Tandoori chicken Tikka (which was featured on food network) before giving them a review. We walked in today for a late lunch,the place was almost full and people kept coming in,they also had a large number of pick up orders.  We settled on a cozy booth and ordered ~Tandoori chicken tikka (marinated Thigh and leg of chicken,charcoal grilled) $8 ~Chicken reshmi kebab (chicken marinated in garlic and ginger paste,cooked in tandoor) $8 ~Non vegetarian Thali (rice,naan,dal,two types of chicken curry) $8.75 ~Lassi (salted yogurt) $2.25 ~Soda $2  The thalis are not available for take-out. All tandoori items are served with Rice or naan,mint chutney and pickled onions. They also serve Sindhi biryani here which is a little different from what you would typically get at an Indian restaurant (Hyderabadi/Andhra style).The biryani is nice,flavorful and has a subtle hint of whole spices.I am not a fan of the salted lassi (i was expecting it to be buttermilk). The tandoori chicken is definitely better than a lot of other restaurants it's moist and tender but lacks flavor. The service is a little slow and it took the food a good 20 minutes to get to our table.  Overall i would give curry corner 5 stars for affordability but 3.5 stars for taste.  Cheers!

I'm been to the Curry Corner in the past and loved their naan bread. I made a curry dish and went there to get some naan to go with my meal. I also got an order of hoomus which came with naan. I paid and included a tip, but when I got home I found out I only had one piece of naan and a small bowl of hoomus. There was barely enough bread for the small hoomus and not enough for the meal. There are a lot of Indian restaurants in town that don't cheat people, I won't be going back!

My husband couldn't stop raving about this place after we dined here. Indian food is one of his favorite cuisines so that should tell you how good it was here. It was really busy on a Friday night at 8 PM. It took a little time to be seated, but you can tell everyone was working very hard.  Food: 1) Tikki Masala Fries - so good! It's a great twist on a classic American side dish. I wasn't hungry, but I couldn't stop picking at it! The topping was addictive! 2) Chicken Makhani - recommended by the owner. It was creamy with a kick and they gave a lot of chicken for $8. The naan was light, crispy yet fluffy, and not overly oiled. It went perfectly with the makhani.

Definitely thought I had reviewed this place before. But I guess not...  I had tried their catering before, and it was pretty good. So I decided I would try their restaurant food.  Bad idea. I ordered chicken tikka masala and got chicken tikka soup. The masala that was there was super watered down, and the chicken was a mix of white meat and brown meat, some of the brown meat was so tough that I had to leave a few pieces of the chicken uneaten. The naan was really good, but the chicken tikka masala was very sub par. To make matters worse, it cost a whopping $7. When $7 gets you much more food at other places, I doubt you are going to venture back here. I suppose it was worth a try, but its not worth the return.

Curry Corner is definitely NOT curry in a hurry! We entered the restaurant and were told to sit wherever we wanted. So, we took a cozy little corner booth since we were at a Curry Corner. It took some time for a server to come by, and we ordered a wrap and the vegetable thali. After another stretch of time the server came by again saying they didn't have the wraps available today. So, the chicken keema ended up being the alternative choice.   It took a loooong time for our meals to get served to us, but they did look delectable. My vegetable thali plate had lentil/dal, spinach/palak, vegetable handi, chikpeas/chole, with a generous heap of rice and a piece of freshly baked naan. I enjoyed all the dishes on my plate and the naan was a good balance of crisp outer layer with soft inner portion. The rice was well cooked, nice and fluffy. I also had a bite of the chicken keema which seemed a bit bland to me.   I had asked for a soda but since service was nearly non-existent and I was doubting I would even get any refills if I had gotten my drink we asked them to take it off our bill once we went up to the register to pay.   Since it took so long, I probably won't be back. I did enjoy the food but there are other Indian restaurants in Tempe with better service with equally tasty dishes!

I admit that I was drawn to this place because I saw it on Diners, Drive thrus, and dives several months ago. I added it to my list, but had yet to visit. Recently I had a weekday off work and decided that was the day to go. They open at 11 and I arrived about a quarter past. The parking lot was empty at that time and I was unsure they were open. I went inside and I was the first customer of the day. The lady in the dining room was very nice and asked about drinks right away. The menu had a lot of good looking items, but I wanted to try something different. I asked about the nehari noor jehan, which was a dish from Pakistani. I didn't know how to pronounce it so I just pointed and said that one. She said it was very good. It arrived fairly quickly and came in a large dish with the marinated boneless beef and another plate with rice. She brought a third plate for me to combine the two. A lot of dishes for one person, but I wasn't washing them so I didn't mind. The plate was excellent. Great flavor, the beef was very tender, and the sauce was great. It was also a very large portion. If my wife would have been there we could have easily shared. As it was I left full and had almost a full box to take home. As I was there the place began to fill up as it moved closer to noon. I would definitely go back and try something else or even stick with that dish again.

Curry Corner is one of my favorite all time places to eat! Their Chicken Tikka Masala is the only thing I ever order. The garlic naan bread pairs very well. I am sad I no longer live in the valley to enjoy their food.

After leaving the last review, the owner contacted me apologized and invited us to visit again. We have not go yet, but I will give a 5 start for their positive attitude  :-P I respect business owners that take their customer seriously.

The food, amazing, try the garlic Naan and if you are a meat eater the Tandori Grill sampler is amazing but I also love the curries as the sauce is amazing with the Naan and the price, extremely affordable - generally about $10 a person and you will leave full. I was actually recommended to try this out well before it was showcased on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. It is a culinary jewel right off of the light rail line.

Sure, the fishtank looks gross and the decor is far more shabby than chic, but nobody comes here for the ambiance. The FOOD, man, the food is incredible. There isn't a bad thing on the menu. The cheese naan is so wrong but SO RIGHT. The chicken tikka masala is on point, and the goat biryani is so tender and flavorful.

Cheapest place I've ever been to. Tap water for drinking , no soap in the restrooms (they use dish detergent with water added to it). Even the rice has tap water aftertaste. So disgusted. Won't recommend to anyone.

My main reason for coming here was the tikka masala fries - it sounded too good to pass up.  And like Russell Peters' standup comedy, these fries are TOOOOO GOOD.  Pictures do not do the tikka masala fries any form of justice because no camera in existence is capable of capturing the full spectrum of their awesomeness.  For only a few bucks you get a generous portion of delicious french fries SMOTHERED in tikka masala sauce, drizzled with some white yogurty sauce, and then topped with feta cheese.  OH MAN.  It was so good that I would be very inclined to make the 400 mile drive from LA just to eat those fries again.  I couldn't finish them on my own so I took half home, even though I was worried that they'd be soggy the next day.  But turns out, they were STILL GOOD as leftovers.  I swear, that tikka masala must be magical as both a goldmine of flavor and as a preserver of all that is goodness.  I also highly recommend the goat karahi.  So much spices and deliciousness in one dish, I definitely got the curry sweats afterward but it was SO worth it.  I can't even imagine how much spicier some of their dishes must be, considering the karahi wasn't even marked on the menu and yet it was able to sizzle my mouth adequately.  Didn't learn until a month later that the joint was featured on Diners, Drive Ins, & Dive's.  No wonder the TV was only tuned to the Food Network!  Definitely coming back here next time I'm in the area.  Hopefully Guy Fieri isn't there, since I can't really stand his face.

My favorite Pakistani place in the area hands down. As seen on the food network and even better than you'd imagine. Family owned business and authentic cuisine. I love the kabob platter here and really everything else.
This place is delicious...the service was great, well worth the wait, I had the Arabic plate, so much flavor definitely a must try!!!

If you're not Indian, expect bad service. 75+ yr old white haired Caucasian who asked for take out menu literally given only menus in Indian.  Lots of tiny bones in the goat Briyani. Very tasty but goat pieces small and had small bones = hard to eat.  'extra spicy' sadly is not.

I decided to try this place after searching for a good Indian place near me. There's quite a few options in Tempe, but since this place had good reviews I decided to give it a try.  Service was good and the prices were very good. I couldn't decide on what to get but the waitress suggested I try the Arabic Plate. It's not on the menu and has a few items on it. For $11 dollars its a lot of food. I opted for Garlic Naan with my dish. The Butter Chicken and Tikka Masala were delicious. The Hummus was good and the rice was tasty. The Garlic Naan was fresh and warm.   The service was good and the food was tasty. I will be back.
Price is reasonable. Very close to campus. Food is mediocre, lacks flavor and spice. Will not come back again

I love and hate Curry Corner.  Curry Corner has excellent food. I mean seriously great middle eastern and Indian food. The things I need however out of a place like Curry Corner are simple and not always met--quick service, good food, and most importantly a good take-out experience.  "Take-out experience? What the hell is that, Faraaz?"  It's several things for me, including the amount of food given when taking out versus when eating in. It's also the quality of the take out box material and strength of the plastic bag they go in. Also, if I choose to not throw away my half eaten meal for a week, take out experience includes the smell of old leftovers (refrigerated and left on the counter).  So yeah, I love and hate Curry Corner because the take out experience just isn't up to par. They seriously will give you almost half the amount of food on many dishes. Plus, it takes forever (which is okay because the food at least tastes really, really good). Everyone is all about the Tikka Masala, but they have many other great items that get overlooked. Branch out, order something you can't pronounce, and prepare to have a great meal at a great price.

I used to love this place. Recently they have been making far too many order mistakes (how hard is it to remember I want naan instead of rice?) and the service has been just awful. My boyfriend and I just left there without even eating. The guy who greeted us told us a moment to clean a booth when there were two other clean booths available, then went to "clean" it. He did absolutely nothing to the table, it was filthy. Then he came back and instead of walking us to the table, handed my boyfriend the menus and told us we could go. Ok. Fine.   We ordered a diet soda, water and a mango lassi. Took 10 minutes to get water and soda. We waited another 10 minutes and we never saw the waiter/greeter/whatever he was again. Got up and left. On our way now to another Indian place that hopefully has good service and gets out the right order.

Food is decent. Service always sucks. The waiter who is Caucasian likes to ignore white people when they come in. He talks to you like you are stupid. I woldn't mention it if it didnt happen every time we come here. Its the 8th or 9th time it happened.  They really need to be more attentive to their customers.

When I came here for the first time I thought I've found my place for authentic Pakistani food. But as I became a regular and tried different dishes I realized how wrong I was. They have renovated the place but have got downhill regarding the food. Even the restaurant area is not so clean and there's always food and stuff under the tables where the customers are supposed to have their meals. Disgusting. I can not even mention one food item that impressed me. Chicken tikka had a lot of color which even colored my fingers, nihari was tooooo salty, biryani was bland, chappli kabab was burnt and parathas didn't seem like parathas. Even the server never comes back to check on us once after taking the order. Plz management pay some attention to your quality of food n customer service. Otherwise u will b losing customers like me.

The food was great. The service was not. Not once did our order taker/server ask if we needed anything, and once I asked for a togo box.  I got a small container that I guess I was supped to put my rice, chicken, humus, and naan into. I had to ask for additional containers, as if. I feel as  though I cheated my for leaving a tip.... If u can, I suggest ordering to go !

This place is pretty decent. I wish I knew more about Indian food or culture to really enjoy it. But I don't, whatever.   Their naan is AMAZING. It's so flaky and buttery! My favorite of course. Their chicken tikki masala is on point. It has lots of flavor and is the perfect amount of spicy. So was their tandoor chicken tikki masala.   Their rice lacked flavor but it wasn't too bad with the other stuff.   I got this stew thing, which was pretty good but I'm not a big fan of lamb so if I had to get it again, I'd get beef instead.   We'll probably be back.

We were here on a business trip saw this restaurant on DDD thought let's try it !!! Got take out one night got a veg curry Palak panner and naan ,Palak panner tasted like boiled Palak with salt and red chills in it with old panner .  But we thought hey maybe there non veg would be better  We went to dine in the next night ordered a few different dishes also told the waiter that did not like the food last night he was like don't worry i here Food was ok I guess for the price  But spent the night vomiting I guess that's what you get!!!! This restaurant makes Indian food look bad, and Indian people with the way give customer service...  Sorry to say they even make DDD look bad  Will NEVER EVER GO BACK

I have made the trek to curry corner a few times from Glendale because it's worth the drive! I love the food, the best Indo-Pak restaurant in phx! I have never been disappointed by this place. I have tried multiple dishes and I'll try to keep it brief!   The chicken tikka fries were delicious and something new, worth trying! The samosas taste freshly prepared with what seems like homemade pastry. By far one of the best chicken tikka masalas I've ever had, a must try!!!!! I've also tried the lamb karahi which was delicious, the lamb was not tough, but this dish does take extra time so don't order if you're in a hurry! The afghani boti had so much delicious spicy flavor with lots of cilantro, the meat was so tender and juicy! The malai kofta was delicious not as heavy as I'm used to with a little more spice than normal, which was a nice change. The aloo mataar was a great vegetarian dish high on flavor! Of all the dishes I've tried there was only one I wouldn't order again, the nehari noor jehan. The meat was too fatty and there wasn't much; I think I had 4-5 pieces. Overall, I love this place and wish I lived closer to it!
Beef biriyani didn't taste that good. I didn't get a chance to try other biriyanis but the appetizers are great.

This has to be the worst restaurant in terms of hygiene. Two of my friends had food -poisoning after having dinner here. The food is just unhealthy with tons of oil floating on the top of curries, and I am not sure if any health/hygiene code is followed here.  The service is poor and the information on its website is incorrect, the owner does not allow dine-in after 9 or 10 even though it says that the restaurant is open till 11.   One night I saw the owner cleaning the place without gloves and she was nice enough to give us a to-go parcel without cleaning her hands (great example to the servers!). I had a peek inside the kitchen when the door was ajar, and it definitely looked dirty.  I have been a lot of hole-in-the-wall places around this restaurant, including Haji Baba, the Vietnamese place and others, but neither any of my friends nor I have fallen sick coz of the food. If you need a spicy-food fix, i strongly recommend you do not try this place, lest you want a visit to the doctor the very next day.
The shittiest food ever The biiriyani yuck Ghe butter chicke. Wtf was that water no gravy  Samosas they took 20 mins n they got us samosa which was not warm from inside Neverrrr go there

The food is excellent!  BUT;  it was very hot in restaurant, until it was packed then they turned the A/C down to make it comfortable.  The service was terrible,  couldn't get even ice water, and we were shorted an order of rice.

Lazy scumbags don't answer their phone. Really frustrating when you just landed and was trying to place a takeout order. Gave up after several calls well over 30 minutes prior to their published closing time.

Went on a Saturday at 6pm just alone , got seated quickly and staff were very friendly ( surprised at some reviews saying otherwise?)   Started with Chicken Pakora, this was the only let down of the meal. Some of the chicken especially small pieces were so overlooked and tough it wasn't enjoyable   Main Lamb Kahari , rice and plain Nan Bread. This was special, nice spice to it but not overwhelming, tasted so fresh and the lamb was cooked perfectly . Nan was also baked to perfection , just a bit crispy . A bit too much rice in relation to the main dish though ( not a complaint, just a preference)  Plan on going again   Dropped 1 star for the Pakora, everything else was class

I had a late lunch here yesterday (around 2:30pm) and my experience was not very pleasant with food and to a certain extent, service.    I ordered the 'Afghan Boti' reluctantly and because I was hungry and have spent 5 years in Afghanistan previously for work. Very familiar with Afghan food even though I had never heard of Afghan Boti before but ordered it under the assumption that it must be close to or similar to Afghan 'Dopiaza' based on the description in the menu.  The description could be misleading especially for folks who are familiar with Afghan cuisine.  Basically, it states "...white meat..." without specifying whether it's chicken or beef.  However, Afghan Dopiaza is beef chunks/cubes (with and without bone) that is slowly cooked and the beef comes out sort of whiteish...a common dish.  This was certainly not the case, they served me with pieces of chicken breast that was mostly RAW!!! I even showed it to the waiter half way through my meal, he was nice enough to offer to replace it but at that point I had lost my appetite.  Additionally, I think the cook just went postal with SALT! Oh my God, just WAY TOO salty just unbelievably salty!   I also ordered the Lassi (yogurt drink) and it was so thick that it made it almost impossible to drink through a straw.  So, I asked the waiter to dump half of it and put water in it so it can be real Lassi which is supposed to be thin!   I am sure other dishes are probably good but I don't believe that I will EVER order Lassi and the so-called Afghan Boti again.  Besides, can't expect an Indian restaurant to produce authentic Afghan dish.

Was at an event with a bunch of friends and decided to come here last minute. Tiki masala chicken was good and the garlic naan was ok. Mango Lassie was also good.  Place is smaller so we had to wait a while for table but we were so hungry we got it to go.  Pretty satisfied with this choice instead of a burger.

The food was good, the main problem was the service. The food was dropped off and that was it. At first I thought this might be a place I will come back to but after today we will not come back also make sure they don't over charge you as all the menu prices are different.  Also asked for a drink refill and it never came till we reminded them the third time.
Been here 5 times so far.   The curries is always tasty and  consistent,   Price is cheap, and the portions is huge.

They've got great tasting dishes. My favorite dish is the chicken tikka Masala, it's to die for. It's also priced very good and won't put a dent in your wallet. They don't have buffet but that doesn't bother me cuz they always serve fresh tasting food. This is my go to place whenever I'm in the mood for Indian food. Overall, I would recommend this place to any person who wants to try some authentic Indian delicious food.

Good food, great prices.  - The tandoori mixed grill was very good.  It's been a long time since I've had tandoori that was this tender with that tangy flavor that permeated deep into the meat.   - The chicken tikka masala was a little thin, but the chicken was tender and the sauce had a couple layers of flavor to it.  Smooth followed by a touch of heat.    - The chicken jalfrezi was a little too creamy, but the hot peppers and the green peppers gave it a nice flavor  - Although not really an IndoPak dish, the chicken hummus was really good as well.  Different than most hummus I've had in a good way.  More tangy and savory

Very nice hole in the wall centered in a strip of shops east of the campus. The servers were attentive and professional. I ordered the goat karahi with garlic nan and an ice tea. The goat was great. I like eating goat when it is offered in a place like this and it didn't disappoint. I took it as it came, and it had a nice flavorful spice to it but not overly hot. You need to pick up the bones and chew and suck out the remaining little bits of meat and juice. If this bothers you, don't get it. The nan was good too. A  good meal for 1 hungry person or very light for 2. The rest of the menu looked very good and people seed to be enjoying their meals. A medium sized crowd but it was early. The only thing that could have been better was the iced tea. Not bad, not great. I would definitely come back . The whole meal was $12 and change.

If you have just a bit of patience you will get really good food. My boyfriend had Indian food for the first time here and was not disappointed, despite him not liking spicy things particularly (the servers took note and suggested things with help from my Indian roommates).   I ordered the hummus which came with 2 pitas and the palak panneer, which was amazing and delicious. We all ended up not being able to finish our meals so we got doggy bags that sealed shut and a plastic bag.   It was also cool to see the Diners Drive ins and Dines spray paint stencil on the wall.

Curry Corner used to be one of my favorite Indian places, especially since it's close to ASU. However, the last time that I went, I felt so bad for the waitress. When we were checking out, she said how hungry she was because she isn't allowed a break (which I let her know was illegal, but I guess she needed a job). When we were going to leave a tip, she also let us know that the owner keeps ALL the tips and told us we didn't need to leave her a tip since she wouldn't see it anyway (we even tried to give her cash and she didn't take it).   I REFUSE to eat at Curry Corner until they treat their employees better!!! This is so wrong & I now understand other people's comments on the poor service they receive. If I was working there and was illegally denied a break and my tips were taken from me, I would have no motivation to provide quality service either (although this girl was great).

I have been looking for a good tasty biryani in the valley for quite some time now and this was the closest I could get ! The biryani is mildly flavored and the chicken was tender and spiced perfectly . The samosas here are the best  . Cozy little place with some good Bollywood music and yummy food !

Food was Ok.  Service was Ok. Our food came out at different times. Two dishes and naan... Then 10 min later the rice. Then five min later the other two dishes. The cheese cubes inside the paneer tikki masala was good, but the sauce initially tasted like speghetti sauce. The sauce looked different than the chicken tiki masala, which was spicier but tasty. The palak murg was devoid of any flavor but spiciness. Just mashed spinach in oil.

My wife and I went to Curry Corner this evening for our 18th anniversary. We chose Curry Corner based on a recommendation from a coworker who happens to be Pakistani. We live on the other side of the valley but often frequent restaurants on the East side. I have to say that Curry Corner was worth the drive.  The food and service at this restaurant was top notch. I ordered the vegetarian thali plate which was a combination of a few vegetable curries along with lentils (daal), basmati rice, yogurt and naan (bread). The curries were very flavorful and cooked well. The heat level was not too high but the waiter said they could be spiced to your liking. Next time! My wife ordered the shrimp tikka masala. Being a vegetarian I did not sample the dish entirely but I do admit I did taste the sauce. The masala sauce was flavorful, rich and not very spicy. I forgot to mention that we started the meal with samosas and a hummus plate. Hummus is not something I usually see at an Indian restaurant, but it was fantastic! It was served with their awesome naan. I have to say that the prices of this place were extremely reasonable. I really cannot wait until we can go back to Curry Corner. If you like Indian or Pakistani food, hurry up and head over to Curry Corner.

Food is good. But terrible service. Ordered on the phone but when showed up at the restaurant had to wait for a long time to pick up the food. They might tell you on the phone that it will take only 20 mins but when you show up 20 mins later, the food will most likely not be ready. And the sad thing is they don't even care that you are waiting.

I loved the tikka fries! They were amazing! Never tried any fries like it!  The chicken and goat karahi were good but honestly I cannot call it karahi. More like any old curry. It really wasn't the traditional karahi taste I was expecting from Pakistan. The look of it was not like karahi too. More like a korma in my humble opinion.  Still it was yummy. And if I didn't know what karahi was then I would think it was amazing loll. Yummy curry, but can't call it karahi ;-) I liked the goat karahi better than the chicken karahi.   The naan is always great :-)  Overall I love this place. Definitely happy to have them in AZ.
Delicious food, cramped spaces, just like India itself!

I originally saw this on Diner's Drive-Ins, and Dives and decided to put it on the list of restaurants to try in Phoenix. I have to say before that show has pointed me in the wrong direction, but I decided to try a variety of food I have never tasted before. I am soo glad that I did, this place was amazing, so much so that I literally told everyone about it and was there within a couple of days.  The third time was a little disappointing, we were forgotten a few times, and I totally get not having good days while waiting at tables. I've waited tables a majority of my life and some people on Yelp could really chill for a second and walk in a waitresses shoes; Just Sayin. Any how it was dead but they had been unexpectedly busy all day so I'm sure they were just beat. Any way I'd totally go back again, wish they had a location in Phoenix, if they did I'd support them more. Sadly the drive is way long for consistent visiting.

I just moved to Arizona and have been craving Indian food for months, but have had a hard time finding a place. I saw online that Guy Fieri(sp?) had been here so I decided to go. This place satisfied my cravings and left me stuffed. I had the veggie pakora which could have been a little more fresh and the tikka masala which was delicious. The waiter was really nice and talked with me for a while. I'll be back to try their fries!

Wow, what a great discovery... My friends and I came all the way from Glendale because we had heard a few decent reviews... But man.. I am more than impressed... we ordered our entree's.. and ordered more because it was amazingggg. we even had dessert and chai.. let me just say.. "epic chai" and "epic kheer" - their kheer and halwa (desserts) are amazing.... everything tastes great, very authentic and pakistani... and ridiculously cheap.. great deal for students or non students...   you will see when you get there how full it is... the busy restaurant is a testament of a great place... its definitely worth the drive. thank you for finally having a great Pakistani style restaurant... took me forever to find u guys! Love it. Cant wait to come back...

I have been here twice and both the times my experience has been decent. We tried their Mediterranean thali. Which is essentially called Mediterranean because they serve hummus with it. The chicken curries are decent. Not too bad but not great either. Food-Their thalis are decent. I dislike the use of food color though. They certainly serve some of the better indian food in town. Service- I believe they could really improve in terms of service. Sometimes the guy serving here comes off as straight off rude. Some of my friends have also faced similar situations with their staff.  Strictly food-wise it would be a 3.5/5 but service stands at 2/5 for me.
This place gets you seated and served super quick and the food is amazing! I always get the tandoori chicken, chicken tiki masala or the curry.  Great service, great food!
Curry is excellent, but they have recently replaced their old plastic containers with much smaller styrofoam cups. Same price, 40% less food. Beware if you order to go.

Down to earth place with friendly staff. Good portions too. Best chicken wings I've ever had. Nihari was ok. Tikka masala fries sounds better than it tastes. Overall good experience. They make u feel welcome and that matters. Will go again.

GUY FIERI! OMG HE CAME TO THIS PLACE TO EAT!  And that man sure don't disappoint, probably the best indian food I've ever ate! We started off with the tikka masala fries as appetizer. It was like chili fries but with an indian twist. I thought it was very interesting and was certainly delicious.  Later on I got the chicken curry while my babe got the chicken makhani.
