They were both delicious, but the best part was the fresh-baked naan that came with it.. We only ordered one serving but they gave us so many. They were perfectly crisp and yet moist so delicious.  If you are in Phoenix you NEED to come try this place out!
I liked the food yhats the reason came here. But server was too busy to attend  us. They need to hire more staff yo serve.

Hi,  I will explain why I am giving a 2 star review ! Food Quality is excellent BUT my reason of giving a 2 Star is pricing. Menu Prices on Yelp are different as to the Menu Prices in the restaurant. This is giving a consumer a false impression about the prices. I am serious, this is not right.   Message to the owner - If you think I am right then you should compensate me for the difference. I am willing to come back and order the same food but you should charge me per the menu prices on Yelp, if not, I understand but I am not coming back to your place.  Thank You !

It doesn't get much more 5 star for me. The service was superb. Very attentive and friendly; the food was better than anything I can get in the state of Utah, and the prices nearly blew me away BEFORE I GOT MY FOOD!  Once the food came everyone at our table was almost in dis belief at the quality for our dollar. The only negative about this place is how embarrassing it was to ask for the mountain of to go boxes because we weren't able to finish our delicious food that we refused to waste because it was so Devine.  Is this where I mention that I lived in India and know my Indian Food?? Lol  Don't miss this place!

I was suckered into visiting this spot by Guy Fieri and his show. I wanted this place to be good. My wife and I have eaten a lot of Indian/Pakistani food across the world, and I know I can't compare it to other countries. This was the worst representation of the respective cuisines. Before we talk food, let's talk service. We sat for 25 minutes without knowing who our server was or even being greeted after we sat down. My wife gave me sound advice and I ignored, bc I was wanting to believe the reviews and show. After, I blocked the server from passing me I got service. He hastily took our order then we sat for another 20min. before getting 1 of our 2 appetizers. Then 10 min. We received our food with our 2nd app. The samosas were ok, and masala fries were cold. The main dishes were rushed and tasted like they were straight out of a frozen food aisle. I highly recommend passing this place by if you want a good meal.

I ordered curry and wasn't totally impressed, especially since this is the specialty.  Both of friends had excellent meals, but mine was just OK.  They did allow us to purchase beer (or wine) at the liquor store next door and bring it into the restaurant.  That is a rare privilege in Arizona.  I will go back and may even try a different type of curry.  The place was packed and everybody else seemed to be enjoying their meals.

I love this place. Like I've said in other reviews, I'm a student, so I appreciate a deal. I'm also a foodie and have expensive taste, so I love when the three can come together on rare occasions, and bless me with great food!   I love Indian food, especially Pakistani and Punjabi. I'm still trying things on the menu but so far, the Chicken Tikka was flavorful, I wish I would've gotten their wonderful saffron rice with it, instead of the regular basmati, but saving money, it tasted just as great. The Aloo Palak, potatoes with saut√©ed spinach and spices was a great vegetarian meal and went perfect with rice and their GREAT garlic Nan.   I also had the the Goat Biryani and though I loath bones, the meat and saffron rice with the rendered fat from stewing made it worth the extra effort of getting through the many bones (that is to be expected with any goat dish at many ethnic restaurants and is part of the dining experience). Very well done dish.  Yes the atmosphere is laid back, but the owner caters to us college students and that keeps the cost down, I think they're the most reasonable Indian restaurant in the valley, that alone will keep me coming back. The service is good, laid back as well, the owner is very kind and attentive, again the food is great so I'll be back often, you should definitely pop your head in and start with some Nan and let your mind wander through the many choices..  They even have daily specials, like Halal Kung Pao Chicken one day...

This Indian food is amazing. So authentic and tasty. I constantly crave Curry Corner. If you like Indian food this is definitely the place to go. Great for college students because it isn't too expensive, but it is a great and filling meal. Would recommend to anyone who lives in the area or is just visiting.
Amazing chicken tikka masala, just as good as my favorite Indian restaurant back in Philadelphia. If you're near Tempe you should really try curry corner... And get the garlic naan.

I've been here twice in the last two weeks on the recommendation of my co-workers and ordered the same thing both times. They give you a ton of food and it's really good. You can easily get two big meals from a single order or the biryani and the naan is excellent. Check this place out. I took out both times so I have no idea about the service, so bear that in mind.

This place doesn't disappoint!  Our favorite Indian restaurant!  We drive 45 mins to eat here. Our favorite dishes are to start, the tiki masala fries.  (I dream about these!) The garlic naan is to die for.  The tiki masala and butter chicken are top notch.  The owners are kind and friendly.  We  this place!!

Yuck. Ordered a bunch of takeout and it was awful. Vegetable Handi swimming in a vat of oil. Flavorless Dahl. Soggy undercooked fries. The plain basmati rice was the best thing I ate. It's all going in the trash, and I hate to waste food.

Remarkably good food (two tikkas), promptly served, hot and tasty, and far from eye-poppingly expensive. Our server was a delight -- attentive and helpful without being a hoverer. I promised him a stellar review, and this is it.

We already had a bad experience with vegetable thali served at this place. One of my friends told me its somewhat revamped and apparently the food quality has changed and it tastes much better now. Nothing like that, on the contrary its has worsened.  We ordered mango lassi, paneer tikka masala(comes with naan or rice), garlic naan, tawa parantha , and veggie biryani. They couldn't serve the biryani cz they were out vegetables (whaatt!!! ) . So we ordered malai kodta with rice instead.   Ok lets not talk about authenticity and getting that real taste with the proper ingredients with almost all the reataurants claiming to serve Indian food here in Tempe. I 've made my peace with that long back. But then this place surprised with how pathetic their food quality and taste can be.  The paneer and kofta were served with the same curry base which felt like someone just opened a tomato paste can. added some random spices and served it with paneer and kofta. Wait, I am missing some important ingredient. I got up in the end to wash my hands , (restrooms!! lets spare them here) and this red color wont go off my hands. So they did have some artificial color added as well. We are also missing some surprise ingredient here which made out stomachs go haywire after having our dinner.  And btw the rice never came. Asked them twice. The cashier showed us the order slip and told that the server missed out rice so its not our fault=). He did correct himself and was gracious enough to give us a $2 discount.

A cozy Indian restaurant that serves several different types of curries and meats at a reasonable price. This place seems family owned and was featured on a Guy Fieri show, and they have a rather large display of him behind their cashier.   I came with over 10 of my family members and we tried an assortment of dishes. The Chicken Tikka Masala was pretty average- it was a tad too spicy and I thought served an unsatisfying amount of chicken. The naan bread was also only OK, I preferred it with garlic but found some pieces slightly burned. I also tried a bit of the mixed tandoori grill and there was barely any flavor or seasoning, although the meat was tender. The best dish was a green curry lamb, which had good flavor.  This place is affordable and good for groups, but just standard in terms of Indian food.

Best Indian food I have ever had. The Chicken Tikki Masala was incredible. It would be 5 stars if the waitress hadn't been so apathetic. The food was worth the mediocre service though! I've found my new favorite Indian place!

Would love to give this place 5 stars but the service is just so bad here. However, the food is really great!! Our waiter though seemed to be taking care of everyone else but us. Keep in mind this place is very small and wasn't very busy so I don't see why we had to wait so long for any attention. Took about 15 minutes before anyone even said a word to us. Be warned you seat yourself when you come in here and drinks are self serve. Maybe if they had 1 or 2 more waiters working they would be able to handle the customer flow.
Best Indian food in Arizona by far!  My two friends and I met up for dinner here for the first time. We ordered hummus, tandoori chicken and I believe yellow chicken curry. Everything was delicious!

There is some yelp-star inflation going on in Tempe.  Curry Corner is a prime example.  We were really shocked at how bad the curries we had were, although the wrap was just OK.  The curries had the vibe that they had just come out of a can, and were quite flavorless.   We've tried a few Indian places, and so far the best Indian we've had in the valley is "Star of India" on Chandler Rd. in Phoenix (Ahwatukee).

Unfortunately, the lowest I can go is one star. If I could I would go lower I would. We went in to a restaurant with tons of open seats, no lines and a waiter that obviously not busy and gave us a few glances but no assistance. We awkwardly sat ourselves waited for someone to get to us, and they never did. So we quickly decided to go next door.

I don't understand why everyone loves this place. I went in with high hopes because of all the great reviews and recommendations from friends. We walked in, the place was totally empty and no server in sight. No music just a TV playing the food channel. After an awkward silent min a server comes out the back. Our server was totally awkward.  When the food was ready he literally brought one thing out at a time. The food was soooo boring. The blandest Indian food I have ever eaten. Maybe it's just the vegetarian items that is so tasteless?
The food was ok, nothing special. The service was kind of ok.  My experience: if u are going special night out, this won't be a great fit..

I used to go there and think they r the best! Lol even the daal cost like 7.5 dollars which should cost like 3 I rather have ramen and noodles at and goat feet at Chen's Noodle house or Fleming Dragon ! Even a plate of gyro and rice costs like 10 dollars at Shawrma Paradise! Their Birwani rice is made with colors on the top of white rice, it's not real spices, if you wanna have real thing! Then go to Tasty Kobob, Istanbul Cafe was great sadly they r no moreee!  Curry Corner has a lot of fake items on the menu!

Went here because I saw it on triple D's, the food was excellent! Had naan and hummus to start, nothing too special but I love naan and hummus. I had the tandoori chicken tikka and my husband had the Afghani boti. Both came with some sort of cilantro lime rice and some kind of spicy onions which which was absolutely delicious! The tandoori chicken was sooo flavor packed and cooked to perfection!  The afghani boti was really good but not my favorite.  Service was friendly but really slow, I kept thinking they forgot about us. The tables were dirty and the lighting lacking. Overall, really great Indo-Pak food, highly recommend if you have a lot of time to eat!
No clean and average food. Non-vegetarian Thali is waste of money.   Id you want to taste good India food I don't suggest here

The Curry Corner hits the spot every time! They have excellent quality food, and pricing is also very reasonable! Portion sizes are above average & if you leave here still hungry, it's your own fault! The curries, masalas, kormas are all spiced perfectly & balanced. The mango lassi was cool, creamy and refreshing & I find comfort in the warm, inviting atmosphere. The service is quick, polite and attentive. I have loved everything I have ever had from the Curry Corner, & you will too!

Loved the food here, great flavor and good portions. I especially liked the biriyani, it was quite different from what my Indian palate considers as biriyani, but nevertheless it totally hit the spot on many levels. I would go eat here over and over again.
Great Tandoori Chicken.  The garlic naan was really good too! The server was much better. He was a big guy, disnt know his name but the friendly sevice and gteat food gets them a 5!

I went here last week with a large group (6 people). We ordered 5 dishes including two orders of chicken tikka masala, goat curry, chicken achari, and palak paneer. Overall we all (including one friend who is Indian) thought it was not the best Indian food we have had....the tikka masala was alright, but wasn't as rich or flavorful as other tikka masalas I have had. I did not care for the chicken achari, but I have not had that before, so it may just not be something I like in general. The palak paneer was alright, but again, was somewhat bland. The goat curry, in my opinion, was the best thing we had. It had a lot of goat flavor (which I like), and was generally tasty. The meals all came with either rice or naan, but disappointingly, the rice was plain white rice (no spices in it like most basmati rices) and the naan was also plain. Still nice that it was included...which brings me to the reason this place is 3 stars and not 2....it is soo inexpensive! We each paid six dollars and change for all of that food....most places would be well over 10$ each, so that is worth an extra star all on its own. I probably wouldn't come here if you want amazing food, but if you want decent food on the cheap, this is your place!

The best Indian restaurant in Tempe! Curry Corner has recently expanded the size and refurnished the layout of the restaurant. The food is always great. I would suggest the non-vegetarian thali that offers 3 different types of curries, rice, yogurt, and plain naan. This will fill you up!

So we came here on our lunch break because we wanted to try something new in our lives... plus we heard great review about it since it was on Diners Drive Ins & Dives...  I've never had  any type of Indian/Pakistan food before so this was going to be quite an experience for me. We ordered the Tikka Masala Fries which were bomb.com. The sauce on it was reallyyyyy good. For the entrees we got the Mixed Grilled Sizzler and the Afghani Boti. Everything was a bit spicy for me since I'm a wuss when it comes to that stuff. lol. I liked the meat in the Afghani Boti and the sauce that it comes with.   The service... was extremely slowwwwww... It took maybe 20 minutes before we even got our waters. We ordered the fries as an appetizer. Which never came out. They ended up coming out with everything else. Other then that it was quite an experience. I might come back if I'm ever in the mood for something different in my life again. =)

Very kind staff! Also very knowledgeable and helpful about middle eastern food. I asked the server to give me the most unique, farthest possible from the US middle eastern item, and the man helped me choose a "garafe" or something written like that. It was lovely!

Eat here. Do it. Went here over the summer after seeing it on Diners,Drive-Ins,and Dives. No one else was there,totally foreign atmosphere where you aren't really sure if they understand what you're saying and you are kind of guessing what they are saying,which adds to the mystique of the place. Very polite server.Super cool decor. We ordered what Guy had on the show,Tandori chicken tikki,goat Karahi,and had the naan and probably some other stuff I don't even remember. It was all amazing,we were so impressed. Can't wait to be back in AZ to go feast here again!

They have a "help wanted" sign so they are short handed which made the service on the slow side. HOWEVER I still gave a five star review. The food was phenomenal! For considering themselves "fast-curry" the depth of flavor screams complexity. Thanks for a meal that even my 6 & 8 year old enjoyed!

I became a regular the first night I visited this restaurant. The Arabian platter was always my favorite go-to, it offers a great sampler of different flavors. Tonight I tried the chicken jalfrezi, and sweet mother of Abraham Lincoln,  it was a life-changing experience.   Spicy, creamy sauce,  huge tender lumps of chicken,  onions and yellow peppers. I mixed in some rice and a drizzle of lemon yogurt, and it was eye-rollingly, mind-blowingly spectacular. I am ruined.

So went there today even after all the mixed reviews. Ordered Garlic Naan, Cheese Naan (more like a Naanadilla), Some kind of chicken wings, some kind of rice with specks of orange colored things and the grilled mixed meat which is there version of a fajita platter with 2 kinds of chicken, ground meat hot dog looking thing and grilled onions and peppers. Be warned however if you do not like cilantro, as tons of cilantro were on everything we ordered. The service was better than antipated, the dining area was clean and the food very flavorful. $30 for two people and we have a third meal sitting in the fridge for later.

First time here today ..saw this place on diner drive ins and dives ..it's a great find. The garlic naan was my fave we also tried the cheese naan it was ok. I had the mix grilled sizzler it was delicious. The chutney sauce was great! Definitely will be going back.

s/o and I decided to swing by this place after doing our touristy visits.  He wanted to come here so badly because apparently Guy Fieri featured this place (sure enough it was, as evidenced by ginormous photo of him plastered nearby the cashier wall).  We ordered the tikka masala fries to start, and while the fries were kind of on the soggy side, it was so addicting. We kept grabbing for them. The spice was good, must recommend!  I got the chicken makhani and it was SUPER DELICIOUS. the chicken was a bit dry but the flavoring and the spice was spot on. Went perfect with the naan or the rice. I've been to a lot of Indian restaurants and this definitely tops it, was so pleasantly surprised!  My s/o got the traditional chicken curry and he loved it as well. Said the flavoring was great and that it was spicy but not overwhelming.

This is a very good value for North Indian and Northwest Frontier Food.  The food is a cross between Pakistani, Indian, and Afghani.    The Boti Kebab is good.  My wife ordered the non-vegetarian thali.  The portions were huge!!  She liked it, and took the leftovers home.  My wife's nephew (from Vietnam) liked his chicken kebabs.  He said it was well prepared.    My wife says she will come back because of the great value.  The only drawback she had was that perhaps certain things were slightly salty for her.  That is why it is 4 stars and not 5 stars.

Worst food with worst service. They took the order then after half an hour the guy comes and says that out of all the food you ordered only one thing is available. As other places were almost closed, we had to order other stuff. After 30 mins food comes and it looks so bad, I cannot even explain. No combination of proper masala. Only 2 small chicken pieces in chicken curry.   One of the worst experience. Won't come here again ever.

Best curry I've had in tempe. My favorite is the Arabian Thali plate. I never feel sick after I eat here; I have a feeling they use good, fresh ingredients.   Customer service isn't always the greatest, but for the food and the prices I can deal :)

Great honest and delicious food! We've been there twice now and I can't wait to go back. We had the goat kahari, lamb kahari and a fish & shrimp kahari, my husband and daughters shared them. The favorite of both my daughters was the fish and shrimp kahari. It comes with rice and we added the garlic naan bread. I really enjoyed the spicy chicken biryani, it was a big portion and so flavorful I couldn't stop eating it. The restaurant is not very fancy, but we felt very comfortable and the service is friendly. The entire menu is great and so very affordable. I hope they never change!
First time trying these genre of food, and the price and flavor is incredible. Staff are kind, however they do not wear restaurant attire. Moreover, great place.

We ordered takeout from this place.  Based on other reviews, we were worried about the amount of food we would receive and if it would be packaged well, but we were pleasantly surprised that we received a normal amount of food and nothing was spilled or leaking.  The food itself tasted good, but it was just entirely too greasy and oily.  The vegetable handi we ordered was just sitting in so much oil.  The spinach curry and tikka masala were also swimming in far too much oil.  I did enjoy the texture of the naan, fluffy yet crispy on the bottom.  The samosas tasted nice but they did not provide the red and green dipping sauce, which is the best part of eating samosas!  Without the sauces it's just fried mashed up potatoes.  I will likely not order from here again, but I do not regret ordering from here, if that makes sense.  FYI tip for others - the medium spice level is really not that spicy at all. if you are looking for a bit of heat, go for hot!
The Chicken Boti Kebab is phenomenal--the chicken is tender and full of flavor, and it is served with great pickled onions and a delicious green sauce.

Love this place. One of my favorite place for Indo-Paki food in entire Arizona. Service is not the best but food is delicious.   We ordered Chicken Tekka Masala and Lamb Tekka Masala with Garlik Naan and Rice.  The chicken and lamb was done right and really delicious.   If you go with two people, order one main dish, rice and bread that will be enough for two people.

This is one of our favorite spots in the valley. I often crave their tikka masala fries. My husband and I both love the chicken tikka masala and chicken mahkni. The tandoori chicken is super yummy and we always get at least two cheese naan to go with our meals. The Arabian Thali plate is a great way to get a lot of yummy stuff together!

I was very disappointed with my order. I ordered 2 chicken tandoori, chicken archari, 1 garlic naan, 1 plain naan and 1 order of rice. I asked the server if he had put my order in right and I repeated my order to him before I paid for it. The server said everything was there. When I got home the order was wrong. I got chicken tandoori, chicken archari, but I got 2 plain naan and no rice. I was charged for the naans and rice when it comes with the meal. I tried calling them and it keeps on coming busy. This has not happened the first time. This is the second time it's gone wrong

I usually love the food but I don't recommend them when they are even marginally busy. Only half the tables were full when I arrived. It took almost 10 minutes of standing at the register to put in a to go order and it's been 40 minutes and counting and I still don't have my food. They said it would be 10 minutes. I asked about it at the 25 minute mark.  Ok update: 44 minutes. If I had known it would be so bad I would have gone elsewhere.
Very tasty curry. Amazing fries and naan. And I finally tried goat. I'd definitely make another trip when we are on that side of town!

I discovered Curry Corner recently when an Armenian cab driver I rode with, told me Curry Corner was his favorite restaurant and he eats there Thursday least once or twice a week.  So I ate there, once, about 4 weeks ago.  No white people were in there, which may be a good sign of authenticity.  I had a goat kahari dish, was good!!  Warning, when server asked me if I wanted garlic Naan or plain, or course I said garlic, but she did not tell me garlic cost extra over plain.  The owner took the extra off my bill, cos server did not tell me.  Owner told the server she mush tell people garlic naan cost more.  Nothing much on the menu was over $12.  Tandoori chicken looks good too.  This place is for all the Indian ASU  students to eat here for affordable price.  I will come here again with more people and eat family style.  Sept 15, 2017, I came here to eat again with two eating buddies.  Prices really went up from those posted here on yelp.  The menu was covered with little white stickers reflecting the price changes, I'd saty 20% more than the prices in the photos of the menus and the menu link on Yelp.  I had the mixed grill for $12.50 (two kinds of chicken and seekh kabab.  I told my server to make sure my chicken is not hard and dry .  When it came, it was still kinda dry.  The table next to me had grilled chicken too, and theirs was not as dry, they pried it open and showed me.  Wild Diner buddy had chicken mahani with the cream gravy - REALLY GOOD, I think she had the best dish.  I t hink I will have that next time.  Other Wild Diner had Nehari Noor Jehan, which she said was spicy!    The service was hit and miss from a tall white guy.  We even laughed, cos he brought water glasses without straws (people at other tables all had straws).  So one of us asked for straws, but later he brought only HER a straw.  i said i would like a straw too, and my other eating buddy said same, so then he brought us two more straws.  Later, he brought us more straws, like he forgot he already brought us straws.  My chicken pieces were really large and needed a knife, so I had to ask for a knife in order to not eat like a cave man.  I also had to ask for a spoon.    I think this second visit - food 4 stars (I tasted the other diners choices), service 3 (cos he was friendly and not rude otherwise it would be a 2 star), tho a bit hodge podge.    We arrived on a Friday at 6 pm.  At 8 pm, the restaurant was totally full of people, except one booth in the corner.  YOUNG people, mostly whites (as opposed to Indians).

The food here is amazing.  The authentic smell and limited menu make this place a real keeper. I've tried about ten things on the menu so far and I have no complaints. The servings are generous and the garlic naan is amazing!  Prices are extremely reasonable, generally a bit cheaper then other Indian restaurants in the Tempe area. The staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is inviting, I highly recommend this place!

Ordered takeout from them, staff was very nice however food was not ready within quoted time. Waited about an additional 10 minutes in the cramped seating area, food was great but sadly our order was wrong when we got home :/. Probably won't eat there again

This is the only Indian restaurant in Tempe that I go to. It is amazingly fresh and has a wide variety of authentic selections. Because of its popularity it is often busy and sometimes takes a few minutes to be greeted, however, this adds to the authenticity of the experience. I'm a vegetarian and there is a wide variety. If you like good fresh food, you can't miss this place.

Too good. The quality and quantity of food they offer for such low price is kind of fantastic. This is the only indian restaurant in Arizona where I ate stomach full and charged under $10. Even though the prices are low, the taste/quality of the food is better than many other Indian restaurants. In addition to the good food and ambience, the service is excellent too. They are pleasant, courteous and prompt. This is my new favorite.

Pretty good.  + Located in a strip mall next to a tattoo shop. Lots of parking, which is a plus. + Staff are friendly and restaurant is clean. - Bathroom isn't so clean. + Food is good, and not spicy if you have a sensitive stomach. I think it could have used more of a kick, though, to be honest. - Flavors are solid but maybe a little watered down. I'd have to try more dishes to really say for sure. + Chicken tikka masala is a safe way to go if you've never had Indian food. + Reasonable prices.  I'll be back.

I took my Mom here, she was visiting from Houston.   I've seen it on RED and have past it on the light rail many times.  It was really good!!!!  We got there right before the rush.  The waitresses were really nice and accommodating.  We loaded up on food...samosas, hummus, tandoori chicken took a, garlic naan wish we had room for more.  I can't wait to go back to try other items.  The chicken had a great flavor, the hummus was light.  I would recommend for sure!

My husband and I freaking love Indian food. We had a business trip in Scottsdale, AZ, and after watching Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives and seeing that Tempe was just 10 minutes up the road, we made it our mission to try Curry Corner. I had high hopes for this place to blow my mind.  We were served quickly, but the meal left much to be desired. We started with samosas which were really good. However the water they brought us tasted like it came out of a hotel swimming pool - very chlorine-y.   I asked if I could have tikka masala, except made with shrimp instead of chicken (usually an option at most Indian places). The server said he "would ask, but the cook is sometimes funny about stuff like that." I didn't understand how difficult it could be to put tikka masala sauce over shrimp instead of chicken, but I was ultimately served shrimp tikka masala. What a disappointment! The sauce literally tasted like Campbell's soup, or ketchup. Just plain tomato sauce. I don't know if this is some side sauce that was whipped up to satisfy my request for shrimp in place of chicken and just wasn't the normal tikka that is used, but I was pretty sad about the whole thing. Had I known it would so negatively affected my meal overall, I would have just stuck with chicken.  The rice was flavorless. Normally I can eat rice from my favorite Indian places plain, because it's so delicious and cooked with cinnamon, cilantro, cardamom, etc. The rice not only didn't taste seasoned, but it also took on the chlorine taste from the water. They would really benefit from installing a water filter in their restaurant.  My husband had chicken makhani which WAS really good. The cheese and garlic naan were also both delicious.  I wish I could give my experience a better rating, but it was ultimately a disappointment for me.

Casual, very casual, casual in many respects.  There is decent to good food here depending on what is ordered, and it comes out rather fast, and it is lower priced than most Indian restaurants in the valley.  But there are a few drawbacks to dining here.  Though you're paying a couple bucks less per entree, you're also in a not so clean place that has a lot of wear on it other than perhaps the newish large flat panel TV on the wall.  This was one of those times where I realized that maybe it is worth the price difference.  There was only one server for the entire little restaurant on our visit, so I can see how that was frustrating for the other table that was there before us but ordered after us.  The Mexican hot sauce (Cholula) on each table was an interesting observation.

Good authentic Indian food. Garlic naan is exactly how they make in India. Arabian Thaali has tasty chicken tikka and biryani. Punjabi Handi is another delicious option to try. Their lassis are also good esp. Mango lassi. The customer service is always good everytime I visit. The ambience is ok. The place is definitely worth the price.

The absolute worst service I have ever experienced in any restaurant ever. I can't believe that are still in business. Food is mediocre, and the service is the absolute worst. Being rude and ignoring customers must be in their employee hand book. If you hate people the the guy running the cash register does, get out of the restaurant business. Stay away from this establishment.

Really great food: the chicken tikka masala was spicy but not overpowering, and the meat was cooked perfectly. Lovely flavor! The mango lhassi was also quite delicious. The only downside was the wait. I had called ahead so the order would be ready, but when I showed up I still had to wait about 15 minutes. But they were really busy, which is a good sign, so maybe it evens out. I'm definitely going back!
I don't have curry all the time and I haven't had it in tons of places, but I went to Curry Corner when it was on Lemon and I hunted it down to find it on Apache, too. This curry rules so hard!

This place is normally good but there is this guy who works there and he's a total douche. It's like he hates his life so much that he takes all of his insecurities and puts them on you. I usually don't order takeout because there might be a chance I have to talk to this dude. Idk if he's mad or just a douche, but this guy make me never order takeout. "jeez dude, calm down"  I also had a hair in my food, so I don't eat there.  If you do go there you better hope you get the good staff and hope you get the curry from the hairless pot.

I got take out and just started eating a few minutes ago. I ask for no cilantro in my traditional chicken curry and there was cilantro. I also ordered tandoori chicken wings and it was raw but very burnt on the outside. Very disappointed.

I rarely go to Indian restaurants. But this is a place I love to visit often. The food seems as if it was done with great interest. When u go there, order anything with rice. They cook it to perfection. I like their handi dishes a lot.  If there is one thing I can suggest, it is that they should stop adding food coloring to some of their dishes. No need to guild this Lilly!

Hi got the vegetable Handi and it was good but there was hardly any sauce so it was hard to dip nan into it. Speaking with the waiter he didn't seem to understand what "vegan" meant - i guess that makes this place authentic, like you're actually traveling overseas.  The food was good though and the nan was the best i've ever had.  Very inexpensive too.  Very slow service and the environment is like a cafeteria. Again, very authentic.
Not terrible but far from great. Service is very poor and order was incomplete. No cutlery, no plates.  It is cheap but overall not worth it.
